But , very well , very well . Since [you]92-mr. bounderby are bent upon it , _ very _ well ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] So , [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom and [[his]75-tom daughter]345-his daughter took [Cecilia Jupe]76-sissy off with [them]635-them to [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge , and on the way [Louisa]91-louisa never spoke one word , good or bad . And [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby went about [his]92-mr. bounderby daily pursuits . And [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby got behind [her]636-her eyebrows and meditated in the gloom of [that retreat]637-that retreat , all the evening . CHAPTER VIII NEVER WONDER LET [us]638-us strike the key - note again , before pursuing the tune . When [she]91-louisa was half a dozen years younger , [Louisa]91-louisa had been overheard to begin a conversation with [[her]91-louisa brother]2889-her brother one day , by saying ‘ [Tom]75-tom , [I]91-louisa wonder’—upon which [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , who was [the person overhearing]3194-the person overhearing , stepped forth into the light and said , ‘[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa , never wonder ! ’ Herein lay the spring of the mechanical art and mystery of educating the reason without stooping to the cultivation of the sentiments and affections . Never wonder . By means of addition , subtraction , multiplication , and division , settle everything somehow , and never wonder . Bring to [me]91-louisa , says [M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild , [yonder baby just able to walk]3195-yonder baby just able to walk , and [I]91-louisa will engage that it shall never wonder . Now , besides [very many babies just able to walk]3196-very many babies just able to walk , there happened to be in [Coketown]4-coketown [a considerable population of babies who had been walking against time towards [the infinite world]3198-the infinite world , twenty , thirty , forty , fifty years and more]3197-a considerable population of babies who had been walking against time towards the infinite world , twenty , thirty , forty , fifty years and more . [These portentous infants]3199-these portentous infants being [alarming creatures to stalk about in any human society]3200-alarming creatures to stalk about in any human society , [the eighteen denominations]2929-the eighteen denominations incessantly scratched [one another]2898-one another ’s faces and pulled [one another]2898-one another ’s hair by way of agreeing on the steps to be taken for [their]2929-the eighteen denominations improvement — which [they]2929-the eighteen denominations never did ; a surprising circumstance , when the happy adaptation of the means to the end is considered . Still , although [they]2929-the eighteen denominations differed in every other particular , conceivable and inconceivable ( especially inconceivable ) , [they]2929-the eighteen denominations were pretty well united on the point that [these unlucky infants]3204-these unlucky infants were never to wonder . Body number one , said [they]3204-these unlucky infants must take everything on trust . [Body number two]3205-body number two , said [they]3205-body number two must take everything on political economy . [Body number three]3206-body number three , wrote leaden little books for [them]2929-the eighteen denominations , showing how [the good grown - up baby]3207-the good grown - up baby invariably got to [the Savings - bank]3208-the savings - bank , and [the bad grown - up baby]3209-the bad grown - up baby invariably got transported . [Body number four]3210-body number four , under dreary pretences of being droll ( when it was very melancholy indeed ) , made the shallowest pretences of concealing pitfalls of knowledge , into which it was the duty of [these babies]3211-these babies to be smuggled and inveigled . But , [all the bodies]3212-all the bodies agreed that [they]2929-the eighteen denominations were never to wonder . There was [a library in [Coketown]4-coketown]3213-a library in coketown , to which general access was easy . [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom greatly tormented [his]75-tom mind about what [the people]307-the people read in [this library]3215-this library : a point whereon little rivers of tabular statements periodically flowed into the howling ocean of tabular statements , which [no diver]3216-no diver ever got to any depth in and came up sane . It was a disheartening circumstance , but a melancholy fact , that even [these readers]3217-these readers persisted in wondering . [They]3217-these readers wondered about human nature , human passions , human hopes and fears , the struggles , triumphs and defeats , the cares and joys and sorrows , the lives and deaths of [common men]3218-common men and [women]574-women ! [They]3217-these readers sometimes , after fifteen hours ’[91-louisa] work , sat down to read mere fables about [men]3039-men and [women]574-women , more or less like [themselves]642-themselves , and about [children]643-children , more or less like [their]643-children own . [They]642-themselves took [De Foe]131-de foe to [their]642-themselves bosoms , instead of [Euclid]132-euclid , and seemed to be on the whole more comforted by [Goldsmith]133-goldsmith than by [Cocker]134-cocker . [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom was for ever working , in print and out of print , at this eccentric sum , and [he]75-tom never could make out how it yielded this unaccountable product . ‘ [I]75-tom am sick of [my]75-tom life , [Loo]100-loo . [I]75-tom , hate it altogether , and [I]75-tom hate [everybody]391-everybody except [you]100-loo , ’[75-tom] said the unnatural young [Thomas Gradgrind]75-tom in the hair - cutting chamber at twilight . ‘ [You]75-tom do n’t hate [Sissy]76-sissy , [Tom]75-tom ? ’[75-tom] ‘ [I]75-tom hate to be obliged to call [her]76-sissy [Jupe]76-sissy . And [she]76-sissy hates [me]75-tom , ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom , moodily . ‘ No , [she]76-sissy does not , [Tom]75-tom , [I]75-tom am sure ! ’[75-tom] ‘ [She]76-sissy must , ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom . ‘ [She]76-sissy must just hate and detest the whole set - out of [us]3221-us . [They]3222-they ’ll bother [her]76-sissy head off , [I]75-tom think , before [they]3222-they have done with [her]76-sissy . Already [she]76-sissy ’s getting as pale as wax , and as heavy as — [I]75-tom am . ’[75-tom] [Young Thomas]75-tom expressed these sentiments sitting astride of a chair before the fire , with [his]75-tom arms on the back , and [his]75-tom sulky face on [his]75-tom arms . [[His]75-tom sister]644-his sister sat in the darker corner by the fireside , now looking at [him]75-tom , now looking at the bright sparks as they dropped upon the hearth . ‘ As to [me]75-tom , ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom , tumbling [his]75-tom hair all manner of ways with [his]75-tom sulky hands , ‘ [I]75-tom am [a Donkey]3223-a donkey , that ’s what _ [I]75-tom _ am . [I]75-tom am as obstinate as [one]2846-one , [I]75-tom am more stupid than one , [I]75-tom get as much pleasure as one , and [I]75-tom should like to kick like one . ’[75-tom] ‘ Not [me]75-tom , [I]75-tom hope , [Tom]75-tom ? ’[75-tom] ‘ No , [Loo]100-loo ; [I]75-tom would n’t hurt _ [you]75-tom _ . [I]75-tom made an exception of [you]75-tom at first . [I]75-tom do n’t know what [this — jolly old — Jaundiced Jail]3225-this — jolly old — jaundiced jail , ’[75-tom] [Tom]75-tom had paused to find a sufficiently complimentary and expressive name for the parental roof , and seemed to relieve [his]75-tom mind for a moment by the strong alliteration of this one , ‘ would be without [you]75-tom . ’[75-tom] ‘ Indeed , [Tom]75-tom ? Do [you]75-tom really and truly say so ? ’[75-tom] ‘ Why , of course [I]75-tom do . What ’s the use of talking about it ! ’[75-tom] returned [Tom]75-tom , chafing [his]75-tom face on [his]75-tom coat - sleeve , as if to mortify [his]75-tom flesh , and have it in unison with [his]75-tom spirit . ‘ Because , [Tom]75-tom , ’[644-his sister] said [[his]75-tom sister]644-his sister , after silently watching the sparks awhile , ‘ as [I]644-his sister get older , and nearer growing up , [I]644-his sister often sit wondering here , and think how unfortunate it is for [me]644-his sister that [I]644-his sister ca n’t reconcile [you]75-tom to [home]336-home better than [I]644-his sister am able to do . [I]644-his sister do n’t know what [other girls]3227-other girls know . [I]644-his sister ca n’t play to [you]75-tom , or sing to [you]75-tom . [I]644-his sister ca n’t talk to [you]75-tom so as to lighten [your]75-tom mind , for [I]644-his sister never see any amusing sights or read any amusing books that it would be a pleasure or a relief to [you]75-tom to talk about , when [you]75-tom are tired . ’[644-his sister] ‘ Well , no more do [I.]0-i [I]647-a prig am as bad as [you]75-tom in that respect ; and [I]647-a prig am [a Mule]3228-a mule too , which [you]75-tom ’re[647-a prig] not . If [father]2723-father was determined to make [me]0-i either [a Prig]647-a prig or [a Mule]3228-a mule , and [I]0-i am not [a Prig]647-a prig , why , it stands to reason , [I]0-i must be [a Mule]3228-a mule . And so [I]0-i am , ’ said [Tom]75-tom , desperately . ‘[0-i] It ’s a great pity , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , after another pause , and speaking thoughtfully out of [her]91-louisa dark corner : ‘[75-tom] it ’s a great pity , [Tom]75-tom . It ’s very unfortunate for both of [us]651-us . ’ ‘[652-you] Oh ! [You]652-you , ’ said [Tom]75-tom ; ‘[652-you] [you]652-you are [a girl]653-a girl , [Loo]100-loo , and [a girl]653-a girl comes out of it better than [a boy]655-a boy does . [I]0-i do n’t miss anything in [you]652-you . [You]652-you are the only pleasure [I]0-i have — [you]652-you can brighten even [this place]656-this place — and [you]652-you can always lead [me]0-i as [you]652-you like . ’ ‘[652-you] [You]75-tom are [a dear brother]657-a dear brother , [Tom]75-tom ; and while [you]75-tom think [I]0-i can do such things , [I]0-i do n’t so much mind knowing better . Though [I]0-i do know better , [Tom]75-tom , and am very sorry for it . ’ [She]3229-she came and kissed [him]75-tom , and went back into [her]3229-she corner again . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could collect all the Facts [we]658-we hear so much about , ’ said [Tom]75-tom , spitefully setting [his]75-tom teeth , ‘[659-the figures] and all [the Figures]659-the figures , and all [the people who found them out]660-the people who found them out : and [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could put a thousand barrels of gunpowder under [them]661-them , and blow them all up together ! However , when [I]0-i go to live with [old Bounderby]100-loo , [I]0-i ’ll have [my]0-i revenge . ’ ‘[0-i] [Your]0-i revenge , [Tom]75-tom ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i mean , [I]0-i ’ll enjoy [myself]0-i a little , and go about and see something , and hear something . [I]0-i ’ll recompense [myself]0-i for the way in which [I]0-i have been brought up . ’ ‘[0-i] But do n’t disappoint [yourself]75-tom beforehand , [Tom]75-tom . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby thinks as [father]2723-father thinks , and is a great deal rougher , and not half so kind . ’ ‘[92-mr. bounderby] Oh ! ’ said [Tom]75-tom , laughing ; ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i do n’t mind that . [I]0-i shall very well know how to manage and smooth [old Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ! ’ [Their]3230-their shadows were defined upon the wall , but those of the high presses in [the room]2859-the room were all blended together on the wall and on the ceiling , as if [the brother and sister]3232-the brother and sister were overhung by [a dark cavern]3233-a dark cavern . Or , a fanciful imagination — if such treason could have been there — might have made it out to be the shadow of [[their]3230-their subject]3234-their subject , and of its lowering association with [their]3230-their future . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] What is [your]75-tom great mode of smoothing and managing , [Tom]75-tom ? Is it a secret ? ’ ‘[92-mr. bounderby] Oh ! ’ said [Tom]75-tom , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] if it is a secret , it ’s not far off . It ’s [you]75-tom . [You]75-tom are [[his]92-mr. bounderby little pet]663-his little pet , [you]75-tom are [his]92-mr. bounderby favourite ; [he]92-mr. bounderby ’ll do anything for [you]75-tom . When [he]92-mr. bounderby says to [me]0-i what [I]0-i do n’t like , [I]0-i shall say to [him]92-mr. bounderby , “ [[My]0-i sister]664-my sister [Loo]100-loo will be hurt and disappointed , [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . [She]664-my sister always used to tell [me]0-i [she]664-my sister was sure [you]75-tom would be easier with [me]0-i than this . ” That ’ll bring [him]92-mr. bounderby about , or nothing will . ’ After waiting for some answering remark , and getting none , [Tom]75-tom wearily relapsed into the present time , and twined [himself]75-tom yawning round and about the rails of [his]75-tom chair , and rumpled [his]75-tom head more and more , until [he]75-tom suddenly looked up , and asked : ‘[664-my sister] Have [you]100-loo gone to sleep , [Loo]100-loo ? ’ ‘[100-loo] No , [Tom]75-tom . [I]0-i am looking at the fire . ’ ‘[0-i] [You]100-loo seem to find more to look at in it than ever [I]0-i could find , ’ said [Tom]75-tom . ‘[100-loo] Another of the advantages , [I]0-i suppose , of being [a girl]653-a girl . ’ ‘[75-tom] [Tom]75-tom , ’ enquired [[his]75-tom sister]644-his sister , slowly , and in a curious tone , as if [she]644-his sister were reading what [she]644-his sister asked in the fire , and it was not quite plainly written there , ‘[75-tom] do [you]75-tom look forward with any satisfaction to this change to [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s ? ’ ‘[75-tom] Why , there ’s one thing to be said of it , ’ returned [Tom]75-tom , pushing [his]75-tom chair from [him]75-tom , and standing up ; ‘[100-loo] it will be getting away from [home]336-home . ’ ‘[100-loo] There is one thing to be said of it , ’ [Louisa]91-louisa repeated in [her]91-louisa former curious tone ; ‘[100-loo] it will be getting away from [home]336-home . Yes . ’ ‘[100-loo] Not but what [I]0-i shall be very unwilling , both to leave [you]100-loo , [Loo]100-loo , and to leave [you]100-loo [here]354-here . But [I]0-i must go , [you]100-loo know , whether [I]0-i like it or not ; and [I]0-i had better go where [I]0-i can take with [me]0-i some advantage of [your]100-loo influence , than where [I]0-i should lose it altogether . Do n’t [you]100-loo see ? ’ ‘[75-tom] Yes , [Tom]75-tom . ’ The answer was so long in coming , though there was no indecision in it , that [Tom]75-tom went and leaned on the back of [her]100-loo chair , to contemplate the fire which so engrossed [her]100-loo , from [her]100-loo point of view , and see what [he]75-tom could make of it . ‘[75-tom] Except that it is a fire , ’ said [Tom]75-tom , ‘[100-loo] it looks to [me]0-i as stupid and blank as everything else looks . What do [you]100-loo see in it ? Not a circus ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t see anything in it , [Tom]75-tom , particularly . But since [I]0-i have been looking at it , [I]0-i have been wondering about [you]100-loo and [me]0-i , grown up . ’ ‘[0-i] Wondering again ! ’ said [Tom]75-tom . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have such unmanageable thoughts , ’ returned [[his]75-tom sister]644-his sister , ‘[0-i] that [they]669-they _ will _ wonder . ’ ‘[669-they] Then [I]0-i beg of [you]100-loo , [Louisa]91-louisa , ’ said [Mrs. Gradgrind]94-mrs. gradgrind , who had opened the door without being heard , ‘[0-i] to do nothing of that description , for goodness ’ sake , [[you]100-loo inconsiderate girl]3237-you inconsiderate girl , or [I]91-louisa shall never hear the last of it from [[your]100-loo father]2725-your father . And , [Thomas]75-tom , it is really shameful , with [my]91-louisa poor head continually wearing [me]91-louisa out , that [a boy brought up as [you]100-loo have been]3239-a boy brought up as you have been , and whose education has cost what [yours]100-loo has , should be found encouraging [[his]3239-a boy brought up as you have been sister]644-his sister to wonder , when [he]3239-a boy brought up as you have been knows [[his]3239-a boy brought up as you have been father]494-his father has expressly said that [she]3239-a boy brought up as you have been is not to do it . ’[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa denied [Tom]75-tom ’s participation in the offence ; but [[her]91-louisa mother]670-her mother stopped [her]91-louisa with the conclusive answer , ‘ [Louisa]91-louisa , do n’t tell [me]91-louisa , in [my]91-louisa state of health ; for unless [you]91-louisa had been encouraged , it is morally and physically impossible that [you]91-louisa could have done it . ’[91-louisa] ‘ [I]670-her mother was encouraged by nothing , [mother]3242-mother , but by looking at the red sparks dropping out of the fire , and whitening and dying . It made [me]670-her mother think , after all , how short [my]670-her mother life would be , and how little [I]670-her mother could hope to do in it . ’[670-her mother] ‘ Nonsense ! ’[94-mrs. gradgrind] said [Mrs. Gradgrind]94-mrs. gradgrind , rendered almost energetic . ‘ Nonsense ! Do n’t stand there and tell [me]94-mrs. gradgrind such stuff , [Louisa]91-louisa , to [my]94-mrs. gradgrind face , when [you]91-louisa know very well that if it was ever to reach [[your]91-louisa father]2725-your father ’s ears [I]94-mrs. gradgrind should never hear the last of it . After all the trouble that has been taken with [you]91-louisa ! After the lectures [you]91-louisa have attended , and the experiments [you]91-louisa have seen ! After [I]94-mrs. gradgrind have heard [you]91-louisa [myself]94-mrs. gradgrind , when the whole of [my]94-mrs. gradgrind right side has been benumbed , going on with [[your]91-louisa master]3244-your master about combustion , and calcination , and calorification , and [I]94-mrs. gradgrind may say every kind of ation that could drive [a poor invalid]3245-a poor invalid distracted , to hear [you]91-louisa talking in this absurd way about sparks and ashes ! [I]94-mrs. gradgrind wish , ’[94-mrs. gradgrind] whimpered [Mrs. Gradgrind]94-mrs. gradgrind , taking a chair , and discharging [her]94-mrs. gradgrind strongest point before succumbing under these mere shadows of facts , ‘ yes , [I]94-mrs. gradgrind really _ do _ wish that [I]94-mrs. gradgrind had never had [a family]3246-a family , and then [you]91-louisa would have known what it was to do without [me]94-mrs. gradgrind ! ’[94-mrs. gradgrind] CHAPTER IX [SISSY ’S PROGRESS SISSY JUPE]76-sissy had not an easy time of it , between [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild and [Mrs. Gradgrind]94-mrs. gradgrind , and was not without strong impulses , in the first months of [her]94-mrs. gradgrind probation , to run away . It hailed facts all day long so very hard , and life in general was opened to [her]94-mrs. gradgrind as such a closely ruled ciphering - book , that assuredly [she]94-mrs. gradgrind would have run away , but for only one restraint . It is lamentable to think of ; but this restraint was the result of no arithmetical process , was self - imposed in defiance of all calculation , and went dead against any table of probabilities that [any Actuary]3247-any actuary would have drawn up from [the premises]3248-the premises . [The girl]265-the girl believed that [[her]265-the girl father]335-her father had not deserted [her]265-the girl ; [she]265-the girl lived in the hope that [he]335-her father would come back , and in the faith that [he]335-her father would be made the happier by [her]265-the girl remaining where [she]265-the girl was . The wretched ignorance with which [Jupe]76-sissy clung to this consolation , rejecting the superior comfort of knowing , on a sound arithmetical basis , that [[her]265-the girl father]335-her father was [an unnatural vagabond]3252-an unnatural vagabond , filled [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom with pity . Yet , what was to be done ? [M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild reported that [she]94-mrs. gradgrind had a very dense head for figures ; that , once possessed with a general idea of the globe , [she]94-mrs. gradgrind took the smallest conceivable interest in its exact measurements ; that [she]94-mrs. gradgrind was extremely slow in the acquisition of dates , unless some pitiful incident happened to be connected therewith ; that [she]94-mrs. gradgrind would burst into tears on being required ( by the mental process ) immediately to name the cost of two hundred and forty - seven muslin caps at fourteen - pence halfpenny ; that [she]94-mrs. gradgrind was as low down , in [the school]2778-the school , as low could be ; that after eight weeks of induction into the elements of [Political Economy]19-political economy , [she]94-mrs. gradgrind had only yesterday been set right by [a prattler three feet high]3254-a prattler three feet high , for returning to the question , ‘[94-mrs. gradgrind] What is the first principle of this science ? ’ the absurd answer , ‘[672-you] To do unto [others]671-others as [I]0-i would that [they]671-others should do unto [me]0-i . ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom observed , shaking [his]75-tom head , that all this was very bad ; that it showed the necessity of infinite grinding at the mill of knowledge , as per system , schedule , blue book , report , and tabular statements A to Z ; and that [Jupe]76-sissy ‘[672-you] must be kept to it . ’ So [Jupe]76-sissy was kept to it , and became low - spirited , but no wiser . ‘[672-you] It would be a fine thing to be [you]672-you , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa ! ’ [she]94-mrs. gradgrind said , one night , when [Louisa]91-louisa had endeavoured to make [her]91-louisa perplexities for next day something clearer to [her]91-louisa . ‘[672-you] Do [you]672-you think so ? ’ ‘[672-you] [I]0-i should know so much , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa . All that is difficult to [me]0-i now , would be so easy then . ’ ‘[672-you] [You]672-you might not be the better for it , [Sissy]76-sissy . ’ [Sissy]76-sissy submitted , after a little hesitation , ‘[672-you] [I]0-i should not be the worse , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa . ’ To which [Miss Louisa]91-louisa answered , ‘[91-louisa] [I]0-i do n’t know that . ’ There had been so little communication between [these two]3255-these two — both because life at [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge went monotonously round like a piece of machinery which discouraged human interference , and because of the prohibition relative to [Sissy]76-sissy ’s past career — that [they]3255-these two were still [almost strangers]3256-almost strangers . [Sissy]76-sissy , with [her]76-sissy dark eyes wonderingly directed to [Louisa]91-louisa ’s face , was uncertain whether to say more or to remain silent . ‘[0-i] [You]91-louisa are more useful to [[my]0-i mother]357-my mother , and more pleasant with [her]357-my mother than [I]0-i can ever be , ’ [Louisa]91-louisa resumed . ‘[91-louisa] [You]91-louisa are pleasanter to [yourself]91-louisa , than _ [I]0-i _ am to _ [my_self]674-my_self . ’ ‘[91-louisa] But , if [you]91-louisa please , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa , ’ [Sissy]76-sissy pleaded , ‘[91-louisa] [I]0-i am — O so stupid ! ’ [Louisa]91-louisa , with a brighter laugh than usual , told [her]91-louisa [she]91-louisa would be wiser by - and - by . ‘[91-louisa] [You]91-louisa do n’t know , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , half crying , ‘[91-louisa] what [a stupid girl]675-a stupid girl [I]0-i am . All through school hours [I]0-i make mistakes . [Mr.]676-mr. and [Mrs. M’Choakumchild]136-mrs. m’choakumchild call [me]0-i up , over and over again , regularly to make mistakes . [I]0-i ca n’t help [them]677-they . [They]677-they seem to come natural to [me]0-i . ’ ‘[678-mr.] [Mr.]678-mr. and [Mrs. M’Choakumchild]136-mrs. m’choakumchild never make any mistakes [themselves]677-they , [I]0-i suppose , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’ ‘[76-sissy] O no ! ’ [she]76-sissy eagerly returned . ‘[677-they] [They]677-they know everything . ’ ‘[677-they] Tell [me]0-i some of [your]91-louisa mistakes . ’ ‘[677-they] [I]0-i am almost ashamed , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , with reluctance . ‘[0-i] But to - day , for instance , [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild was explaining to [us]679-us about Natural Prosperity . ’ ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] National , [I]0-i think it must have been , ’ observed [Louisa]91-louisa . ‘[0-i] Yes , it was.—But is n’t it the same ? ’ [she]91-louisa timidly asked . ‘[91-louisa] [You]91-louisa had better say , National , as [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said so , ’ returned [Louisa]91-louisa , with [her]91-louisa dry reserve . ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] National Prosperity . And [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said , Now , [this schoolroom]680-this schoolroom is [a Nation]681-a nation . And in [this nation]682-this nation , there are fifty millions of money . Is n’t this [a prosperous nation]683-a prosperous nation ? [Girl]2742-girl number twenty , is n’t [this]685-this [a prosperous nation]683-a prosperous nation , and a’n’t [you]91-louisa in [a thriving state]687-a thriving state ? ’ ‘[91-louisa] What did [you]91-louisa say ? ’ asked [Louisa]91-louisa . ‘[91-louisa] [Miss Louisa]91-louisa , [I]0-i said [I]0-i did n’t know . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could n’t know whether it was [a prosperous nation]683-a prosperous nation or not , and whether [I]0-i was in [a thriving state]687-a thriving state or not , unless [I]0-i knew who had got the money , and whether any of it was [mine]0-i . But that had nothing to do with it . It was not in the figures at all , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , wiping [her]76-sissy eyes . ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] That was a great mistake of [yours]91-louisa , ’ observed [Louisa]91-louisa . ‘[91-louisa] Yes , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa , [I]0-i know it was , now . Then [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild said [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild would try [me]0-i again . And [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said , [This schoolroom]680-this schoolroom is [an immense town]691-an immense town , and in [it]680-this schoolroom there are [a million of inhabitants]692-a million of inhabitants , and only five - and - twenty are starved to death in [the streets]2931-the streets , in the course of a year . What is [your]91-louisa remark on that proportion ? And [my]0-i remark was — for [I]0-i could n’t think of a better one — that [I]0-i thought it must be just as hard upon [those who were starved , whether the others]694-those who were starved , whether the others were [a million , or a million million]695-a million , or a million million . And that was wrong , too . ’ ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] Of course it was . ’ ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] Then [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild said [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild would try [me]0-i once more . And [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said , Here are the stutterings — ’ ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] Statistics , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa . ‘[78-mr. m’choakumchild] Yes , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa — [they]696-they always remind [me]0-i of stutterings , and that ’s another of [my]0-i mistakes — of accidents upon [the sea]697-the sea . And [I]0-i find ( [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild said ) that in a given time [a hundred thousand persons]698-a hundred thousand persons went to [sea]699-sea on long voyages , and only five hundred of [them]698-a hundred thousand persons were drowned or burnt to death . What is the percentage ? And [I]0-i said , [Miss]700-miss ; ’ here [Sissy]76-sissy fairly sobbed as confessing with extreme contrition to [her]76-sissy greatest error ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i said it was nothing . ’ ‘[0-i] Nothing , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’ ‘[0-i] Nothing , [Miss]701-miss — to the relations and friends of [the people who were killed]702-the people who were killed . [I]0-i shall never learn , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘[0-i] And the worst of all is , that although [[my]0-i poor father]703-my poor father wished [me]0-i so much to learn , and although [I]0-i am so anxious to learn , because [he]703-my poor father wished [me]0-i to , [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i do n’t like it . ’ [Louisa]91-louisa stood looking at the pretty modest head , as it drooped abashed before [her]91-louisa , until it was raised again to glance at [her]91-louisa face . Then [she]91-louisa asked : ‘[0-i] Did [[your]76-sissy father]2725-your father know so much [himself]703-my poor father , that [he]703-my poor father wished [you]76-sissy to be well taught too , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’ [Sissy]76-sissy hesitated before replying , and so plainly showed [her]76-sissy sense that [they]706-they were entering on [forbidden ground]3257-forbidden ground , that [Louisa]91-louisa added , ‘[703-my poor father] [No one]545-no one hears [us]706-they ; and if [any one]2994-any one did , [I]0-i am sure no harm could be found in such an innocent question . ’ ‘[0-i] No , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa , ’ answered [Sissy]76-sissy , upon this encouragement , shaking [her]76-sissy head ; ‘[91-louisa] [father]2723-father knows very little indeed . It ’s as much as [he]2723-father can do to write ; and it ’s more than [people in general]709-people in general can do to read [his]2723-father writing . Though it ’s plain to _ [me]0-i _ . ’ ‘[710-your mother] [[Your]76-sissy mother]710-your mother ? ’ ‘[106-father] [Father]106-father says [she]710-your mother was quite [a scholar]711-a scholar . [She]710-your mother died when [I]0-i was born . [She]710-your mother was ; ’ [Sissy]76-sissy made the terrible communication nervously ; ‘[710-your mother] [she]710-your mother was [a dancer]712-a dancer . ’ ‘[712-a dancer] Did [[your]76-sissy father]2725-your father love [her]710-your mother ? ’ [Louisa]91-louisa asked these questions with a strong , wild , wandering interest peculiar to [her]91-louisa ; an interest gone astray like a banished creature , and hiding in solitary places . ‘[710-your mother] O yes ! As dearly as [he]2725-your father loves [me]0-i . [Father]106-father loved [me]0-i , first , for [her]710-your mother sake . [He]106-father carried [me]0-i about with [him]106-father when [I]0-i was quite [a baby]714-a baby . [We]715-we have never been asunder from that time . ’ ‘[715-we] Yet [he]2725-your father leaves [you]76-sissy now , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’ ‘[2725-your father] Only for [my]0-i good . [Nobody]353-nobody understands [him]2725-your father as [I]0-i do ; [nobody]353-nobody knows [him]2725-your father as [I]0-i do . When [he]2725-your father left [me]0-i for [my]0-i good — [he]2725-your father never would have left [me]0-i for [his]2725-your father own — [I]0-i know [he]2725-your father was almost broken - hearted with the trial . [He]2725-your father will not be happy for a single minute , till [he]2725-your father comes back . ’ ‘[718-you] Tell [me]0-i more about [him]2725-your father , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , ‘[718-you] [I]0-i will never ask [you]718-you again . Where did [you]718-you live ? ’ ‘[719-we] [We]719-we travelled about [the country]2802-the country , and had no fixed place to live in . [Father]106-father ’s a ; ’ [Sissy]76-sissy whispered the awful word , ‘[721-a clown] [a clown]721-a clown . ’ ‘[721-a clown] To make [the people]307-the people laugh ? ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , with a nod of intelligence . ‘[721-a clown] Yes . But [they]307-the people would n’t laugh sometimes , and then [father]2723-father cried . Lately , [they]307-the people very often would n’t laugh , and [he]2725-your father used to come [home]336-home despairing . [Father]106-father ’s not like most . Those who did n’t know [him]106-father as well as [I]0-i do , and did n’t love [him]106-father as dearly as [I]0-i do , might believe [he]106-father was not quite right . Sometimes [they]307-the people played tricks upon [him]106-father ; but [they]307-the people never knew how [he]106-father felt [them]307-the people , and shrunk up , when [he]106-father was alone with [me]0-i . [He]106-father was far , far timider than [they]307-the people thought ! ’ ‘[106-father] And [you]0-i were [his]106-father comfort through everything ? ’ [She]3258-she nodded , with the tears rolling down [her]3258-she face . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i hope so , and [father]2723-father said [I]0-i was . It was because [he]2723-father grew so scared and trembling , and because [he]2723-father felt [himself]2723-father to be [a poor , weak , ignorant , helpless man]726-a poor , weak , ignorant , helpless man ( those used to be [his]2723-father words ) , that [he]2723-father wanted [me]0-i so much to know a great deal , and be different from [him]2723-father . [I]0-i used to read to [him]2723-father to cheer [his]2723-father courage , and [he]2723-father was very fond of that . [They]727-they were wrong books — [I]0-i am never to speak of them here — but [we]728-we did n’t know there was any harm in them . ’ ‘[2723-father] And [he]2723-father liked [them]727-they ? ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , with a searching gaze on [Sissy]76-sissy all this time . ‘[2723-father] O very much ! [They]727-they kept [him]2723-father , many times , from what did [him]2723-father real harm . And often and often of a night , [he]2723-father used to forget all [his]2723-father troubles in wondering whether [the Sultan]729-the sultan would let [the lady]730-the lady go on with the story , or would have [her]730-the lady head cut off before it was finished . ’ ‘[729-the sultan] And [[your]0-i father]2725-your father was always kind ? To the last ? ’ asked [Louisa]91-louisa contravening the great principle , and wondering very much . ‘[2725-your father] Always , always ! ’ returned [Sissy]76-sissy , clasping [her]76-sissy hands . ‘[2725-your father] Kinder and kinder than [I]0-i can tell . [He]2723-father was angry only one night , and that was not to [me]0-i , but [Merrylegs]104-merrylegs . [Merrylegs]104-merrylegs ; ’ [she]91-louisa whispered the awful fact ; ‘[104-merrylegs] is [his]2723-father performing dog . ’ ‘[104-merrylegs] Why was [he]2723-father angry with the dog ? ’ [Louisa]91-louisa demanded . ‘[106-father] [Father]106-father , soon after [they]732-they came [home]336-home from performing , told [Merrylegs]104-merrylegs to jump up on the backs of the two chairs and stand across [them]734-them — which is one of [his]2723-father tricks . [He]104-merrylegs looked at [father]2723-father , and did n’t do it at once . Everything of [father]2723-father ’s had gone wrong that night , and [he]2723-father had n’t pleased [the public]255-the public at all . [He]2723-father cried out that the very dog knew [he]2723-father was failing , and had no compassion on [him]2723-father . Then [he]2723-father beat the dog , and [I]0-i was frightened , and said , “ [Father]106-father , [father]2723-father ! Pray do n’t hurt the creature who is so fond of [you]2723-father ! O Heaven forgive [you]2723-father , [father]2723-father , stop ! ” And [he]2723-father stopped , and the dog was bloody , and [father]2723-father lay down crying on the floor with the dog in [his]2723-father arms , and the dog licked [his]2723-father face . ’ [Louisa]91-louisa saw that [she]91-louisa was sobbing ; and going to [her]91-louisa , kissed [her]91-louisa , took [her]91-louisa hand , and sat down beside [her]91-louisa . ‘[2723-father] Finish by telling [me]0-i how [[your]2723-father father]2725-your father left [you]2723-father , [Sissy]76-sissy . Now that [I]0-i have asked [you]2723-father so much , tell [me]0-i the end . The blame , if there is any blame , is [mine]0-i , not [yours]2723-father . ’ ‘[91-louisa] [Dear Miss Louisa]91-louisa , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , covering [her]2723-father eyes , and sobbing yet ; ‘[91-louisa] [I]0-i came [home]336-home from [the school]2778-the school that afternoon , and found [poor father]744-poor father just come [home]336-home too , from [the booth]327-the booth . And [he]744-poor father sat rocking [himself]744-poor father over the fire , as if [he]744-poor father was in pain . And [I]0-i said , “ Have [you]744-poor father hurt [yourself]744-poor father , [father]2723-father ? ” ( as [he]744-poor father did sometimes , like [they]748-they all did ) , and [he]744-poor father said , “ A little , [[my]0-i darling]749-my darling . ” And when [I]0-i came to stoop down and look up at [his]744-poor father face , [I]0-i saw that [he]744-poor father was crying . The more [I]0-i spoke to [him]744-poor father , the more [he]744-poor father hid [his]744-poor father face ; and at first [he]744-poor father shook all over , and said nothing but “ [[My]0-i darling]749-my darling ; ” and “ [My]0-i love ! ” ’ Here [Tom]75-tom came lounging in , and stared at [the two]3259-the two with a coolness not particularly savouring of interest in anything but [himself]75-tom , and not much of that at present . ‘[744-poor father] [I]0-i am asking [Sissy]76-sissy a few questions , [Tom]75-tom , ’ observed [[his]75-tom sister]644-his sister . ‘[75-tom] [You]75-tom have no occasion to go away ; but do n’t interrupt [us]751-us for a moment , [[Tom]75-tom dear]752-tom dear . ’ ‘[75-tom] Oh ! very well ! ’ returned [Tom]75-tom . ‘[75-tom] [Only father]753-only father has brought [old Bounderby]100-loo [home]336-home , and [I]0-i want [you]76-sissy to come into [the drawing - room]755-the drawing - room . Because if [you]76-sissy come , there ’s a good chance of [old Bounderby]100-loo ’s asking [me]0-i to dinner ; and if [you]76-sissy do n’t , there ’s none . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll come directly . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll wait for [you]76-sissy , ’ said [Tom]75-tom , ‘[0-i] to make sure . ’ [Sissy]76-sissy resumed in a lower voice . ‘[0-i] At last [poor father]744-poor father said that [he]744-poor father had given no satisfaction again , and never did give any satisfaction now , and that [he]744-poor father was a shame and disgrace , and [I]0-i should have done better without [him]744-poor father all along . [I]0-i said all the affectionate things to [him]744-poor father that came into [my]0-i heart , and presently [he]744-poor father was quiet and [I]0-i sat down by [him]744-poor father , and told [him]744-poor father all about [the school]2778-the school and everything that had been said and done [there]412-there . When [I]0-i had no more left to tell , [he]744-poor father put [his]744-poor father arms round [my]0-i neck , and kissed [me]0-i a great many times . Then [he]744-poor father asked [me]0-i to fetch some of the stuff [he]744-poor father used , for the little hurt [he]744-poor father had had , and to get it at the best place , which was at [the other end of [town]427-town]759-the other end of town from there ; and then , after kissing [me]0-i again , [he]744-poor father let [me]0-i go . When [I]0-i had gone down - [stairs]761-stairs , [I]0-i turned back that [I]0-i might be a little bit more company to [him]744-poor father yet , and looked in at the door , and said , “ [[Father]106-father dear]762-father dear , shall [I]0-i take [Merrylegs]104-merrylegs ? ” [Father]106-father shook [his]106-father head and said , “ No , [Sissy]76-sissy , no ; take nothing that ’s known to be [mine]106-father , [[my]0-i darling]749-my darling ; ” and [I]0-i left [him]744-poor father sitting by the fire . Then the thought must have come upon [him]744-poor father , [poor , poor father]3075-poor , poor father ! of going away to try something for [my]0-i sake ; for when [I]0-i came back , [he]744-poor father was gone . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i say ! Look sharp for [old Bounderby]100-loo , [Loo]100-loo ! ’ [Tom]75-tom remonstrated . ‘[100-loo] There ’s no more to tell , [Miss Louisa]91-louisa . [I]0-i keep the nine oils ready for [him]744-poor father , and [I]0-i know [he]744-poor father will come back . Every letter that [I]0-i see in [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom ’s hand takes [my]0-i breath away and blinds [my]0-i eyes , for [I]0-i think it comes from [father]2723-father , or from [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary about [father]2723-father . [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary promised to write as soon as ever [father]2723-father should be heard of , and [I]0-i trust to [him]744-poor father to keep [his]744-poor father word . ’ ‘[744-poor father] Do look sharp for [old Bounderby]100-loo , Loo ! ’ said [Tom]75-tom , with an impatient whistle . ‘[744-poor father] [He]744-poor father ’ll be off if [you]768-you do n’t look sharp ! ’ After this , whenever [Sissy]76-sissy dropped a curtsey to [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom in the presence of [[his]0-i family]332-his family , and said in a faltering way , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]2723-father pardon , [sir]2713-sir , for being troublesome — but — have [you]2723-father had any letter yet about [me]0-i ? ’ [Louisa]91-louisa would suspend the occupation of the moment , whatever it was , and look for the reply as earnestly as [Sissy]76-sissy did . And when [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom regularly answered , ‘[2723-father] No , [Jupe]76-sissy , nothing of the sort , ’ the trembling of [Sissy]76-sissy ’s lip would be repeated in [Louisa]91-louisa ’s face , and [her]91-louisa eyes would follow [Sissy]76-sissy with compassion to the door . [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom usually improved these occasions by remarking , when [she]91-louisa was gone , that if [Jupe]76-sissy had been properly trained from an early age [she]91-louisa would have remonstrated to [herself]91-louisa on sound principles the baselessness of these fantastic hopes . Yet it did seem ( though not to [him]2713-sir , for [he]2713-sir saw nothing of it ) as if fantastic hope could take as strong a hold as Fact . This observation must be limited exclusively to [[his]75-tom daughter]345-his daughter . As to [Tom]75-tom , [he]2713-sir was becoming that not unprecedented triumph of calculation which is usually at work on number one . As to [Mrs. Gradgrind]94-mrs. gradgrind , if [she]91-louisa said anything on the subject , [she]91-louisa would come a little way out of [her]91-louisa wrappers , like [a feminine dormouse]3263-a feminine dormouse , and say : ‘[76-sissy] Good gracious bless [me]0-i , how [my]0-i poor head is vexed and worried by [that girl Jupe]770-that girl jupe ’s so perseveringly asking , over and over again , about [her]770-that girl jupe tiresome letters ! Upon [my]0-i word and honour [I]0-i seem to be fated , and destined , and ordained , to live in the midst of things that [I]0-i am never to hear the last of . It really is a most extraordinary circumstance that it appears as if [I]0-i never was to hear the last of anything ! ’ At about this point , [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom ’s eye would fall upon [her]91-louisa ; and under the influence of that wintry piece of fact , [she]91-louisa would become torpid again . CHAPTER X [STEPHEN BLACKPOOL]137-stephen [I]138-providence ENTERTAIN a weak idea that [the English people]3264-the english people are as hard - worked as [any people upon whom the sun shines]3265-any people upon whom the sun shines . [I]138-providence acknowledge to this ridiculous idiosyncrasy , as a reason why [I]138-providence would give [them]3264-the english people a little more play . In [the hardest working part of [Coketown]4-coketown]3266-the hardest working part of coketown ; in [the innermost fortifications of [that ugly citadel]3268-that ugly citadel]3267-the innermost fortifications of that ugly citadel , where Nature was as strongly bricked out as killing airs and gases were bricked in ; at the heart of the labyrinth of narrow courts upon [courts]3269-courts , and [close streets upon streets]3270-close streets upon streets , which had come into existence piecemeal , every piece in a violent hurry for [some one man]3271-some one man ’s purpose , and [the whole an unnatural family]3272-the whole an unnatural family , shouldering , and trampling , and pressing [one another to death]3273-one another to death ; in [the last close nook of [this great exhausted receiver]3275-this great exhausted receiver]3274-the last close nook of this great exhausted receiver , where the chimneys , for want of air to make a draught , were built in an immense variety of stunted and crooked shapes , as though [every house]3276-every house put out a sign of the kind of [people who might be expected to be born in]3277-people who might be expected to be born in [it]3276-every house ; among [the multitude of [Coketown]4-coketown]3278-the multitude of coketown , generically called ‘[138-providence] the Hands,’—a race who would have found more favour with [some people]3154-some people , if [Providence]138-providence had seen fit to make [them]3154-some people only hands , or , like the lower creatures of [the seashore]772-the seashore , only hands and stomachs — lived a certain [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , forty years of age . [Stephen]137-stephen looked older , but [he]137-stephen had had a hard life . It is said that every life has its roses and thorns ; there seemed , however , to have been a misadventure or mistake in [Stephen]137-stephen ’s case , whereby [somebody else]773-somebody else had become possessed of [his]137-stephen roses , and [he]137-stephen had become possessed of the same [somebody else]773-somebody else ’s thorns in addition to [his]137-stephen own . [He]137-stephen had known , to use [his]137-stephen words , a peck of trouble . [He]137-stephen was usually called [Old Stephen]139-stephen , in a kind of rough homage to the fact . [A rather stooping man , with a knitted brow , a pondering expression of face , and a hard - looking head sufficiently capacious]775-a rather stooping man , with a knitted brow , a pondering expression of face , and a hard - looking head sufficiently capacious , on which [his]137-stephen iron - grey hair lay long and thin , [Old Stephen]139-stephen might have passed for [a particularly intelligent man in [his]137-stephen condition]776-a particularly intelligent man in his condition . Yet [he]139-stephen was not . [He]139-stephen took no place among [those remarkable ‘ Hands , ’[777-those remarkable ‘ hands , ’ who , piecing together their broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things] who , piecing together [their]777-those remarkable ‘ hands , ’ who , piecing together their broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things]777-those remarkable ‘ hands , ’ who , piecing together their broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things . [He]139-stephen held no station among [the Hands who could make speeches and carry on debates]778-the hands who could make speeches and carry on debates . [Thousands of [his]139-stephen compeers]779-thousands of his compeers could talk much better than [he]139-stephen , at any time . [He]139-stephen was [a good power - loom weaver]780-a good power - loom weaver , and [a man of perfect integrity]781-a man of perfect integrity . What more [he]139-stephen was , or what else [he]139-stephen had in [him]139-stephen , if anything , let [him]139-stephen show for [himself]139-stephen . The lights in [the great factories]782-the great factories , which looked , when they were illuminated , like [Fairy palaces]783-fairy palaces — or the travellers by [express - train]784-express - train said so — were all extinguished ; and the bells had rung for knocking off for the night , and had ceased again ; and [the Hands]785-the hands , [men]3039-men and [women]574-women , [boy]286-boy and [girl]2742-girl , were clattering [home]336-home . [Old Stephen]139-stephen was standing in [the street]448-the street , with the old sensation upon [him]139-stephen which the stoppage of the machinery always produced — the sensation of its having worked and stopped in [his]139-stephen own head . ‘ Yet [I]139-stephen do n’t see [Rachael]140-rachael , still ! ’[139-stephen] said [he]139-stephen . It was a wet night , and [many groups of [young women]793-young women]792-many groups of young women passed [him]139-stephen , with [their]792-many groups of young women shawls drawn over [their]792-many groups of young women bare heads and held close under [their]792-many groups of young women chins to keep the rain out . [He]139-stephen knew [Rachael]140-rachael well , for a glance at [any one of [these groups]795-these groups]794-any one of these groups was sufficient to show [him]139-stephen that [she]140-rachael was not [there]412-there . At last , there were no more to come ; and then [he]139-stephen turned away , saying in a tone of disappointment , ‘ Why , then , ha ’[139-stephen] missed [her]140-rachael ! ’ But , [he]139-stephen had not gone the length of [three streets]3279-three streets , when [he]139-stephen saw another of the shawled figures in advance of [him]139-stephen , at which [he]139-stephen looked so keenly that perhaps its mere shadow indistinctly reflected on the wet pavement — if [he]139-stephen could have seen it without the figure itself moving along from lamp to lamp , brightening and fading as it went — would have been enough to tell [him]139-stephen who was there . Making [his]139-stephen pace at once much quicker and much softer , [he]139-stephen darted on until [he]139-stephen was very near [this figure]3280-this figure , then fell into [his]139-stephen former walk , and called ‘[139-stephen] [Rachael]140-rachael ! ’ [She]140-rachael turned , being then in the brightness of a lamp ; and raising [her]140-rachael hood a little , showed a quiet oval face , dark and rather delicate , irradiated by a pair of very gentle eyes , and further set off by the perfect order of [her]140-rachael shining black hair . It was not a face in its first bloom ; [she]140-rachael was [a woman five and thirty years of age]3281-a woman five and thirty years of age . ‘[797-lad] Ah , [lad]797-lad ! ’ Tis [thou]140-rachael ? ’[797-lad] When [she]140-rachael had said this , with a smile which would have been quite expressed , though nothing of [her]140-rachael had been seen but [her]140-rachael pleasant eyes , [she]140-rachael replaced [her]140-rachael hood again , and [they]798-they went on together . ‘ [I]140-rachael thought [thou]140-rachael wast ahind [me]140-rachael , [Rachael]140-rachael ? ’[140-rachael] ‘ No . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Early t’night , [lass]3282-lass ? ’[140-rachael] ‘ ’[140-rachael] Times [I]0-i ’m a little early , [Stephen]139-stephen ! ’[140-rachael] times a little late . [I]0-i ’m never to be counted on , going [home]336-home . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Nor going t’other way , neither , ’[140-rachael] t seems to [me]0-i , [Rachael]140-rachael ? ’ ‘[139-stephen] No , [Stephen]139-stephen . ’ [He]139-stephen looked at [her]140-rachael with some disappointment in [his]139-stephen face , but with a respectful and patient conviction that [she]140-rachael must be right in whatever [she]140-rachael did . The expression was not lost upon [her]140-rachael ; [she]140-rachael laid [her]140-rachael hand lightly on [his]139-stephen arm a moment as if to thank [him]139-stephen for it . ‘[139-stephen] [We]799-we are [such true friends]800-such true friends , [lad]797-lad , and [such old friends]802-such old friends , and getting to be [such old folk]803-such old folk , now . ’ ‘[140-rachael] No , [Rachael]140-rachael , [thou’rt]804-thou as young as ever [thou]804-thou wast . ’ ‘[140-rachael] [One of [us]799-we]805-one of us would be puzzled how to get old , [Stephen]139-stephen , without ’ t other getting so too , [both being alive]3284-both being alive , ’[806-she] [she]806-she answered , laughing ; ‘ but , anyways , [we]799-we ’re[806-she] [such old friends]802-such old friends , and t ’ hide a word of honest truth fro ’[806-she] one another would be a sin and a pity . ’ Tis better not to walk too much together . ’[806-she] Times , yes ! ’ Twould be hard , indeed , if ’[806-she] twas not to be at all , ’ [she]806-she said , with a cheerfulness [she]806-she sought to communicate to [him]139-stephen . ‘[806-she] ’ Tis hard , anyways , [Rachael]140-rachael . ’[806-she] ‘ Try to think not ; and ’[806-she] twill seem better . ’ ‘[806-she] [I]0-i ’ve tried a long time , and ’ ta’nt got better . But thou’rt right ; ’[806-she] t might mak fok talk , even of [thee]804-thou . [Thou]804-thou hast been that to [me]0-i , [Rachael]140-rachael , through so many year : [thou]804-thou hast done [me]0-i so much good , and heartened of [me]0-i in that cheering way , that [thy]804-thou word is a law to [me]0-i . Ah , [lass]3282-lass , and a bright good law ! Better than [some real ones]809-some real ones . ’ ‘[139-stephen] Never fret about [them]810-them , [Stephen]139-stephen , ’ [she]806-she answered quickly , and not without an anxious glance at [his]139-stephen face . ‘[139-stephen] Let the laws be . ’ ‘[139-stephen] Yes , ’ [he]139-stephen said , with a slow nod or two . ‘[139-stephen] Let [’em]3285-’em be . Let everything be . Let all sorts alone . ’[139-stephen] Tis a muddle , and that ’s aw . ’ ‘[139-stephen] Always a muddle ? ’ said [Rachael]140-rachael , with another gentle touch upon [his]139-stephen arm , as if to recall [him]139-stephen out of the thoughtfulness , in which [he]139-stephen was biting the long ends of [his]139-stephen loose neckerchief as [he]139-stephen walked along . The touch had its instantaneous effect . [He]139-stephen let [them]3286-them fall , turned a smiling face upon [her]806-she , and said , as [he]139-stephen broke into a good - humoured laugh , ‘[140-rachael] Ay , [Rachael]140-rachael , [lass]3282-lass , awlus a muddle . That ’s where [I]0-i stick . [The woman]3289-the woman ’s was the first reached . It was in [one of the many small streets for which [the favourite undertaker ( who turned a handsome sum out of the one poor ghastly pomp of [the neighbourhood]3292-the neighbourhood]3291-the favourite undertaker ( who turned a handsome sum out of the one poor ghastly pomp of the neighbourhood]3290-one of the many small streets for which the favourite undertaker ( who turned a handsome sum out of the one poor ghastly pomp of the neighbourhood ) kept a black ladder , in order that [those who had done [their]3293-those who had done their daily groping up and down the narrow stairs daily groping up and down the narrow stairs]3293-those who had done their daily groping up and down the narrow stairs might slide out of this working world by the windows . [She]806-she stopped at the corner , and putting [her]806-she hand in [his]139-stephen , wished [him]139-stephen good night . ‘[0-i] Good night , [dear lass]812-dear lass ; good night ! ’ [She]806-she went , with [her]806-she neat figure and [her]806-she sober womanly step , down [the dark street]3294-the dark street , and [he]139-stephen stood looking after [her]806-she until [she]806-she turned into [one of [the small houses]3296-the small houses]3295-one of the small houses . There was not a flutter of [her]806-she coarse shawl , perhaps , but had its interest in [this man]2949-this man ’s eyes ; not a tone of [her]806-she voice but had its echo in [his]139-stephen innermost heart . When [she]806-she was lost to [his]139-stephen view , [he]139-stephen pursued [his]139-stephen homeward way , glancing up sometimes at the sky , where the clouds were sailing fast and wildly . But , they were broken now , and the rain had ceased , and the moon shone,—looking down [the high chimneys of [Coketown]4-coketown]3298-the high chimneys of coketown on the deep furnaces below , and casting Titanic shadows of the steam - engines at rest , upon the walls where [they]3299-they were lodged . [The man]3010-the man seemed to have brightened with the night , as [he]3010-the man went on . [[His]3010-the man home]3301-his home , in such [another street]3302-another street as the first , saving that [it]3301-his home was narrower , was over [a little shop]3303-a little shop . How it came to pass that [any people]3304-any people found it worth [their]3304-any people while to sell or buy the wretched little toys , mixed up in [its]3303-a little shop window with cheap newspapers and pork ( there was a leg to be raffled for to - morrow - night ) , matters not [here]354-here . [He]3010-the man took [his]3010-the man end of candle from a shelf , lighted it at another end of candle on the counter , without disturbing [the mistress of the shop who was asleep in [[her]3306-the mistress of the shop who was asleep in her little room , and went upstairs into his lodging little room]3307-her little room , and went [upstairs]3308-upstairs into [[his]3010-the man lodging]3309-his lodging]3306-the mistress of the shop who was asleep in her little room , and went upstairs into his lodging . It was [a room , not unacquainted with the black ladder under various tenants]3310-a room , not unacquainted with the black ladder under various tenants ; but as neat , at present , as such [a room]2749-a room could be . A few books and writings were on an old bureau in a corner , the furniture was decent and sufficient , and , though the atmosphere was tainted , [the room]2859-the room was clean . Going to the hearth to set the candle down upon a round three - legged table standing there , [he]3010-the man stumbled against something . As [he]3010-the man recoiled , looking down at it , it raised itself up into the form of [a woman in a sitting attitude]3313-a woman in a sitting attitude . ‘[0-i] Heaven ’s mercy , [woman]813-woman ! ’ [he]3010-the man cried , falling farther off from [the figure]3314-the figure . ‘[0-i] Hast [thou]814-thou come back again ! ’ [Such a woman]3315-such a woman ! [A disabled , drunken creature]3316-a disabled , drunken creature , barely able to preserve [her]813-woman sitting posture by steadying [herself]813-woman with one begrimed hand on the floor , while the other was so purposeless in trying to push away [her]813-woman tangled hair from [her]813-woman face , that it only blinded [her]813-woman the more with the dirt upon it . [A creature so foul to look at]3317-a creature so foul to look at , in [her]813-woman tatters , stains and splashes , but so much fouler than that in [her]813-woman moral infamy , that it was a shameful thing even to see [her]813-woman . After an impatient oath or two , and some stupid clawing of [herself]813-woman with the hand not necessary to [her]813-woman support , [she]813-woman got [her]813-woman hair away from [her]813-woman eyes sufficiently to obtain a sight of [him]797-lad . Then [she]813-woman sat swaying [her]813-woman body to and fro , and making gestures with [her]813-woman unnerved arm , which seemed intended as the accompaniment to a fit of laughter , though [her]813-woman face was stolid and drowsy . ‘[0-i] Eigh , [lad]797-lad ? What , [yo’r]816-yo’r there ? ’ Some hoarse sounds meant for this , came mockingly out of [her]813-woman at last ; and [her]813-woman head dropped forward on [her]813-woman breast . ‘[816-yo’r] Back agen ? ’ [she]813-woman screeched , after some minutes , as if [he]797-lad had that moment said it . ‘[816-yo’r] Yes ! And back agen . Back agen ever and ever so often . Back ? Yes , back . Why not ? ’ Roused by the unmeaning violence with which [she]813-woman cried it out , [she]813-woman scrambled up , and stood supporting [herself]813-woman with [her]813-woman shoulders against the wall ; dangling in one hand by the string , a dunghill - fragment of a bonnet , and trying to look scornfully at [him]797-lad . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll sell [thee]797-lad off again , and [I]0-i ’ll sell [thee]797-lad off again , and [I]0-i ’ll sell [thee]797-lad off a score of times ! ’ [she]813-woman cried , with something between a furious menace and an effort at a defiant dance . ‘[0-i] Come awa ’ from th ’[0-i] bed ! ’ [He]797-lad was sitting on the side of it , with [his]797-lad face hidden in [his]797-lad hands . ‘[0-i] Come awa ! from ’ t. ’[0-i] Tis mine , and [I]0-i ’ve a right to t ’ ! ’[817-her] As [she]817-her staggered to it , [he]797-lad avoided [her]817-her with a shudder , and passed — [his]797-lad face still hidden — to the opposite end of [the room]2859-the room . [She]817-her threw [herself]817-her upon the bed heavily , and soon was snoring hard . [He]797-lad sunk into a chair , and moved but once all that night . It was to throw a covering over [her]817-her ; as if [his]797-lad hands were not enough to hide [her]817-her , even in the darkness . CHAPTER XI NO WAY OUT [THE Fairy palaces]819-the fairy palaces burst into illumination , before pale morning showed the monstrous serpents of smoke trailing themselves over [Coketown]4-coketown . A clattering of clogs upon [the pavement]453-the pavement ; a rapid ringing of bells ; and all the melancholy mad elephants , polished and oiled up for the day ’s monotony , were at [their]821-their heavy exercise again . [Stephen]139-stephen bent over [his]139-stephen loom , quiet , watchful , and steady . A special contrast , as [every man]822-every man was in the forest of looms where [Stephen]139-stephen worked , to the crashing , smashing , tearing piece of mechanism at which [he]139-stephen laboured . Never fear , [good people of an anxious turn of mind]823-good people of an anxious turn of mind , that Art will consign Nature to oblivion . Set anywhere , side by side , the work of [GOD]126-god and the work of [man]2923-man ; and the former , even though it be a troop of Hands of very small account , will gain in dignity from the comparison . So many hundred Hands in [this Mill]825-this mill ; so many hundred horse Steam Power . It is known , to the force of a single pound weight , what the engine will do ; but , not all the calculators of the National Debt can tell [me]0-i the capacity for good or evil , for love or hatred , for patriotism or discontent , for the decomposition of virtue into vice , or the reverse , at any single moment in the soul of [one of [these its quiet servants]827-these its quiet servants]826-one of these its quiet servants , with the composed faces and the regulated actions . There is no mystery in it ; there is an unfathomable mystery in the meanest of [them]819-the fairy palaces , for ever.—Supposing [we]828-we were to reverse [our]828-we arithmetic for material objects , and to govern these awful unknown quantities by other means ! The day grew strong , and showed itself outside , even against the flaming lights within . The lights were turned out , and the work went on . The rain fell , and the Smoke - serpents , submissive to the curse of all that tribe , trailed themselves upon [the earth]3171-the earth . In [the waste - yard outside]830-the waste - yard outside , the steam from the escape pipe , the litter of barrels and old iron , the shining heaps of coals , the ashes everywhere , were shrouded in a veil of mist and rain . The work went on , until the noon - bell rang . More clattering upon the pavements . The looms , and wheels , and Hands all out of gear for an hour . [Stephen]139-stephen came out of [the hot mill]831-the hot mill into the damp wind and [cold wet streets]832-cold wet streets , haggard and worn . [He]139-stephen turned from [[his]139-stephen own class]833-his own class and [[his]139-stephen own quarter]834-his own quarter , taking nothing but a little bread as [he]139-stephen walked along , towards [the hill on which [[his]139-stephen principal employer]836-his principal employer lived]835-the hill on which his principal employer lived , in [a red house with black outside shutters , green inside blinds]837-a red house with black outside shutters , green inside blinds , a black street door , up two white steps , [BOUNDERBY]100-loo ( in letters very like [himself]100-loo ) upon a brazen plate , and a round brazen door - handle underneath it , like a brazen full - stop . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby was at [his]92-mr. bounderby lunch . So [Stephen]139-stephen had expected . Would [[his]139-stephen servant]838-his servant say that [one of [the Hands]785-the hands]839-one of the hands begged leave to speak to [him]139-stephen ? [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby netting at the fireside , in a side - saddle attitude , with one foot in a cotton stirrup . It was a part , at once of [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby ’s dignity and service , not to lunch . [She]843-she supervised the meal officially , but implied that in [her]843-she own stately person [she]843-she considered lunch a weakness . ‘ Now , [Stephen]137-stephen , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ what ’s the matter with _ [you]137-stephen _ ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Stephen]137-stephen made a bow .
