[The institutions of [[your]0-i country]884-your country]883-the institutions of your country are not [your]0-i piece - work , and the only thing [you]0-i have got to do , is , to mind [your]0-i piece - work . [You]0-i did n’t take [[your]0-i wife]887-your wife for fast and for loose ; but for better for worse . If [she]887-your wife has turned out worse — why , all [we]888-we have got to say is , [she]887-your wife might have turned out better . ’ ‘[137-stephen] ’ Tis a muddle , ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen , shaking [his]137-stephen head as [he]137-stephen moved to the door . ‘ ’[137-stephen] Tis a ’ a muddle ! ’[137-stephen] ‘ Now , [I]92-mr. bounderby ’ll tell [you]0-i what ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby resumed , as a valedictory address . ‘ With what [I]92-mr. bounderby shall call [your]0-i unhallowed opinions , [you]0-i have been quite shocking [this lady]3106-this lady : who , as [I]92-mr. bounderby have already told [you]0-i , is [a born lady]852-a born lady , and who , as [I]92-mr. bounderby have not already told [you]0-i , has had [her]3106-this lady own marriage misfortunes to the tune of tens of thousands of pounds — tens of Thousands of Pounds ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] ( [he]92-mr. bounderby repeated it with great relish ) . ‘ Now , [you]0-i have always been a steady Hand hitherto ; but [my]92-mr. bounderby opinion is , and so [I]92-mr. bounderby tell [you]0-i plainly , that [you]0-i are turning into [the wrong road]3355-the wrong road . [You]0-i have been listening to [some mischievous stranger or other]3356-some mischievous stranger or other — [they’re]3356-some mischievous stranger or other always about — and the best thing [you]0-i can do is , to come out of that . Now [you]0-i know ; ’[92-mr. bounderby] here [his]92-mr. bounderby countenance expressed marvellous acuteness ; ‘ [I]92-mr. bounderby can see as far into a grindstone as [another man]3357-another man ; farther than a good many , perhaps , because [I]92-mr. bounderby had [my]92-mr. bounderby nose well kept to it when [I]92-mr. bounderby was young . [I]92-mr. bounderby see traces of the turtle soup , and venison , and gold spoon in this . Yes , [I]92-mr. bounderby do ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] cried [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , shaking [his]92-mr. bounderby head with obstinate cunning . ‘ By [the Lord Harry]113-the lord harry , [I]92-mr. bounderby do ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] With a very different shake of the head and deep sigh , [Stephen]137-stephen said , ‘ Thank [you]92-mr. bounderby , [sir]2713-sir , [I]137-stephen wish [you]92-mr. bounderby good day . ’[137-stephen] So [he]137-stephen left [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby swelling at [his]92-mr. bounderby own portrait on the wall , as if [he]92-mr. bounderby were going to explode [himself]92-mr. bounderby into it ; and [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby still ambling on with [her]889-her foot in [her]889-her stirrup , looking quite cast down by the popular vices . CHAPTER XII [THE OLD WOMAN OLD STEPHEN]144-the old woman old stephen descended the two white steps , shutting the black door with the brazen door - plate , by the aid of the brazen full - stop , to which [he]137-stephen gave a parting polish with the sleeve of [his]137-stephen coat , observing that [his]137-stephen hot hand clouded it . [He]137-stephen crossed [the street]448-the street with [his]137-stephen eyes bent upon the ground , and thus was walking sorrowfully away , when [he]137-stephen felt a touch upon [his]137-stephen arm . It was not the touch [he]137-stephen needed most at such a moment — the touch that could calm the wild waters of [his]137-stephen soul , as the uplifted hand of the sublimest love and patience could abate the raging of [the sea]697-the sea — yet it was [a woman]892-a woman ’s hand too . [It]892-a woman was [an old woman]440-an old woman , tall and shapely still , though withered by time , on whom [his]137-stephen eyes fell when [he]137-stephen stopped and turned . [She]440-an old woman was very cleanly and plainly dressed , had country mud upon [her]440-an old woman shoes , and was newly come from a journey . The flutter of [her]440-an old woman manner , in the unwonted noise of [the streets]2931-the streets ; the spare shawl , carried unfolded on [her]440-an old woman arm ; the heavy umbrella , and little basket ; the loose long - fingered gloves , to which [her]440-an old woman hands were unused ; all bespoke [an old woman from [the country]2802-the country]895-an old woman from the country , in [her]440-an old woman plain holiday clothes , come into [Coketown]4-coketown on an expedition of rare occurrence . Remarking this at a glance , with the quick observation of [[his]137-stephen class]897-his class , [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen bent [his]137-stephen attentive face — [his]137-stephen face , which , like the faces of [many of [his]137-stephen order]898-many of his order , by dint of long working with eyes and hands in the midst of a prodigious noise , had acquired the concentrated look with which [we]899-we are familiar in the countenances of [the deaf]900-the deaf — the better to hear what [she]440-an old woman asked [him]137-stephen . ‘ Pray , [sir]2713-sir , ’[901-the old woman] said [the old woman]901-the old woman , ‘ did n’t [I]901-the old woman see [you]2713-sir come out of [[that gentleman]3041-that gentleman ’s house]3361-that gentleman ’s house ? ’[901-the old woman] pointing back to [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s . ‘ [I]901-the old woman believe it was [you]901-the old woman , unless [I]901-the old woman have had the bad luck to mistake [the person in following]3362-the person in following ? ’[901-the old woman] ‘ Yes , [missus]3363-missus , ’[137-stephen] returned [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘ it were [me]137-stephen . ’[137-stephen] ‘ Have [you]2713-sir — [you’ll]2713-sir excuse [an old woman]440-an old woman ’s curiosity — have [you]2713-sir seen [the gentleman]284-the gentleman ? ’[901-the old woman] ‘ Yes , [missus]3363-missus . ’[901-the old woman] ‘ And how did [he]284-the gentleman look , [sir]2713-sir ? Was [he]284-the gentleman portly , bold , outspoken , and hearty ? ’[902-her] As [she]902-her straightened [her]902-her own figure , and held up [her]902-her head in adapting [her]902-her action to [her]902-her words , the idea crossed [Stephen]137-stephen that [he]137-stephen had seen [this old woman]441-this old woman before , and had not quite liked [her]441-this old woman . ‘ O yes , ’[137-stephen] [he]137-stephen returned , observing [her]441-this old woman more attentively , ‘ [he]284-the gentleman were all that . ’[137-stephen] ‘ And healthy , ’[901-the old woman] said [the old woman]901-the old woman , ‘ as the fresh wind ? ’[901-the old woman] ‘ Yes , ’[137-stephen] returned [Stephen]137-stephen . ‘ [He]284-the gentleman were ett’n and drinking — as large and as loud as a Hummobee . ’[137-stephen] ‘ Thank [you]137-stephen ! ’[901-the old woman] said [the old woman]901-the old woman , with infinite content . ‘ Thank [you]137-stephen ! ’[901-the old woman] [He]137-stephen certainly never had seen [this old woman]441-this old woman before . Yet there was a vague remembrance in [his]137-stephen mind , as if [he]137-stephen had more than once dreamed of [some old woman like [her]441-this old woman]907-some old woman like her . [She]901-the old woman walked along at [his]137-stephen side , and , gently accommodating [himself]137-stephen to [her]901-the old woman humour , [he]137-stephen said [Coketown]4-coketown was [a busy place]908-a busy place , was it not ? To which [she]901-the old woman answered ‘ Eigh sure ! Dreadful busy ! ’[901-the old woman] Then [he]137-stephen said , [she]901-the old woman came from [the country]2802-the country , [he]137-stephen saw ? To which [she]901-the old woman answered in the affirmative . ‘ By Parliamentary , this morning . [I]901-the old woman came forty mile by [Parliamentary]20-parliamentary this morning , and [I]901-the old woman ’m[901-the old woman] going back [the same forty mile]910-the same forty mile this afternoon . [I]0-i walked nine mile to [the station]911-the station this morning , and if [I]0-i find [nobody]353-nobody on [the road]326-the road to give [me]0-i a lift , [I]0-i shall walk the nine mile back to - night . That ’s pretty well , [sir]2713-sir , at [my]0-i age ! ’ said [the chatty old woman]3368-the chatty old woman , [her]3368-the chatty old woman eye brightening with exultation . ‘[3363-missus] ’ Deed ’[3363-missus] tis . Do n’t do’t too often , [missus]3363-missus . ’ ‘[3363-missus] No , no . Once a year , ’ [she]918-i answered , shaking [her]3368-the chatty old woman head . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i spend [my]0-i savings so , once every year . [I]0-i come regular , to tramp about [the streets]2931-the streets , and see [the gentlemen]917-the gentlemen . ’ ‘[0-i] Only to see [’em]3369-’em ? ’[137-stephen] returned [Stephen]137-stephen . ‘ That ’s enough for [me]918-i , ’[918-i] [she]918-i replied , with great earnestness and interest of manner . ‘ [I]918-i ask no more ! [I]918-i have been standing about , on this side of the way , to see [that gentleman]3041-that gentleman , ’[918-i] turning [her]918-i head back towards [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s again , ‘ come out . But , [he]3041-that gentleman ’s late this year , and [I]918-i have not seen [him]3041-that gentleman . [You]137-stephen came out instead . Now , if [I]918-i am obliged to go back without a glimpse of [him]3041-that gentleman — [I]918-i only want a glimpse — well ! [I]918-i have seen [you]137-stephen , and [you]137-stephen have seen [him]3041-that gentleman , and [I]918-i must make that do . ’[918-i] Saying this , [she]918-i looked at [Stephen]137-stephen as if to fix [his]137-stephen features in [her]918-i mind , and [her]918-i eye was not so bright as it had been . With a large allowance for difference of tastes , and with all submission to [the patricians of [Coketown]4-coketown]919-the patricians of coketown , this seemed so extraordinary a source of interest to take so much trouble about , that it perplexed [him]137-stephen . But [they]920-they were passing [the church]2936-the church now , and as [his]137-stephen eye caught the clock , [he]137-stephen quickened [his]137-stephen pace . [He]137-stephen was going to [his]137-stephen work ? [the old woman]901-the old woman said , quickening [hers]901-the old woman , too , quite easily . Yes , time was nearly out . On [his]137-stephen telling [her]901-the old woman where [he]137-stephen worked , [the old woman]901-the old woman became [a more singular old woman than before]924-a more singular old woman than before . ‘ An’t [you]137-stephen happy ? ’[901-the old woman] [she]901-the old woman asked [him]137-stephen . ‘ Why — there ’s awmost nobbody but has [their]901-the old woman troubles , [missus]3363-missus . ’[901-the old woman] [He]137-stephen answered evasively , because [the old woman]901-the old woman appeared to take it for granted that [he]137-stephen would be very happy indeed , and [he]137-stephen had not the heart to disappoint [her]901-the old woman . [He]137-stephen knew that there was trouble enough in [the world]2766-the world ; and if [the old woman]901-the old woman had lived so long , and could count upon [his]137-stephen having so little , why so much the better for [her]901-the old woman , and none the worse for [him]137-stephen . ‘ Ay , ay ! [You]137-stephen have [your]137-stephen troubles at [home]336-home , [you]137-stephen mean ? ’[901-the old woman] [she]901-the old woman said . ‘ Times . Just now and then , ’[137-stephen] [he]137-stephen answered , slightly . ‘ But , working under [such a gentleman]3373-such a gentleman , [they]928-they do n’t follow [you]137-stephen to [the Factory]3374-the factory ? ’[137-stephen] No , no ; [they]928-they did n’t follow [him]137-stephen [there]412-there , said [Stephen]137-stephen . All correct there . Everything accordant [there]412-there . ( [He]137-stephen did not go so far as to say , for [her]901-the old woman pleasure , that there was a sort of Divine Right there ; but , [I]0-i have heard claims almost as magnificent of late years . ) [They]931-they were now in [the black by - road near [the place]329-the place]932-the black by - road near the place , and [the Hands]145-the coketown hands were crowding in . The bell was ringing , and the Serpent was a Serpent of many coils , and [the Elephant]934-the elephant was getting ready . [The strange old woman]935-the strange old woman was delighted with the very bell . It was the beautifullest bell [she]935-the strange old woman had ever heard , [she]935-the strange old woman said , and sounded grand ! [She]935-the strange old woman asked [him]137-stephen , when [he]137-stephen stopped good - naturedly to shake hands with [her]935-the strange old woman before going in , how long [he]137-stephen had worked [there]412-there ? ‘ A dozen year , ’[137-stephen] [he]137-stephen told [her]935-the strange old woman . ‘ [I]935-the strange old woman must kiss the hand , ’[935-the strange old woman] said [she]935-the strange old woman , ‘ that has worked in [this fine factory]3375-this fine factory for a dozen year ! ’[935-the strange old woman] And [she]935-the strange old woman lifted it , though [he]137-stephen would have prevented [her]935-the strange old woman , and put it to [her]935-the strange old woman lips . What harmony , besides [her]935-the strange old woman age and [her]935-the strange old woman simplicity , surrounded [her]935-the strange old woman , [he]137-stephen did not know , but even in this fantastic action there was a something neither out of time nor place : a something which it seemed as if [nobody else]937-nobody else could have made as serious , or done with such a natural and touching air . [He]137-stephen had been at [[his]137-stephen loom]938-his loom full half an hour , thinking about [this old woman]441-this old woman , when , having occasion to move round the loom for its adjustment , [he]137-stephen glanced through a window which was in [his]137-stephen corner , and saw [her]935-the strange old woman still looking up at [the pile of building]940-the pile of building , lost in admiration . Heedless of the smoke and mud and wet , and of [her]935-the strange old woman two long journeys , [she]935-the strange old woman was gazing at it , as if the heavy thrum that issued from its many stories were proud music to [her]935-the strange old woman . [She]935-the strange old woman was gone by and by , and the day went after [her]935-the strange old woman , and the lights sprung up again , and the Express whirled in full sight of [the Fairy Palace]941-the fairy palace over the arches near : little felt amid the jarring of the machinery , and scarcely heard above its crash and rattle . Long before then [his]137-stephen thoughts had gone back to [the dreary room above [the little shop]943-the little shop]942-the dreary room above the little shop , and to [the shameful figure heavy on the bed]944-the shameful figure heavy on the bed , but heavier on [his]137-stephen heart . Machinery slackened ; throbbing feebly like a fainting pulse ; stopped . The bell again ; the glare of light and heat dispelled ; [the factories]945-the factories , looming heavy in the black wet night — [their]945-the factories tall chimneys rising up into the air like [competing Towers of [Babel]21-babel]946-competing towers of babel . [He]137-stephen had spoken to [Rachael]140-rachael only last night , it was true , and had walked with [her]140-rachael a little way ; but [he]137-stephen had [his]137-stephen new misfortune on [him]137-stephen , in which [no one else]947-no one else could give [him]137-stephen a moment ’s relief , and , for the sake of it , and because [he]137-stephen knew [himself]137-stephen to want that softening of [his]137-stephen anger which no voice but [hers]140-rachael could effect , [he]137-stephen felt [he]137-stephen might so far disregard what [she]140-rachael had said as to wait for [her]140-rachael again . [He]137-stephen waited , but [she]140-rachael had eluded [him]137-stephen . [She]140-rachael was gone . On no other night in the year could [he]137-stephen so ill have spared [her]140-rachael patient face . O ! Better to have [no home in which to lay [his]137-stephen head]948-no home in which to lay his head , than to have [a home]949-a home and dread to go to it , through such a cause . [He]137-stephen ate and drank , for [he]137-stephen was exhausted — but [he]137-stephen little knew or cared what ; and [he]137-stephen wandered about in the chill rain , thinking and thinking , and brooding and brooding . No word of a new marriage had ever passed between [them]950-them ; but [Rachael]140-rachael had taken great pity on [him]137-stephen years ago , and to [her]140-rachael alone [he]137-stephen had opened [his]137-stephen closed heart all this time , on the subject of [his]137-stephen miseries ; and [he]137-stephen knew very well that if [he]137-stephen were free to ask [her]140-rachael , [she]140-rachael would take [him]137-stephen . [He]137-stephen thought of the home [he]137-stephen might at that moment have been seeking with pleasure and pride ; of [the different man [he]137-stephen might have been that night]951-the different man he might have been that night ; of the lightness then in [his]137-stephen now heavy - laden breast ; of the then restored honour , self - respect , and tranquillity all torn to pieces . [He]137-stephen thought of the waste of the best part of [his]137-stephen life , of the change it made in [his]137-stephen character for the worse every day , of the dreadful nature of [his]137-stephen existence , bound hand and foot , to [a dead woman]952-a dead woman , and tormented by [a demon in [her]952-a dead woman shape]953-a demon in her shape . [He]137-stephen thought of [Rachael]140-rachael , how young when [they]954-they were first brought together in these circumstances , how mature now , how soon to grow old . [He]137-stephen thought of the number of [girls]2709-girls and [women]574-women [she]140-rachael had seen marry , how many homes with [children]643-children in [them]958-them [she]140-rachael had seen grow up around [her]140-rachael , how [she]140-rachael had contentedly pursued [her]140-rachael own lone quiet path — for [him]137-stephen — and how [he]137-stephen had sometimes seen a shade of melancholy on [her]140-rachael blessed face , that smote [him]137-stephen with remorse and despair . [He]137-stephen set the picture of [her]140-rachael up , beside the infamous image of last night ; and thought , Could it be , that the whole earthly course of one so gentle , good , and self - denying , was subjugate to [such a wretch as that]959-such a wretch as that ! Filled with these thoughts — so filled that [he]137-stephen had an unwholesome sense of growing larger , of being placed in some new and diseased relation towards the objects among which [he]137-stephen passed , of seeing the iris round every misty light turn red — [he]137-stephen went [home]336-home for shelter . CHAPTER XIII [RACHAEL]140-rachael A CANDLE faintly burned in the window , to which the black ladder had often been raised for the sliding away of all that was most precious in [this world]961-this world to [a striving wife]962-a striving wife and [a brood of hungry babies]963-a brood of hungry babies ; and [Stephen]137-stephen added to [his]137-stephen other thoughts the stern reflection , that of [all the casualties of this existence upon earth]964-all the casualties of this existence upon earth , not one was dealt out with so unequal a hand as Death . The inequality of Birth was nothing to it . For , say that [the child of a King]965-the child of a king and [the child of [a Weaver]881-a weaver]966-the child of a weaver were born to - night in the same moment , what was that disparity , to the death of [any human creature who was serviceable to , or beloved by , another]968-any human creature who was serviceable to , or beloved by , another , while [this abandoned woman]969-this abandoned woman lived on ! From the outside of [[his]137-stephen home]3301-his home [he]137-stephen gloomily passed to the inside , with suspended breath and with a slow footstep . [He]137-stephen went up to [his]137-stephen door , opened it , and so into [the room]2859-the room . Quiet and peace were there . [Rachael]140-rachael was there , sitting by the bed . [She]140-rachael turned [her]140-rachael head , and the light of [her]140-rachael face shone in upon the midnight of [his]137-stephen mind . [She]140-rachael sat by the bed , watching and tending [[his]137-stephen wife]972-his wife . That is to say , [he]137-stephen saw that [some one]973-some one lay there , and [he]137-stephen knew too well it must be [she]140-rachael ; but [Rachael]140-rachael ’s hands had put a curtain up , so that [she]140-rachael was screened from [his]137-stephen eyes . [Her]140-rachael disgraceful garments were removed , and some of [Rachael]140-rachael ’s were in [the room]2859-the room . Everything was in its place and order as [he]137-stephen had always kept it , the little fire was newly trimmed , and the hearth was freshly swept . It appeared to [him]137-stephen that [he]137-stephen saw all this in [Rachael]140-rachael ’s face , and looked at nothing besides . While looking at it , it was shut out from [his]137-stephen view by the softened tears that filled [his]137-stephen eyes ; but not before [he]137-stephen had seen how earnestly [she]140-rachael looked at [him]137-stephen , and how [her]140-rachael own eyes were filled too . [She]140-rachael turned again towards the bed , and satisfying [herself]140-rachael that all was quiet there , spoke in a low , calm , cheerful voice . ‘ [I]140-rachael am glad [you]137-stephen have come at last , [Stephen]137-stephen . [You]137-stephen are very late . ’[140-rachael] ‘ [I]140-rachael ha ’[140-rachael] been walking up an ’ down . ’[140-rachael] ‘ [I]140-rachael thought so . But ’[140-rachael] tis too bad a night for that . The rain falls very heavy , and the wind has risen . ’ The wind ? True . It was blowing hard . Hark to the thundering in the chimney , and the surging noise ! To have been out in such a wind , and not to have known it was blowing ! ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have been [here]354-here once before , to - day , [Stephen]137-stephen . [Landlady]976-landlady came round for [me]0-i at dinner - time . There was [some one here that needed looking to]977-some one here that needed looking to , [she]140-rachael said . And ‘ deed [she]140-rachael was right . All wandering and lost , [Stephen]137-stephen . Wounded too , and bruised . ’[137-stephen] [He]137-stephen slowly moved to a chair and sat down , drooping [his]137-stephen head before [her]140-rachael . ‘ [I]137-stephen came to do what little [I]137-stephen could , [Stephen]137-stephen ; first , for that [she]140-rachael worked with [me]137-stephen when [we]3376-we were [girls]2709-girls both , and for that [you]137-stephen courted [her]140-rachael and married [her]140-rachael when [I]137-stephen was [[her]140-rachael friend]3378-her friend — ’[137-stephen] [He]137-stephen laid [his]137-stephen furrowed forehead on [his]137-stephen hand , with a low groan . ‘ And next , for that [I]137-stephen know [your]137-stephen heart , and am right sure and certain that ’[137-stephen] tis far too merciful to let [her]140-rachael die , or even so much as suffer , for want of aid . [Thou]978-thou knowest who said , “ Let [him]979-him who is without sin among [you]978-thou cast the first stone at [her]140-rachael ! ” There have been plenty to do that . [Thou]978-thou art not [the man to cast the last stone]980-the man to cast the last stone , [Stephen]137-stephen , when [she]140-rachael is brought so low . ’ ‘[978-thou] O [Rachael]140-rachael , [Rachael]140-rachael ! ’ ‘[140-rachael] [Thou]978-thou hast been [a cruel sufferer]981-a cruel sufferer , [Heaven]80-heaven reward [thee]978-thou ! ’ [she]140-rachael said , in compassionate accents . ‘[80-heaven] [I]0-i am [[thy]978-thou poor friend]982-thy poor friend , with all [my]0-i heart and mind . ’ [ Picture : [Stephen]137-stephen and [Rachael]140-rachael in [the sick room]3379-the sick room ] The wounds of which [she]140-rachael had spoken , seemed to be about the neck of [the self - made outcast]3380-the self - made outcast . [She]140-rachael dressed them now , still without showing [her]140-rachael . [She]140-rachael steeped a piece of linen in a basin , into which [she]140-rachael poured some liquid from a bottle , and laid it with a gentle hand upon the sore . The three - legged table had been drawn close to the bedside , and on it there were two bottles . This was one . It was not so far off , but that [Stephen]137-stephen , following [her]140-rachael hands with [his]137-stephen eyes , could read what was printed on it in large letters . [He]137-stephen turned of a deadly hue , and a sudden horror seemed to fall upon [him]137-stephen . ‘[80-heaven] [I]0-i will stay here , [Stephen]137-stephen , ’ said [Rachael]140-rachael , quietly resuming [her]140-rachael seat , ‘[137-stephen] till the bells go Three . ’ Tis to be done again at three , and then [she]140-rachael may be left till morning . ’[137-stephen] ‘ But [thy]983-thou rest agen to - morrow ’s work , [[my]80-heaven dear]3090-my dear . ’[80-heaven] ‘ [I]137-stephen slept sound last night . [I]137-stephen can wake many nights , when [I]137-stephen am put to it . ’[137-stephen] Tis [thou]983-thou [who art in need of rest]984-who art in need of rest — so white and tired . Try to sleep in the chair there , while [I]0-i watch . [Thou]983-thou hadst no sleep last night , [I]0-i can well believe . To - morrow ’s work is far harder for [thee]983-thou than for [me]0-i . ’ [He]137-stephen heard the thundering and surging out of doors , and it seemed to [him]137-stephen as if [his]137-stephen late angry mood were going about trying to get at [him]137-stephen . [She]985-she had cast it out ; [she]985-she would keep it out ; [he]137-stephen trusted to [her]985-she to defend [him]137-stephen from [himself]137-stephen . ‘[985-she] [She]985-she do n’t know [me]0-i , [Stephen]137-stephen ; [she]985-she just drowsily mutters and stares . [I]0-i have spoken to [her]985-she times and again , but [she]985-she do n’t notice ! ’ Tis as well so . When [she]985-she comes to [her]985-she right mind once more , [I]985-she shall have done what [I]985-she can , and [she]985-she never the wiser . ’[985-she] ‘ How long , [Rachael]140-rachael , is ’[985-she] t looked for , that [she]985-she ’ll be so ? ’ ‘[146-doctor] [Doctor]146-doctor said [she]985-she would haply come to [her]985-she mind to - morrow . ’ [His]137-stephen eyes fell again on the bottle , and a tremble passed over [him]137-stephen , causing [him]137-stephen to shiver in every limb . [She]985-she thought [he]137-stephen was chilled with the wet . ‘[985-she] No , ’ [he]137-stephen said , ‘[985-she] it was not that . [He]985-she had had a fright . ’ ‘[985-she] A fright ? ’ ‘[985-she] Ay , ay ! coming in . When [I]0-i were walking . When [I]0-i were thinking . When [I]0-i — ’ It seized [him]137-stephen again ; and [he]137-stephen stood up , holding by the mantel - shelf , as [he]137-stephen pressed [his]137-stephen dank cold hair down with a hand that shook as if it were palsied . ‘[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen ! ’ [She]985-she was coming to [him]137-stephen , but [he]137-stephen stretched out [his]137-stephen arm to stop [her]985-she . ‘[137-stephen] No ! Do n’t , please ; do n’t . Let [me]0-i see [thee]985-she setten by the bed . Let [me]0-i see [thee]985-she , a ’ so good , and so forgiving . Let [me]0-i see [thee]985-she as [I]0-i see [thee]985-she when [I]0-i coom in . [I]0-i can never see [thee]985-she better than so . Never , never , never ! ’[0-i] [He]137-stephen had a violent fit of trembling , and then sunk into [his]137-stephen chair . After a time [he]137-stephen controlled [himself]137-stephen , and , resting with an elbow on one knee , and [his]137-stephen head upon that hand , could look towards [Rachael]140-rachael . Seen across the dim candle with [his]137-stephen moistened eyes , [she]140-rachael looked as if [she]140-rachael had a glory shining round [her]140-rachael head . [He]137-stephen could have believed [she]140-rachael had . [He]137-stephen did believe it , as the noise without shook the window , rattled at the door below , and went about [the house]2875-the house clamouring and lamenting . ‘ When [she]140-rachael gets better , [Stephen]137-stephen , ’[140-rachael] tis to be hoped [she]140-rachael ’ll leave [thee]137-stephen to [thyself]987-thyself again , and do [thee]137-stephen no more hurt . Anyways [we]988-we will hope so now . And now [I]0-i shall keep silence , for [I]0-i want [thee]137-stephen to sleep . ’ [He]137-stephen closed [his]137-stephen eyes , more to please [her]140-rachael than to rest [his]137-stephen weary head ; but , by slow degrees as [he]137-stephen listened to the great noise of the wind , [he]137-stephen ceased to hear it , or it changed into the working of [his]137-stephen loom , or even into the voices of the day ( [his]137-stephen own included ) saying what had been really said . Even this imperfect consciousness faded away at last , and [he]137-stephen dreamed a long , troubled dream . [He]137-stephen thought that [he]137-stephen , and [some one on whom [his]137-stephen heart had long been set]3382-some one on whom his heart had long been set — but [she]140-rachael was not [Rachael]140-rachael , and that surprised [him]137-stephen , even in the midst of [his]137-stephen imaginary happiness — stood in [the church]2936-the church being married . While the ceremony was performing , and while [he]137-stephen recognized among [the witnesses some whom [he]137-stephen knew to be living , and many whom [he]137-stephen knew to be dead]3384-the witnesses some whom he knew to be living , and many whom he knew to be dead , darkness came on , succeeded by the shining of a tremendous light . It broke from one line in the table of commandments at the altar , and illuminated [the building]3385-the building with the words . They were sounded through [the church]2936-the church , too , as if there were voices in the fiery letters . Upon this , the whole appearance before [him]137-stephen and around [him]137-stephen changed , and nothing was left as it had been , but [himself]137-stephen and [the clergyman]3387-the clergyman . [They]3384-the witnesses some whom he knew to be living , and many whom he knew to be dead stood in the daylight before a crowd so vast , that if [all the people in [the world]2766-the world]3388-all the people in the world could have been brought together into one space , [they]3384-the witnesses some whom he knew to be living , and many whom he knew to be dead could not have looked , [he]137-stephen thought , more numerous ; and [they]3384-the witnesses some whom he knew to be living , and many whom he knew to be dead all abhorred [him]137-stephen , and there was not one pitying or friendly eye among the millions that were fastened on [his]137-stephen face . [He]137-stephen stood on a raised stage , under [his]137-stephen own loom ; and , looking up at the shape the loom took , and hearing the burial service distinctly read , [he]137-stephen knew that [he]137-stephen was there to suffer death . In an instant what [he]137-stephen stood on fell below [him]137-stephen , and [he]137-stephen was gone . — Out of what mystery [he]137-stephen came back to [his]137-stephen usual life , and to places that [he]137-stephen knew , [he]137-stephen was unable to consider ; but [he]137-stephen was back in [those places]3390-those places by some means , and with this condemnation upon [him]137-stephen , that [he]137-stephen was never , in [this world]961-this world or the next , through all the unimaginable ages of eternity , to look on [Rachael]140-rachael ’s face or hear [her]140-rachael voice . Wandering to and fro , unceasingly , without hope , and in search of [he]137-stephen knew not what ( [he]137-stephen only knew that [he]137-stephen was doomed to seek it ) , [he]137-stephen was [the subject of a nameless , horrible dread , a mortal fear of one particular shape which everything took]3392-the subject of a nameless , horrible dread , a mortal fear of one particular shape which everything took . Whatsoever [he]137-stephen looked at , grew into that form sooner or later . The object of [his]137-stephen miserable existence was to prevent its recognition by [any one among [the various people [he]137-stephen encountered]3394-the various people he encountered]3393-any one among the various people he encountered . Hopeless labour ! If [he]137-stephen led [them]3395-them out of [rooms where it was]3396-rooms where it was , if [he]137-stephen shut up drawers and closets where [it]3397-it stood , if [he]137-stephen drew the curious from places where [he]137-stephen knew it to be secreted , and got [them]3395-them out into [the streets]2931-the streets , [the very chimneys of [the mills]3400-the mills]3399-the very chimneys of the mills assumed that shape , and round [them]3399-the very chimneys of the mills was the printed word . The wind was blowing again , the rain was beating on the house - tops , and the larger spaces through which [he]137-stephen had strayed contracted to the four walls of [[his]137-stephen room]3401-his room . Saving that the fire had died out , it was as [his]137-stephen eyes had closed upon it . [Rachael]140-rachael seemed to have fallen into a doze , in the chair by the bed . [She]140-rachael sat wrapped in [her]140-rachael shawl , perfectly still . The table stood in the same place , close by the bedside , and on [it]3402-it , in its real proportions and appearance , was the shape so often repeated . [He]137-stephen thought [he]137-stephen saw the curtain move . [He]137-stephen looked again , and [he]137-stephen was sure it moved . [He]137-stephen saw a hand come forth and grope about a little . Then the curtain moved more perceptibly , and [the woman in the bed]3403-the woman in the bed put it back , and sat up . With [her]3403-the woman in the bed woful eyes , so haggard and wild , so heavy and large , [she]3403-the woman in the bed looked all round [the room]2859-the room , and passed the corner where [he]137-stephen slept in [his]137-stephen chair . [Her]3403-the woman in the bed eyes returned to that corner , and [she]3403-the woman in the bed put [her]3403-the woman in the bed hand over them as a shade , while [she]3403-the woman in the bed looked into it . Again [they]3405-them went all round [the room]2859-the room , scarcely heeding [Rachael]140-rachael if at all , and returned to that corner . [He]137-stephen thought , as [she]3403-the woman in the bed once more shaded [them]3405-them — not so much looking at [him]137-stephen , as looking for [him]137-stephen with a brutish instinct that [he]137-stephen was there — that no single trace was left in those debauched features , or in the mind that went along with [them]3405-them , of [the woman [he]137-stephen had married eighteen years before]3407-the woman he had married eighteen years before . But that [he]137-stephen had seen [her]3403-the woman in the bed come to this by inches , [he]137-stephen never could have believed [her]3403-the woman in the bed to be the same . All this time , as if a spell were on [him]137-stephen , [he]137-stephen was motionless and powerless , except to watch [her]3403-the woman in the bed . Stupidly dozing , or communing with [her]3403-the woman in the bed incapable self about nothing , [she]3403-the woman in the bed sat for a little while with [her]3403-the woman in the bed hands at [her]3403-the woman in the bed ears , and [her]3403-the woman in the bed head resting on them . Presently , [she]3403-the woman in the bed resumed [her]3403-the woman in the bed staring round [the room]2859-the room . And now , for the first time , [her]3403-the woman in the bed eyes stopped at the table with the bottles on it . Straightway [she]3403-the woman in the bed turned [her]3403-the woman in the bed eyes back to [his]137-stephen corner , with the defiance of last night , and moving very cautiously and softly , stretched out [her]3403-the woman in the bed greedy hand . [She]3403-the woman in the bed drew a mug into the bed , and sat for a while considering which of the two bottles [she]3403-the woman in the bed should choose . Finally , [she]3403-the woman in the bed laid [her]3403-the woman in the bed insensate grasp upon the bottle that had swift and certain death in it , and , before [his]137-stephen eyes , pulled out the cork with [her]3403-the woman in the bed teeth . Dream or reality , [he]137-stephen had no voice , nor had [he]137-stephen power to stir . If this be real , and [her]3403-the woman in the bed allotted time be not yet come , wake , [Rachael]140-rachael , wake ! [She]3403-the woman in the bed thought of that , too . [She]3403-the woman in the bed looked at [Rachael]140-rachael , and very slowly , very cautiously , poured out the contents . The draught was at [her]3403-the woman in the bed lips . A moment and [she]3403-the woman in the bed would be past all help , let [the whole world]3409-the whole world wake and come about [her]3403-the woman in the bed with its utmost power . But in that moment [Rachael]140-rachael started up with a suppressed cry . [The creature]3410-the creature struggled , struck [her]3403-the woman in the bed , seized [her]3403-the woman in the bed by the hair ; but [Rachael]140-rachael had the cup . [Stephen]137-stephen broke out of [his]137-stephen chair . ‘[0-i] [Rachael]140-rachael , am [I]0-i wakin ’ or dreamin ’[0-i] this dreadfo ’ night ? ’[0-i] ‘ ’[137-stephen] Tis all well , [Stephen]137-stephen . [I]0-i have been asleep , [myself]0-i . ’ Tis near three . Hush ! [I]0-i hear the bells . ’[0-i] The wind brought the sounds of the church clock to the window . [They]989-they listened , and it struck three . [Stephen]137-stephen looked at [her]140-rachael , saw how pale [she]140-rachael was , noted the disorder of [her]140-rachael hair , and the red marks of fingers on [her]140-rachael forehead , and felt assured that [his]137-stephen senses of sight and hearing had been awake . [She]140-rachael held the cup in [her]140-rachael hand even now . ‘ [I]140-rachael thought it must be near three , ’[140-rachael] [she]140-rachael said , calmly pouring from the cup into the basin , and steeping the linen as before . ‘ [I]140-rachael am thankful [I]140-rachael stayed ! ’[140-rachael] Tis done now , when [I]0-i have put this on . There ! And now [she]140-rachael ’s quiet again . [She]140-rachael had nothing to do , then , but to cover [herself]140-rachael with [her]140-rachael shawl before going out into the wind and rain . ‘ [Thou’lt]992-thou’lt let [me]140-rachael walk wi ’[140-rachael] [thee]140-rachael at this hour , [Rachael]140-rachael ? ’ ‘[140-rachael] No , [Stephen]137-stephen . ’ Tis but a minute , and [I]140-rachael ’m[140-rachael] [home]336-home . ’ ‘[140-rachael] [Thou’rt]992-thou’lt not fearfo ’ ; ’[137-stephen] [he]137-stephen said it in a low voice , as [they]993-they went out at the door ; ‘ to leave [me]137-stephen alone wi ’[137-stephen] [her]140-rachael ! ’ As [she]140-rachael looked at [him]137-stephen , saying , ‘[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen ? ’ [he]137-stephen went down on [his]137-stephen knee before [her]140-rachael , on the poor mean stairs , and put an end of [her]140-rachael shawl to [his]137-stephen lips . ‘[137-stephen] [Thou]994-thou art [an Angel]995-an angel . The wind blew from [the quarter where the day would soon appear]3420-the quarter where the day would soon appear , and still blew strongly . It had cleared the sky before it , and the rain had spent itself or travelled elsewhere , and the stars were bright . [He]0-i stood bare - headed in [the road]326-the road , watching [her]998-a working woman quick disappearance . As the shining stars were to the heavy candle in the window , so was [Rachael]140-rachael , in the rugged fancy of [this man]2949-this man , to the common experiences of [his]0-i life . CHAPTER XIV [THE GREAT MANUFACTURER TIME]3423-the great manufacturer time went on in [Coketown]4-coketown like [its]3423-the great manufacturer time own machinery : so much material wrought up , so much fuel consumed , so many powers worn out , so much money made . But , less inexorable than iron , steel , and brass , it brought its varying seasons even into that wilderness of smoke and brick , and made the only stand that ever _ was _ made in [the place]329-the place against its direful uniformity . ‘[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa is becoming , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[1002-a young woman] almost [a young woman]1002-a young woman . ’ Time , with [his]0-i innumerable horse - power , worked away , not minding what [anybody]2845-anybody said , and presently turned out [young [Thomas]75-tom a foot taller than when [[his]75-tom father]494-his father had last taken particular notice of [him]75-tom]3426-young thomas a foot taller than when his father had last taken particular notice of him . ‘[1002-a young woman] [Thomas]75-tom is becoming , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[3001-a young man] almost [a young man]3001-a young man . ’ Time passed [Thomas]75-tom on in [the mill]3428-the mill , while [[his]75-tom father]494-his father was thinking about it , and there [he]75-tom stood in a long - tailed coat and a stiff shirt - collar . ‘[3001-a young man] Really , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[3001-a young man] the period has arrived when [Thomas]75-tom ought to go to [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ’ Time , sticking to [him]75-tom , passed [him]75-tom on into [[Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s Bank]3430-bounderby ’s bank , made [him]75-tom [an inmate of [[Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s house]3432-bounderby ’s house]3431-an inmate of bounderby ’s house , necessitated the purchase of [his]75-tom first razor , and exercised [him]75-tom diligently in [his]75-tom calculations relative to number one . [The same great manufacturer , always with an immense variety of work on hand , in every stage of development]3433-the same great manufacturer , always with an immense variety of work on hand , in every stage of development , passed [Sissy]76-sissy onward in [[his]3433-the same great manufacturer , always with an immense variety of work on hand , in every stage of development mill]3434-his mill , and worked [her]76-sissy up into a very pretty article indeed . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i fear , [Jupe]76-sissy , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[76-sissy] that [your]76-sissy continuance at [the school]2778-the school any longer would be useless . ’ ‘[76-sissy] [I]0-i am afraid it would , [sir]2713-sir , ’ [Sissy]76-sissy answered with a curtsey . ‘[2713-sir] [I]0-i can not disguise from [you]76-sissy , [Jupe]76-sissy , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , knitting [his]75-tom brow , ‘[76-sissy] that the result of [your]76-sissy probation there has disappointed [me]0-i ; has greatly disappointed [me]0-i . [You]76-sissy have not acquired , under [Mr.]1006-mr. and [Mrs. M’Choakumchild]136-mrs. m’choakumchild , anything like that amount of exact knowledge which [I]0-i looked for . [You]76-sissy are extremely deficient in [your]76-sissy facts . [Your]76-sissy acquaintance with [figures]444-figures is very limited . [You]76-sissy are altogether backward , and below the mark . ’ ‘[76-sissy] [I]0-i am sorry , [sir]2713-sir , ’ [she]76-sissy returned ; ‘[76-sissy] but [I]0-i know it is quite true . Yet [I]0-i have tried hard , [sir]2713-sir . ’ ‘[0-i] Yes , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[0-i] yes , [I]0-i believe [you]76-sissy have tried hard ; [I]0-i have observed [you]76-sissy , and [I]0-i can find no fault in that respect . ’ ‘[0-i] Thank [you]2713-sir , [sir]2713-sir . [I]0-i have thought sometimes ; ’ [Sissy]76-sissy very timid here ; ‘[0-i] that perhaps [I]0-i tried to learn too much , and that if [I]0-i had asked to be allowed to try a little less , [I]0-i might have — ’ ‘[0-i] No , [Jupe]76-sissy , no , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , shaking [his]75-tom head in [his]75-tom profoundest and most eminently practical way . ‘[0-i] No . The course [you]76-sissy pursued , [you]76-sissy pursued according to the system — the system — and there is no more to be said about it . [I]0-i can only suppose that the circumstances of [your]76-sissy early life were too unfavourable to the development of [your]76-sissy reasoning powers , and that [we]1011-we began too late . Still , as [I]0-i have said already , [I]0-i am disappointed . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could have made a better acknowledgment , [sir]2713-sir , of [your]2713-sir kindness to [a poor forlorn girl who had no claim upon [you]2713-sir , and of [your]2713-sir protection of [her]1014-her]1013-a poor forlorn girl who had no claim upon you , and of your protection of her . ’ ‘[2713-sir] Do n’t shed tears , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . ‘[2713-sir] Do n’t shed tears . [I]0-i do n’t complain of [you]76-sissy . [You]76-sissy are [an affectionate , earnest , good young woman]1015-an affectionate , earnest , good young woman — and — and [we]1011-we must make that do . ’ ‘[76-sissy] Thank [you]2713-sir , [sir]2713-sir , very much , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , with a grateful curtsey . ‘[2713-sir] [You]76-sissy are useful to [Mrs. Gradgrind]94-mrs. gradgrind , and ( in a generally pervading way ) [you]76-sissy are serviceable in [the family]1017-the family also ; so [I]0-i understand from [Miss Louisa]91-louisa , and , indeed , so [I]0-i have observed [myself]0-i . [I]0-i therefore hope , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[0-i] that [you]76-sissy can make [yourself]76-sissy happy in those relations . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i should have nothing to wish , [sir]2713-sir , if — ’ ‘[76-sissy] [I]0-i understand [you]76-sissy , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom ; ‘[76-sissy] [you]76-sissy still refer to [[your]76-sissy father]2725-your father . [I]0-i have heard from [Miss Louisa]91-louisa that [you]76-sissy still preserve that bottle . Well ! If [your]76-sissy training in the science of arriving at exact results had been more successful , [you]76-sissy would have been wiser on these points . [I]0-i will say no more . ’ [He]2713-sir really liked [Sissy]76-sissy too well to have a contempt for [her]76-sissy ; otherwise [he]2713-sir held [her]76-sissy calculating powers in such very slight estimation that [he]2713-sir must have fallen upon that conclusion . Somehow or other , [he]2713-sir had become possessed by an idea that there was something in [this girl]423-this girl which could hardly be set forth in a tabular form . [Her]76-sissy capacity of definition might be easily stated at a very low figure , [her]76-sissy mathematical knowledge at nothing ; yet [he]2713-sir was not sure that if [he]2713-sir had been required , for example , to tick [her]76-sissy off into columns in a parliamentary return , [he]2713-sir would have quite known how to divide [her]76-sissy . In some stages of [his]2713-sir manufacture of the human fabric , the processes of Time are very rapid . [Young Thomas]75-tom and [Sissy]76-sissy being both at such a stage of [their]3436-their working up , these changes were effected in a year or two ; while [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom [himself]75-tom seemed stationary in [his]75-tom course , and underwent no alteration . Except one , which was apart from [his]75-tom necessary progress through [the mill]3428-the mill . Time hustled [him]75-tom into a little noisy and rather dirty machinery , in a by - comer , and made [him]75-tom Member of [Parliament]3438-parliament for [Coketown]4-coketown : one of [the respected members for ounce weights and measures]3439-the respected members for ounce weights and measures , [one of [the representatives of the multiplication table]3441-the representatives of the multiplication table]3440-one of the representatives of the multiplication table , one of [the deaf honourable gentlemen]3442-the deaf honourable gentlemen , [dumb honourable gentlemen]3443-dumb honourable gentlemen , [blind honourable gentlemen]3444-blind honourable gentlemen , [lame honourable gentlemen]3445-lame honourable gentlemen , [dead honourable gentlemen]3446-dead honourable gentlemen , to every other consideration . Else wherefore live [we]3447-we in [a Christian land]3448-a christian land , eighteen hundred and odd years after [[our]3447-we Master]3449-our master ? All this while , [Louisa]91-louisa had been passing on , so quiet and reserved , and so much given to watching the bright ashes at twilight as they fell into the grate , and became extinct , that from the period when [[her]91-louisa father]335-her father had said [she]91-louisa was almost [a young woman]1002-a young woman — which seemed but yesterday — [she]91-louisa had scarcely attracted [his]335-her father notice again , when [he]335-her father found [her]91-louisa quite [a young woman]1002-a young woman . ‘[0-i] Quite [a young woman]1002-a young woman , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , musing . ‘[2972-dear] [Dear]2972-dear [me]0-i ! ’ Soon after this discovery , [he]75-tom became more thoughtful than usual for several days , and seemed much engrossed by one subject . On a certain night , when [he]75-tom was going out , and [Louisa]91-louisa came to bid [him]75-tom good - bye before [his]75-tom departure — as [he]75-tom was not to be [home]336-home until late and [she]91-louisa would not see [him]75-tom again until the morning — [he]75-tom held [her]91-louisa in [his]75-tom arms , looking at [her]91-louisa in [his]75-tom kindest manner , and said : ‘[2972-dear] [[My]0-i dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , [you]91-louisa are [a woman]892-a woman ! ’ [She]91-louisa answered with the old , quick , searching look of the night when [she]91-louisa was found at [the Circus]394-the circus ; then cast down [her]91-louisa eyes . ‘[2723-father] Yes , [father]2723-father . ’ ‘[2723-father] [[My]0-i dear]3090-my dear , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[2723-father] [I]0-i must speak with [you]91-louisa alone and seriously . Come to [me]0-i in [[my]0-i room]1026-my room after breakfast to - morrow , will [you]91-louisa ? ’ ‘[2723-father] Yes , [father]2723-father . ’ ‘[2723-father] [Your]91-louisa hands are rather cold , [Louisa]91-louisa . Are [you]91-louisa not well ? ’ ‘[2723-father] Quite well , [father]2723-father . ’ ‘[2723-father] And cheerful ? ’ [She]91-louisa looked at [him]2723-father again , and smiled in [her]91-louisa peculiar manner . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am as cheerful , [father]2723-father , as [I]0-i usually am , or usually have been . ’ ‘[0-i] That ’s well , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . So , [he]2723-father kissed [her]91-louisa and went away ; and [Louisa]91-louisa returned to [the serene apartment of the hair - cutting character]3455-the serene apartment of the hair - cutting character , and leaning [her]91-louisa elbow on [her]91-louisa hand , looked again at the short - lived sparks that so soon subsided into ashes . ‘[0-i] Are [you]91-louisa there , [Loo]100-loo ? ’ said [[her]91-louisa brother]2889-her brother , looking in at the door . [He]2889-her brother was quite [a young gentleman of pleasure]3457-a young gentleman of pleasure now , and [not quite a prepossessing one]3458-not quite a prepossessing one . ‘[91-louisa] Dear [Tom]75-tom , ’ [she]91-louisa answered , rising and embracing [him]75-tom , ‘[100-loo] how long it is since [you]75-tom have been to see [me]0-i ! ’ ‘[75-tom] Why , [I]0-i have been otherwise engaged , [Loo]100-loo , in the evenings ; and in the daytime [old Bounderby]100-loo has been keeping [me]0-i at it rather . But [I]0-i touch [him]1030-him up with [you]75-tom when [he]1030-him comes it too strong , and so [we]1031-we preserve an understanding . [I]0-i say ! Has [father]2723-father said anything particular to [you]75-tom to - day or yesterday , [Loo]100-loo ? ’ ‘[2723-father] No , [Tom]75-tom . But [he]2723-father told [me]0-i to - night that [he]2723-father wished to do so in the morning . ’ ‘[2723-father] Ah ! That ’s what [I]0-i mean , ’ said [Tom]75-tom . ‘[2723-father] Do [you]75-tom know where [he]2723-father is to - night?’—with a very deep expression . ‘ No . ’[75-tom] ‘ Then [I]1033-i ’ll tell [you]75-tom . [He]2723-father ’s with [old Bounderby]100-loo . [They]3459-they are having a regular confab together up at [the Bank]3460-the bank . Why at [the Bank]3460-the bank , do [you]75-tom think ? Well , [I]1033-i ’ll tell [you]75-tom again . To keep [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby ’s ears as far off as possible , [I]1033-i expect . ’[1033-i] With [her]1033-i hand upon [[her]1033-i brother]2889-her brother ’s shoulder , [Louisa]91-louisa still stood looking at the fire . [[Her]1033-i brother]2889-her brother glanced at [her]91-louisa face with greater interest than usual , and , encircling [her]91-louisa waist with [his]2889-her brother arm , drew [her]91-louisa coaxingly to [him]2889-her brother . ‘ [You]75-tom are very fond of [me]2889-her brother , an’t [you]75-tom , [Loo]100-loo ? ’[2889-her brother] ‘ Indeed [I]2889-her brother am , [Tom]75-tom , though [you]75-tom do let such long intervals go by without coming to see [me]2889-her brother . ’[2889-her brother] ‘ Well , sister of [mine]75-tom , ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom , ‘ when [you]91-louisa say that , [you]91-louisa are near [my]75-tom thoughts . [We]3462-we might be so much oftener together — mightn’t [we]3462-we ? Always together , almost — mightn’t [we]3462-we ? It would do [me]75-tom a great deal of good if [you]91-louisa were to make up [your]91-louisa mind to [I]75-tom know what , [Loo]100-loo . It would be a splendid thing for [me]75-tom . It would be uncommonly jolly ! ’[75-tom] [Her]1036-i thoughtfulness baffled [his]75-tom cunning scrutiny . [He]75-tom could make nothing of [her]1036-i face . [He]75-tom pressed [her]1036-i in [his]75-tom arm , and kissed [her]1036-i cheek . [She]1036-i returned the kiss , but still looked at the fire . ‘ [I]1036-i say , [Loo]100-loo ! [I]1036-i thought [I]1036-i ’d come , and just hint to [you]100-loo what was going on : though [I]1036-i supposed [you]100-loo ’d most likely guess , even if [you]100-loo did n’t know . [I]1036-i ca n’t stay , because [I]1036-i ’m[1036-i] engaged to [some fellows]1037-some fellows to - night . [You]75-tom wo n’t forget how fond [you]75-tom are of [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[75-tom] No , dear [Tom]75-tom , [I]0-i wo n’t forget . ’ ‘[0-i] That ’s [a capital girl]1038-a capital girl , ’ said [Tom]75-tom . ‘[0-i] Good - bye , [Loo]100-loo . ’ [She]1036-i gave [him]75-tom an affectionate good - night , and went out with [him]75-tom to the door , whence the fires of [Coketown]4-coketown could be seen , making the distance lurid . [She]1036-i stood there , looking steadfastly towards [them]3463-them , and listening to [his]75-tom departing steps . [They]3463-them retreated quickly , as glad to get away from [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge ; and [she]1036-i stood there yet , when [he]75-tom was gone and all was quiet . It seemed as if , first in [her]1036-i own fire within [the house]2875-the house , and then in the fiery haze without , [she]1036-i tried to discover what kind of woof Old Time , [that greatest and longest - established Spinner of all]3465-that greatest and longest - established spinner of all , would weave from the threads [he]75-tom had already spun into [a woman]892-a woman . But [[his]75-tom factory]3467-his factory is [a secret place]3468-a secret place , [his]75-tom work is noiseless , and [his]75-tom Hands are mutes . CHAPTER XV [FATHER]2723-father AND [DAUGHTER]3470-daughter ALTHOUGH [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom did not take after [Blue Beard]149-blue beard , [[his]75-tom room]3401-his room was quite [a blue chamber in [its]3401-his room abundance of blue books]3472-a blue chamber in its abundance of blue books . Whatever [they]3473-they could prove ( which is usually anything [you]3474-you like ) , [they]3473-they proved [there]412-there , in an army constantly strengthening by the arrival of [new recruits]3476-new recruits . In [that charmed apartment]3477-that charmed apartment , the most complicated social questions were cast up , got into exact totals , and finally settled — if [those concerned]3478-those concerned could only have been brought to know it . As if [an astronomical observatory]3479-an astronomical observatory should be made without any windows , and [the astronomer within]3480-the astronomer within should arrange [the starry universe]3481-the starry universe solely by pen , ink , and paper , so [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , in [_ [his]75-tom _ Observatory]3482-_ his _ observatory ( and there are many like it ) , had no need to cast an eye upon [the teeming myriads of [human beings]3484-human beings around [him]75-tom]3483-the teeming myriads of human beings around him , but could settle all [their]3483-the teeming myriads of human beings around him destinies on a slate , and wipe out all [their]3483-the teeming myriads of human beings around him tears with one dirty little bit of sponge . To [this Observatory]3485-this observatory , then : [a stern room]3486-a stern room , with a deadly statistical clock in it , which measured every second with a beat like a rap upon a coffin - lid ; [Louisa]91-louisa repaired on the appointed morning . A window looked towards [Coketown]4-coketown ; and when [she]91-louisa sat down near [[her]91-louisa father]335-her father ’s table , [she]91-louisa saw the high chimneys and the long tracts of smoke looming in the heavy distance gloomily . ‘[100-loo] [[My]0-i dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , ’ said [[her]91-louisa father]335-her father , ‘[100-loo] [I]0-i prepared [you]91-louisa last night to give [me]0-i [your]91-louisa serious attention in the conversation [we]1040-we are now going to have together . [You]91-louisa have been so well trained , and [you]91-louisa do , [I]0-i am happy to say , so much justice to the education [you]91-louisa have received , that [I]0-i have perfect confidence in [your]91-louisa good sense . [You]91-louisa are not impulsive , [you]91-louisa are not romantic , [you]91-louisa are accustomed to view everything from the strong dispassionate ground of reason and calculation . From that ground alone , [I]0-i know [you]91-louisa will view and consider what [I]0-i am going to communicate . ’ [He]0-i waited , as if [he]0-i would have been glad that [she]91-louisa said something . But [she]91-louisa said never a word . ‘[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , [you]91-louisa are the subject of a proposal of marriage that has been made to [me]0-i . ’ Again [he]0-i waited , and again [she]91-louisa answered not one word . This so far surprised [him]0-i , as to induce [him]0-i gently to repeat , ‘[91-louisa] a proposal of marriage , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear . ’ To which [she]91-louisa returned , without any visible emotion whatever : ‘[91-louisa] [I]0-i hear [you]0-i , [father]2723-father . [I]0-i am attending , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] Well ! ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , breaking into a smile , after being for the moment at a loss , ‘[91-louisa] [you]91-louisa are even more dispassionate than [I]0-i expected , [Louisa]91-louisa . Or , perhaps , [you]91-louisa are not unprepared for the announcement [I]0-i have it in charge to make ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i can not say that , [father]2723-father , until [I]0-i hear it . Prepared or unprepared , [I]0-i wish to hear it all from [you]0-i . [I]0-i wish to hear [you]0-i state it to [me]0-i , [father]2723-father . ’ Strange to relate , [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom was not so collected at this moment as [[his]75-tom daughter]345-his daughter was . [He]75-tom took a paper - knife in [his]75-tom hand , turned it over , laid it down , took it up again , and even then had to look along the blade of it , considering how to go on . ‘[0-i] What [you]91-louisa say , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , is perfectly reasonable . [I]0-i have undertaken then to let [you]91-louisa know that — in short , that [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby has informed [me]0-i that [he]92-mr. bounderby has long watched [your]91-louisa progress with particular interest and pleasure , and has long hoped that the time might ultimately arrive when [he]92-mr. bounderby should offer [you]91-louisa [his]92-mr. bounderby hand in marriage . That time , to which [he]92-mr. bounderby has so long , and certainly with great constancy , looked forward , is now come . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby has made [his]92-mr. bounderby proposal of marriage to [me]0-i , and has entreated [me]0-i to make it known to [you]91-louisa , and to express [his]92-mr. bounderby hope that [you]91-louisa will take it into [your]91-louisa favourable consideration . ’ Silence between [them]3490-them . The deadly statistical clock very hollow . The distant smoke very black and heavy . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [Father]106-father , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , ‘[106-father] do [you]106-father think [I]0-i love [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ? ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom was extremely discomfited by this unexpected question . ‘[106-father] Well , [[my]0-i child]1047-my child , ’ [he]0-i returned , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i — really — cannot take upon [myself]0-i to say . ’ ‘[0-i] [Father]2723-father , ’ pursued [Louisa]91-louisa in exactly the same voice as before , ‘[106-father] do [you]106-father ask [me]0-i to love [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ? ’ ‘[106-father] [[My]0-i dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , no . No . [I]0-i ask nothing . ’ ‘[0-i] [Father]2723-father , ’ [she]91-louisa still pursued , ‘[2723-father] does [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ask [me]0-i to love [him]92-mr. bounderby ? ’ ‘[92-mr. bounderby] Really , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] it is difficult to answer [your]3090-my dear question — ’ ‘[3090-my dear] Difficult to answer it , Yes or No , [father]2723-father ? ‘ Certainly , [[my]2723-father dear]3090-my dear . Because ; ’[2723-father] here was something to demonstrate , and it set [him]2723-father up again ; ‘ because the reply depends so materially , [Louisa]91-louisa , on the sense in which [we]3492-we use the expression . Now , [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby does not do [you]91-louisa the injustice , and does not do [himself]92-mr. bounderby the injustice , of pretending to anything fanciful , fantastic , or ( [I]2723-father am using synonymous terms ) sentimental . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby would have seen [you]91-louisa grow up under [his]92-mr. bounderby eyes , to very little purpose , if [he]92-mr. bounderby could so far forget what is due to [your]91-louisa good sense , not to say to [his]92-mr. bounderby , as to address [you]91-louisa from any such ground . Therefore , perhaps the expression itself — [I]2723-father merely suggest this to [you]91-louisa , [[my]2723-father dear]3090-my dear — may be a little misplaced . ’[2723-father] ‘ What would [you]75-tom advise [me]3090-my dear to use in its stead , [father]2723-father ? ’[3090-my dear] ‘ Why , [[my]75-tom dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , completely recovered by this time , ‘ [I]75-tom would advise [you]91-louisa ( since [you]91-louisa ask [me]75-tom ) to consider this question , as [you]91-louisa have been accustomed to consider every other question , simply as one of tangible Fact . [The ignorant]3496-the ignorant and the giddy may embarrass [such subjects]3497-such subjects with irrelevant fancies , and other absurdities that have no existence , properly viewed — really no existence — but it is no compliment to [you]91-louisa to say , that [you]91-louisa know better . Now , what are the Facts of this case ? [You]91-louisa are , [we]3498-we will say in round numbers , twenty years of age ; [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby is , [we]3498-we will say in round numbers , fifty . There is some disparity in [your]91-louisa respective years , but in [your]91-louisa means and positions there is none ; on the contrary , there is a great suitability . Then the question arises , Is this one disparity sufficient to operate as a bar to such a marriage ? In considering this question , it is not unimportant to take into account the statistics of marriage , so far as they have yet been obtained , in [England]1-england and [Wales]23-wales . [I]75-tom find , on reference to the figures , that a large proportion of these marriages are contracted between [parties of very unequal ages]3499-parties of very unequal ages , and that [the elder of these contracting parties]3500-the elder of these contracting parties is , in rather more than three - fourths of these instances , [the bridegroom]3501-the bridegroom . It is remarkable as showing the wide prevalence of this law , that among [the natives of [the British]3503-the british possessions in [India]24-india]3502-the natives of the british possessions in india , also in [a considerable part of [China]25-china]3504-a considerable part of china , and among [the Calmucks of [Tartary]26-tartary]3505-the calmucks of tartary , the best means of computation yet furnished [us]3498-we by [travellers]3506-travellers , yield similar results . The disparity [I]75-tom have mentioned , therefore , almost ceases to be disparity , and ( virtually ) all but disappears . ’[75-tom] ‘ What do [you]335-her father recommend , [father]2723-father , ’[91-louisa] asked [Louisa]91-louisa , [her]91-louisa reserved composure not in the least affected by these gratifying results , ‘ that [I]91-louisa should substitute for the term [I]91-louisa used just now ? For the misplaced expression ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ [Louisa]91-louisa , ’[335-her father] returned [[her]91-louisa father]335-her father , ‘ it appears to [me]335-her father that nothing can be plainer . Confining [yourself]91-louisa rigidly to Fact , the question of Fact [you]91-louisa state to [yourself]91-louisa is : Does [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ask [me]335-her father to marry [him]92-mr. bounderby ? Yes , [he]92-mr. bounderby does . The sole remaining question then is : Shall [I]335-her father marry [him]92-mr. bounderby ? [I]335-her father think nothing can be plainer than that ? ’[335-her father] ‘ Shall [I]91-louisa marry [him]92-mr. bounderby ? ’[91-louisa] repeated [Louisa]91-louisa , with great deliberation . ‘ Precisely . And it is satisfactory to [me]91-louisa , as [[your]91-louisa father]2725-your father , [[my]91-louisa dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , to know that [you]91-louisa do not come to the consideration of that question with the previous habits of mind , and habits of life , that belong to [many young women]3510-many young women . ’[91-louisa] ‘ No , [father]2723-father , ’[91-louisa] [she]91-louisa returned , ‘ [I]91-louisa do not . ’[91-louisa] ‘ [I]75-tom now leave [you]91-louisa to judge for [yourself]91-louisa , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . ‘ [I]75-tom have stated the case , as such cases are usually stated among practical minds ; [I]75-tom have stated it , as the case of [[your]91-louisa mother]710-your mother and [myself]75-tom was stated in its time . The rest , [[my]75-tom dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa , is for [you]91-louisa to decide . ’[75-tom] From the beginning , [she]91-louisa had sat looking at [him]75-tom fixedly . As [he]75-tom now leaned back in [his]75-tom chair , and bent [his]75-tom deep - set eyes upon [her]91-louisa in [his]75-tom turn , perhaps [he]75-tom might have seen one wavering moment in [her]91-louisa , when [she]91-louisa was impelled to throw [herself]91-louisa upon [his]75-tom breast , and give [him]75-tom the pent - up confidences of [her]91-louisa heart . But , to see it , [he]75-tom must have overleaped at a bound the artificial barriers [he]75-tom had for many years been erecting , between [himself]75-tom and all those subtle essences of humanity which will elude the utmost cunning of algebra until the last trumpet ever to be sounded shall blow even algebra to wreck . The barriers were too many and too high for such a leap . With [his]75-tom unbending , utilitarian , matter - of - fact face , [he]75-tom hardened [her]91-louisa again ; and the moment shot away into the plumbless depths of the past , to mingle with all the lost opportunities that are drowned there . Removing [her]91-louisa eyes from [him]75-tom , [she]91-louisa sat so long looking silently towards [the town]317-the town , that [he]75-tom said , at length : ‘ Are [you]91-louisa consulting the chimneys of [the Coketown works]3514-the coketown works , [Louisa]91-louisa ? ’[75-tom] ‘ There seems to be nothing there but languid and monotonous smoke . Yet when the night comes , Fire bursts out , [father]2723-father ! ’[91-louisa] [she]91-louisa answered , turning quickly . ‘ Of course [I]91-louisa know that , [Louisa]91-louisa . [I]91-louisa do not see the application of the remark . ’[91-louisa] To do [him]75-tom justice [he]75-tom did not , at all . [She]91-louisa passed it away with a slight motion of [her]91-louisa hand , and concentrating [her]91-louisa attention upon [him]75-tom again , said , ‘ [Father]106-father , [I]91-louisa have often thought that life is very short . ’—This[91-louisa] was so distinctly one of [[his]75-tom subjects]1055-his subjects that [he]75-tom interposed . ‘ It is short , no doubt , [[my]91-louisa dear]3090-my dear . Still , the average duration of human life is proved to have increased of late years . The calculations of various life assurance and annuity offices , among other figures which can not go wrong , have established the fact . ’[91-louisa] ‘ [I]91-louisa speak of [my]91-louisa own life , [father]2723-father . ’[91-louisa] ‘ O indeed ? Still , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘ [I]75-tom need not point out to [you]91-louisa , [Louisa]91-louisa , that it is governed by the laws which govern lives in the aggregate . ’[75-tom] ‘ While it lasts , [I]75-tom would wish to do the little [I]75-tom can , and the little [I]75-tom am fit for . What does it matter ? ’[75-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom seemed rather at a loss to understand the last four words ; replying , ‘ How , matter ? What matter , [[my]75-tom dear]3090-my dear ? ’[75-tom] ‘ [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ’[1056-i] [she]1056-i went on in a steady , straight way , without regarding this , ‘ asks [me]1056-i to marry [him]92-mr. bounderby . The question [I]1056-i have to ask [myself]1056-i is , shall [I]1056-i marry [him]92-mr. bounderby ? That is so , [father]2723-father , is it not ? Tell [him]92-mr. bounderby , [father]2723-father , as soon as [you]2723-father please , that this was [my]1056-i answer . Repeat it , word for word , if [you]2723-father can , because [I]1056-i should wish [him]92-mr. bounderby to know what [I]1056-i said . ’[1056-i] ‘ It is quite right , [[my]335-her father dear]3090-my dear , ’[335-her father] retorted [[her]1057-her father]335-her father approvingly , ‘ to be exact . [He]75-tom paused to look at [her]1057-her , and , still holding [her]1057-her hand , said : ‘ [Louisa]91-louisa , [I]75-tom have not considered it essential to ask [you]1057-her one question , because the possibility implied in it appeared to [me]75-tom to be too remote . [You]1057-her have never entertained in secret any other proposal ? ’[75-tom] ‘ [Father]106-father , ’[1057-her] [she]1057-her returned , almost scornfully , ‘ what other proposal can have been made to _ [me]1057-her _ ?
