Good night ! ’[75-tom] [He]1268-the whelp had another odd dream of being taken by [a waiter]1303-a waiter through a mist , which , after giving [him]1268-the whelp some trouble and difficulty , resolved itself into [the main street]1304-the main street , in which [he]1268-the whelp stood alone . [He]1268-the whelp then walked [home]336-home pretty easily , though not yet free from an impression of the presence and influence of [[his]1268-the whelp new friend]1287-his new friend — as if [he]1287-his new friend were lounging somewhere in the air , in the same negligent attitude , regarding [him]1268-the whelp with the same look . [The whelp]1268-the whelp went [home]336-home , and went to bed . If [he]1268-the whelp had had any sense of what [he]1268-the whelp had done that night , and had been [less of a whelp]1309-less of a whelp and more of [a brother]1310-a brother , [he]1268-the whelp might have turned short on [the road]326-the road , might have gone down to [the ill - smelling river]1312-the ill - smelling river that was dyed black , might have gone to bed in [it]1312-the ill - smelling river for good and all , and have curtained [his]1268-the whelp head for ever with [its]1312-the ill - smelling river filthy waters . CHAPTER IV MEN AND [BROTHERS]167-brothers ‘ OH , [[my]1314-the orator , perched on a stage friends]3923-my friends , [the down - trodden operatives of [Coketown]4-coketown]3924-the down - trodden operatives of coketown ! Oh , [[my]1314-the orator , perched on a stage friends]3923-my friends and [fellow - countrymen]3926-fellow - countrymen , [the slaves of an iron - handed and a grinding despotism]3927-the slaves of an iron - handed and a grinding despotism ! Oh , [[my]1314-the orator , perched on a stage friends]3923-my friends and [fellow - sufferers]3929-fellow - sufferers , and [fellow - workmen]3930-fellow - workmen , and [fellow - men]3931-fellow - men ! [I]1314-the orator , perched on a stage tell [you]3932-you that the hour is come , when [we]3933-our must rally round [one another]2898-one another as One united power , and crumble into dust the oppressors that too long have battened upon the plunder of [[our]3933-our families]3935-our families , upon the sweat of [our]3933-our brows , upon the labour of [our]3933-our hands , upon the strength of [our]3933-our sinews , upon the God - created glorious rights of Humanity , and upon the holy and eternal privileges of Brotherhood ! ’[1314-the orator , perched on a stage] ‘ Good ! ’[167-brothers] ‘ Hear , hear , hear ! ’[167-brothers] ‘ Hurrah ! ’[167-brothers] and other cries , arose in many voices from various parts of [the densely crowded and suffocatingly close Hall]1313-the densely crowded and suffocatingly close hall , in which [the orator , perched on a stage]1314-the orator , perched on a stage , delivered [himself]1314-the orator , perched on a stage of this and what other froth and fume [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage had in [him]1314-the orator , perched on a stage . [He]1314-the orator , perched on a stage had declaimed [himself]1314-the orator , perched on a stage into a violent heat , and was as hoarse as [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was hot . By dint of roaring at the top of [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage voice under a flaring gaslight , clenching [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage fists , knitting [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage brows , setting [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage teeth , and pounding with [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage arms , [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage had taken so much out of [himself]1314-the orator , perched on a stage by this time , that [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was brought to a stop , and called for a glass of water . As [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage stood there , trying to quench [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage fiery face with [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage drink of water , the comparison between [the orator]1315-the orator and [the crowd of attentive faces]1316-the crowd of attentive faces turned towards [him]1314-the orator , perched on a stage , was extremely to [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage disadvantage . Judging [him]1314-the orator , perched on a stage by [Nature]168-nature ’s evidence , [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was above the mass in very little but the stage on which [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage stood . In many great respects [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was essentially below [them]1317-their . [He]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was not so honest , [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was not so manly , [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage was not so good - humoured ; [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage substituted cunning for [their]1317-their simplicity , and passion for [their]1317-their safe solid sense . [An ill - made , high - shouldered man]1318-an ill - made , high - shouldered man , with lowering brows , and [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage features crushed into an habitually sour expression , [he]1314-the orator , perched on a stage contrasted most unfavourably , even in [his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage mongrel dress , with the great body of [[his]1314-the orator , perched on a stage hearers]1319-his hearers in [their]1319-his hearers plain working clothes . Strange as it always is to consider any assembly in the act of submissively resigning itself to the dreariness of [some complacent person]1320-some complacent person , [lord]1321-lord or [commoner , whom three - fourths of it]1322-commoner , whom three - fourths of it could , by no human means , raise out of the slough of inanity to [their]1317-their own intellectual level , it was particularly strange , and it was even particularly affecting , to see [this crowd of earnest faces , whose honesty in the main [no competent observer free from bias]1324-no competent observer free from bias could doubt , so agitated by [such a leader]1325-such a leader]1323-this crowd of earnest faces , whose honesty in the main no competent observer free from bias could doubt , so agitated by such a leader . Good ! Hear , hear ! Hurrah ! The eagerness both of attention and intention , exhibited in all the countenances , made them a most impressive sight . There was no carelessness , no languor , no idle curiosity ; none of the many shades of indifference to be seen in all other assemblies , visible for one moment there . That [every man]822-every man felt [his]822-every man condition to be , somehow or other , worse than it might be ; that [every man]822-every man considered it incumbent on [him]822-every man to join [the rest]462-the rest , towards the making of it better ; that [every man]822-every man felt [his]822-every man only hope to be in [his]822-every man allying [himself]822-every man to [the comrades by whom [he]822-every man was surrounded]1330-the comrades by whom he was surrounded ; and that in this belief , right or wrong ( unhappily wrong then ) , [the whole of that crowd]1331-the whole of that crowd were gravely , deeply , faithfully in earnest ; must have been as plain to [any one who chose to see what was there , as the bare beams of the roof and the whitened brick walls]1332-any one who chose to see what was there , as the bare beams of the roof and the whitened brick walls . Nor could [any such spectator]1333-any such spectator fail to know in [his]1333-any such spectator own breast , that [these men]1334-these men , through [their]1334-these men very delusions , showed great qualities , susceptible of being turned to the happiest and best account ; and that to pretend ( on the strength of sweeping axioms , howsoever cut and dried ) that [they]1334-these men went astray wholly without cause , and of [their]1334-these men own irrational wills , was to pretend that there could be smoke without fire , death without birth , harvest without seed , anything or everything produced from nothing . [The orator]1315-the orator having refreshed [himself]1315-the orator , wiped [his]1315-the orator corrugated forehead from left to right several times with [his]1315-the orator handkerchief folded into a pad , and concentrated all [his]1315-the orator revived forces , in a sneer of great disdain and bitterness . ‘ But oh , [[my]1336-the assembly friends]3923-my friends and [brothers]3937-brothers ! Oh , [men]3039-men and [Englishmen]3939-englishmen , [the down - trodden operatives of [Coketown]4-coketown]3924-the down - trodden operatives of coketown ! What shall [we]3941-we say of [that man]3019-that man — [that working - man]3943-that working - man , that [I]1336-the assembly should find it necessary so to libel the glorious name — who , being practically and well acquainted with the grievances and wrongs of [you]3944-you , [the injured pith and marrow of [this land]3345-this land]3945-the injured pith and marrow of this land , and having heard [you]3944-you , with a noble and majestic unanimity that will make [Tyrants]3947-tyrants tremble , resolve for to subscribe to the funds of [the United Aggregate Tribunal]3948-the united aggregate tribunal , and to abide by the injunctions issued by [that body]3949-that body for [your]3944-you benefit , whatever they may be — what , [I]1336-the assembly ask [you]3944-you , will [you]3944-you say of [that working - man]3943-that working - man , since such [I]1336-the assembly must acknowledge [him]3943-that working - man to be , who , at such a time , deserts [his]3943-that working - man post , and sells [his]3943-that working - man flag ; who , at such a time , turns [a traitor]3951-a traitor and [a craven]3952-a craven and a recreant , who , at such a time , is not ashamed to make to [you]3944-you the dastardly and humiliating avowal that [he]3943-that working - man will hold [himself]3943-that working - man aloof , and will _ not _ be [one of those associated in the gallant stand for Freedom and for Right]3953-one of those associated in the gallant stand for freedom and for right ? ’[1336-the assembly] [The assembly]1336-the assembly was divided at this point . There were some groans and hisses , but the general sense of honour was much too strong for the condemnation of [a man]3830-a man unheard . ‘ Be sure [you]169-slackbridge ’re[169-slackbridge] right , [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge ! ’ ‘[169-slackbridge] Put [him]3830-a man up ! ’ ‘[3830-a man] Let ’s hear [him]3830-a man ! ’ Such things were said on many sides . Finally , [one strong voice]3954-one strong voice called out , ‘[3830-a man] Is [the man heer]1338-the man heer ? If [the man]3010-the man ’s heer , [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , let ’s hear [the man himseln , ’ stead o ’[1340-the man himseln , ’ stead o ’ yo] yo]1340-the man himseln , ’ stead o ’ yo . ’ Which was received with a round of applause . [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , [the orator]1315-the orator , looked about [him]169-slackbridge with a withering smile ; and , holding out [his]169-slackbridge right hand at arm ’s length ( as the manner of all [Slackbridges]170-slackbridges is ) , to still the thundering sea , waited until there was a profound silence . ‘[1340-the man himseln , ’ stead o ’ yo] Oh , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends and [fellow - men]3931-fellow - men ! ’ said [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge then , shaking [his]169-slackbridge head with violent scorn , ‘[1340-the man himseln , ’ stead o ’ yo] [I]0-i do not wonder that [you]1343-you , [the prostrate sons of labour]1344-the prostrate sons of labour , are incredulous of the existence of [such a man]1345-such a man . But [he]1345-such a man who sold [his]1345-such a man birthright for a mess of pottage existed , and [Judas Iscariot]171-judas iscariot existed , and [Castlereagh]172-castlereagh existed , and [this man]2949-this man exists ! ’ Here , a brief press and confusion near the stage , ended in [the man]3010-the man [himself]3010-the man standing at [the orator]1315-the orator ’s side before [the concourse]3958-the concourse . [He]3010-the man was pale and a little moved in the face — [his]3010-the man lips especially showed it ; but [he]3010-the man stood quiet , with [his]3010-the man left hand at [his]3010-the man chin , waiting to be heard . There was [a chairman]3959-a chairman to regulate the proceedings , and [this functionary]3960-this functionary now took the case into [his]0-i own hands . ‘[3923-my friends] [[My]0-i friends]3923-my friends , ’ said [he]0-i , ‘[3923-my friends] by virtue o ’ [[my]3923-my friends office]619-my office as [[your]3923-my friends president]3962-your president , [I]3923-my friends askes [o]3963-o ’[3923-my friends] [[our]1348-our friend]1349-our friend [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , who may be a little over hetter in this business , to take [his]169-slackbridge seat , whiles [this man [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen]1350-this man stephen blackpool is heern . [You]3923-my friends all know [this man [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen]1350-this man stephen blackpool . [You]3923-my friends know [him]1350-this man stephen blackpool awlung o ’ [his]1350-this man stephen blackpool misfort’ns , and [his]1350-this man stephen blackpool good name . ’[3923-my friends] With that , [the chairman]1352-the chairman shook [him]169-slackbridge frankly by the hand , and sat down again . [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge likewise sat down , wiping [his]169-slackbridge hot forehead — always from left to right , and never the reverse way . ‘ [[My]137-stephen friends]3923-my friends , ’[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen began , in the midst of a dead calm ; ‘ [I]1353-i ha ’[1353-i] [he]1353-i d what ’s been spok’n o ’ [me]1353-i , and ’[1353-i] tis lickly that [I]0-i sha n’t mend it . But [I]0-i ’d liefer [you]3923-my friends ’d hearn the truth concernin [myseln]1354-myseln , fro [my]0-i lips than fro onny other man ’s , though [I]0-i never cud’n speak afore so monny , wi’out bein moydert and muddled . ’ [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge shook [his]169-slackbridge head as if [he]169-slackbridge would shake it off , in [his]169-slackbridge bitterness . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m [th]3965-th ’[3966-o ’ a ’] one single Hand in [Bounderby ’s mill]1355-bounderby ’s mill , [o ’ a ’]3966-o ’ a ’[549-the men] [the men]549-the men theer , as do n’t coom in wi ’ th ’[3966-o ’ a ’] proposed reg’lations . [I]0-i canna coom in wi ’ ’em[3966-o ’ a ’] . [[My]0-i friends]3923-my friends , [I]0-i doubt [their]549-the men doin’ [yo]3923-my friends onny good . Licker [they]549-the men ’ll do yo hurt . ’ [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge laughed , folded [his]169-slackbridge arms , and frowned sarcastically . ‘[549-the men] But ’ t an’t sommuch for that as [I]549-the men stands out . If that were aw , [I]549-the men ’d coom in wi ’[549-the men] th ’ rest . But [I]549-the men ha ’[549-the men] [my]0-i reasons — [mine]0-i , [yo]3923-my friends see — for being hindered ; not on’y now , but awlus — awlus — life long ! ’ [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge jumped up and stood beside [him]169-slackbridge , gnashing and tearing . ‘[549-the men] Oh , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends , what but this did [I]0-i tell [you]3923-my friends ? Oh , [[my]0-i fellow - countrymen]1359-my fellow - countrymen , what warning but this did [I]0-i give [you]3923-my friends ? And how shows this recreant conduct in [a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy ? Oh , [[you]3923-my friends Englishmen]1361-you englishmen , [I]0-i ask [you]3923-my friends how does this subornation show in one of [yourselves]3923-my friends , who is thus consenting to [his]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy own undoing and to [yours]3923-my friends , and to [[your]3923-my friends children]1362-your children ’s and [[your]3923-my friends children]1362-your children ’s children ’s ? ’ There was some applause , and some crying of Shame upon [the man]3010-the man ; but [the greater part of [the audience]3969-the audience]3968-the greater part of the audience were quiet . [They]3968-the greater part of the audience looked at [Stephen]137-stephen ’s worn face , rendered more pathetic by the homely emotions it evinced ; and , in the kindness of [their]3968-the greater part of the audience nature , [they]3968-the greater part of the audience were more sorry than indignant . ‘[1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy] ’ Tis [this Delegate]3970-this delegate ’s trade for t ’[1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy] speak , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘[1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy] an ’ [he]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy ’s paid for ’[1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy] t , an ’ [he]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy knows [his]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy work . Let [him]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy keep to ’[1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy] t. Let [him]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy give no heed to what [I]0-i ha had’n to bear . That ’s not for [him]1360-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy . That ’s not for nobbody but [me]0-i . ’ There was a propriety , not to say a dignity in these words , that made [the hearers]3971-the hearers yet more quiet and attentive . [The same strong voice]3972-the same strong voice called out , ‘[169-slackbridge] [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , let [the man]3010-the man be heern , and how d [thee]169-slackbridge tongue ! ’ Then [the place]329-the place was wonderfully still . ‘[169-slackbridge] [[My]0-i brothers]1365-my brothers , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , whose low voice was distinctly heard , ‘[1365-my brothers] and [[my]0-i fellow - workmen]1366-my fellow - workmen — for that [yo]1367-yo are to [me]0-i , though not , as [I]0-i knows on , to [this delegate here]1368-this delegate here — [I]0-i ha but a word to [sen]1369-sen , and [I]0-i could sen nommore if [I]0-i was to speak till Strike o ’ day . [I]0-i know weel , aw what ’s afore [me]0-i . [I]0-i know [weel]3974-weel that [yo]1367-yo aw resolve to [ha]3975-ha nommore ado wi ’[3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther] [a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther . [I]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther know weel that if [I]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther was a lyin parisht [i]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther ’[3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther] [th ’ road]3977-th ’ road , [yo’d]1367-yo feel it right to pass [me]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther by , as [a forrenner and stranger]3978-a forrenner and stranger . What [I]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther ha getn , [I]3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther mun mak th ’[3976-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther] best on . ’ ‘[137-stephen] [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , ’ said [the chairman]1352-the chairman , rising , ‘[137-stephen] think on ’ t agen . Think on ’[137-stephen] t once agen , [lad]797-lad , afore [thou’rt]1371-thou’rt shunned by [aw owd friends]1372-aw owd friends . ’ There was an universal murmur to the same effect , though [no man]3980-no man articulated a word . Every eye was fixed on [Stephen]137-stephen ’s face . To repent of [his]137-stephen determination , would be to take a load from all [their]3981-their minds . [He]137-stephen looked around [him]137-stephen , and knew that it was so . Not a grain of anger with [them]3981-their was in [his]137-stephen heart ; [he]137-stephen knew [them]3981-their , far below [their]3981-their surface weaknesses and misconceptions , as [no one]545-no one but [[their]3981-their fellow - labourer]3983-their fellow - labourer could . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ha thowt on ’ t , above a bit , [sir]2713-sir . [I]0-i simply canna coom in . [I]0-i mun go th ’[0-i] way as lays afore [me]0-i . [I]0-i mun tak [my]0-i leave o ’ aw heer . ’[0-i] [He]0-i made a sort of reverence to [them]1373-them by holding up [his]0-i arms , and stood for the moment in that attitude ; not speaking until [they]1373-them slowly dropped at [his]0-i sides . ‘ [Monny]173-monny ’s the pleasant word as [soom heer]3985-soom heer has spok’n wi ’[0-i] [me]0-i ; [monny]1374-monny ’s the face [I]0-i see heer , as [I]0-i first seen when [I]0-i were yoong and lighter heart’n than now . [I]0-i ha ’ never had [no fratch]3986-no fratch afore , sin ever [I]0-i were born , wi ’[0-i] any o ’ [my]0-i like ; Gonnows [I]0-i ha ’[0-i] none now that ’s o ’ [my]0-i makin ’[0-i] . [Yo’ll]1375-yo’ll ca ’ [me]1375-yo’ll traitor and that — [yo]1375-yo’ll [I]1375-yo’ll mean t ’[1375-yo’ll] say , ’ addressing [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , ‘[1375-yo’ll] but ’ tis easier to ca ’[3987-mak ’] than [mak ’]3987-mak ’ out . So let be . ’[0-i] [He]0-i had moved away a pace or two to come down from [the platform]1376-the platform , when [he]0-i remembered something [he]0-i had not said , and returned again . ‘ Haply , ’[0-i] [he]0-i said , turning [his]0-i furrowed face slowly about , that [he]0-i might as it were individually address [the whole audience]1377-the whole audience , [those both near and distant]1378-those both near and distant ; ‘ haply , when this question has been tak’n up and discoosed , there ’ll be a threat to turn out if [I]0-i ’m[0-i] let to work among [yo]1379-yo . [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall die ere ever such a time cooms , and [I]0-i shall work solitary among [yo]1379-yo unless it cooms — truly , [I]0-i mun do ’ t , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends ; not to brave [yo]1379-yo , but to live . [I]0-i ha nobbut work to live by ; and [wheerever]174-wheerever can [I]0-i go , [I]0-i who [ha]0-i worked sin [I]0-i were no heighth at aw , in [Coketown]4-coketown heer ? [I]0-i mak ’[0-i] no complaints o ’ bein turned to the wa ’[0-i] , o ’ bein outcasten and overlooken fro this time forrard , but hope [I]0-i shall be let to work . If there is any right for [me]0-i at aw , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends , [I]0-i think ’[0-i] tis that . ’ Not a word was spoken . Not a sound was audible in [the building]3385-the building , but the slight rustle of [men]3039-men moving a little apart , all along the centre of [the room]2859-the room , to open a means of passing out , to [the man with whom [they]3039-men had all bound [themselves]3039-men to renounce companionship]3993-the man with whom they had all bound themselves to renounce companionship . Looking at [no one]545-no one , and going [his]0-i way with a lowly steadiness upon [him]0-i that asserted nothing and sought nothing , [Old Stephen]139-stephen , with all [his]0-i troubles on [his]0-i head , left the scene . Then [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , who had kept [his]169-slackbridge oratorical arm extended during the going out , as if [he]169-slackbridge were repressing with infinite solicitude and by a wonderful moral power the vehement passions of [the multitude]3995-the multitude , applied [himself]169-slackbridge to raising [their]3995-the multitude spirits . Had not [the Roman Brutus]175-the roman brutus , oh , [[my]0-i British countrymen]3996-my british countrymen , condemned [[his]175-the roman brutus son]3997-his son to death ; and had not [the Spartan mothers]3998-the spartan mothers , oh [[my]0-i soon to be victorious friends]3999-my soon to be victorious friends , driven [[their]3998-the spartan mothers flying children]4000-their flying children on the points of [[their]3998-the spartan mothers enemies]4001-their enemies ’[0-i] swords ? Then was it not the sacred duty of [the men of [Coketown]4-coketown]1380-the men of coketown , with [forefathers]1381-forefathers before [them]1380-the men of coketown , [an admiring world in company with [them]1380-the men of coketown]1382-an admiring world in company with them , and [a posterity]1383-a posterity to come after [them]1380-the men of coketown , to hurl out [traitors]1384-traitors from [the tents [they]1380-the men of coketown had pitched in a sacred and a God - like cause]1385-the tents they had pitched in a sacred and a god - like cause ? [The winds of [heaven]1387-heaven]1386-the winds of heaven answered Yes ; and bore Yes , east , west , north , and south . And consequently three cheers for the United Aggregate Tribunal ! [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge acted as fugleman , and gave the time . [The multitude of doubtful faces]1388-the multitude of doubtful faces ( a little conscience - stricken ) brightened at the sound , and took it up . Private feeling must yield to the common cause . Hurrah ! The roof yet vibrated with the cheering , when [the assembly]1336-the assembly dispersed . Thus easily did [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen fall into the loneliest of lives , the life of solitude among [a familiar crowd]1390-a familiar crowd . [The stranger in [the land]1392-the land who looks into [ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it]1393-ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it , is in cheering society as compared with [him]1391-the stranger in the land who looks into ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it , is in cheering society as compared with him who passes ten averted faces daily , that were once the countenances of friends who passes ten averted faces daily , that were once the countenances of [friends]1394-friends]1391-the stranger in the land who looks into ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it , is in cheering society as compared with him who passes ten averted faces daily , that were once the countenances of friends . Such experience was to be [Stephen]137-stephen ’s now , in every waking moment of [his]137-stephen life ; at [his]137-stephen work , on [his]137-stephen way to [it]1395-it and from [it]1395-it , at [his]137-stephen door , at [his]137-stephen window , everywhere . By general consent , [they]1396-they even avoided that side of [the street]448-the street on which [he]137-stephen habitually walked ; and left [it]1398-it , of [all the working men]1399-all the working men , to [him]137-stephen only . [He]137-stephen had been for many years , [a quiet silent man]1400-a quiet silent man , associating but little with [other men]602-other men , and used to companionship with [his]137-stephen own thoughts . [He]137-stephen had never known before the strength of the want in [his]137-stephen heart for the frequent recognition of a nod , a look , a word ; or the immense amount of relief that had been poured into it by drops through such small means . It was even harder than [he]137-stephen could have believed possible , to separate in [his]137-stephen own conscience [his]137-stephen abandonment by all [[his]137-stephen fellows]1402-his fellows from a baseless sense of shame and disgrace . The first four days of [his]137-stephen endurance were days so long and heavy , that [he]137-stephen began to be appalled by the prospect before [him]137-stephen . Not only did [he]137-stephen see no [Rachael]140-rachael all the time , but [he]137-stephen avoided every chance of seeing [her]140-rachael ; for , although [he]137-stephen knew that the prohibition did not yet formally extend to [the women working in [the factories]945-the factories]1403-the women working in the factories , [he]137-stephen found that [some of [them]1403-the women working in the factories with whom [he]137-stephen was acquainted]1405-some of them with whom he was acquainted were changed to [him]137-stephen , and [he]137-stephen feared to try [others]671-others , and dreaded that [Rachael]140-rachael might be even singled out from the rest if [she]140-rachael were seen in [his]137-stephen company . So , [he]137-stephen had been quite alone during the four days , and had spoken to [no one]545-no one , when , as [he]137-stephen was leaving [his]137-stephen work at night , [a young man of a very light complexion]1408-a young man of a very light complexion accosted [him]137-stephen in [the street]448-the street . ‘ [Your]137-stephen name ’s [Blackpool]137-stephen , ai n’t it ? ’[1410-the young man] said [the young man]1410-the young man . [Stephen]137-stephen coloured to find [himself]137-stephen with [his]137-stephen hat in [his]137-stephen hand , in [his]137-stephen gratitude for being spoken to , or in the suddenness of it , or both . [He]137-stephen made a feint of adjusting the lining , and said , ‘ Yes . ’[137-stephen] ‘ [You]137-stephen are the Hand [they]4002-they have sent to [Coventry]176-coventry , [I]77-bitzer mean ? ’[77-bitzer] said [Bitzer]77-bitzer , [the very light young man in question]1411-the very light young man in question . [Stephen]137-stephen answered ‘ Yes , ’[137-stephen] again . ‘ [I]137-stephen supposed so , from [their]4002-they all appearing to keep away from [you]77-bitzer . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby wants to speak to [you]77-bitzer . [You]77-bitzer know [[his]92-mr. bounderby house]4003-his house , do n’t [you]77-bitzer ? ’[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen said ‘ Yes , ’[137-stephen] again . ‘ Then go straight up there , will [you]137-stephen ? ’[77-bitzer] said [Bitzer]77-bitzer . ‘ [You]137-stephen ’re[77-bitzer] expected , and have only to tell [the servant]1412-the servant it ’s [you]137-stephen . [I]0-i belong to [the Bank]3460-the bank ; so , if [you]137-stephen go straight up without [me]0-i ( [I]0-i was sent to fetch [you]137-stephen ) , [you]137-stephen ’ll save [me]0-i a walk . ’ [Stephen]137-stephen , whose way had been in the contrary direction , turned about , and betook [himself]137-stephen as in duty bound , to [the red brick castle of the giant [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby]4004-the red brick castle of the giant bounderby . CHAPTER V [MEN AND MASTERS]4005-men and masters ‘[137-stephen] WELL , [Stephen]137-stephen , ’ said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , in [his]92-mr. bounderby windy manner , ‘[137-stephen] what ’s this [I]0-i hear ? What have these pests of [the earth]3171-the earth been doing to _ [you]137-stephen _ ? Come in , and speak up . ’ It was into [the drawing - room]755-the drawing - room that [he]137-stephen was thus bidden . A tea - table was set out ; and [[Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s young wife]4007-mr. bounderby ’s young wife , and [[her]4007-mr. bounderby ’s young wife brother]2889-her brother , and [a great gentleman from [London]8-london]4009-a great gentleman from london , were present . To whom [Stephen]137-stephen made [his]137-stephen obeisance , closing the door and standing near it , with [his]137-stephen hat in [his]137-stephen hand . ‘[1415-the man i was telling you about] This is [the man [I]0-i was telling [you]137-stephen about]1415-the man i was telling you about , [Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . [The gentleman [he]92-mr. bounderby addressed , who was talking to [Mrs. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby on the sofa]4010-the gentleman he addressed , who was talking to mrs. bounderby on the sofa , got up , saying in an indolent way , ‘[162-mr. harthouse] Oh really ? ’ and dawdled to the hearthrug where [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby stood . ‘[162-mr. harthouse] Now , ’ said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘[1415-the man i was telling you about] speak up ! ’ After the four days [he]92-mr. bounderby had passed , this address fell rudely and discordantly on [Stephen]137-stephen ’s ear . Besides being a rough handling of [his]137-stephen wounded mind , it seemed to assume that [he]137-stephen really was [the self - interested deserter [he]137-stephen had been called]4011-the self - interested deserter he had been called . ‘[1415-the man i was telling you about] What were it , [sir]2713-sir , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘[2713-sir] as [yo]2713-sir were pleased to want wi ’ [me]1415-the man i was telling you about ? ’[1415-the man i was telling you about] ‘ Why , [I]92-mr. bounderby have told [you]137-stephen , ’[92-mr. bounderby] returned [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ Speak up like [a man]3830-a man , since [you]137-stephen are [a man]3830-a man , and tell [us]4014-us about [yourself]137-stephen and [this Combination]4015-this combination . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Wi ’[1415-the man i was telling you about] yor pardon , [sir]2713-sir , ’ said [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , ‘[2713-sir] [I]0-i ha ’ nowt to sen about it . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , who was always more or less like a Wind , finding something in [his]92-mr. bounderby way here , began to blow at it directly . ‘ Now , look here , [Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [he]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ here ’s a specimen of [’em]4016-’em[92-mr. bounderby] . Ah ! _ [I]0-i _ know what [you]92-mr. bounderby said ; more than that , [I]0-i know what [you]92-mr. bounderby mean , [you]92-mr. bounderby see . Not always the same thing , by [the Lord Harry]113-the lord harry ! Quite different things . [You]92-mr. bounderby had better tell [us]4017-us at once , that [that fellow [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge]4018-that fellow slackbridge is not in [the town]317-the town , stirring up [the people]307-the people to mutiny ; and that [he]4018-that fellow slackbridge is not [a regular qualified leader of [the people]307-the people]4021-a regular qualified leader of the people : that is , [a most confounded scoundrel]4023-a most confounded scoundrel . Why do n’t [you]92-mr. bounderby ? ’[0-i] ‘ [I]0-i ’m[0-i] as sooary as [yo]1425-yo , [sir]2713-sir , when [[the people]307-the people ’s leaders]1428-the people ’s leaders is bad , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , shaking [his]137-stephen head . ‘[1428-the people ’s leaders] [They]1428-the people ’s leaders taks such as offers . Haply ’ tis na ’[0-i] the sma’est o ’ [their]1428-the people ’s leaders misfortuns when [they]1428-the people ’s leaders can get no better . ’[0-i] The wind began to get boisterous . ‘ Now , [you]92-mr. bounderby ’ll think this pretty well , [Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ [You]92-mr. bounderby ’ll think this tolerably strong . Pray , [Mr. Blackpool’—wind]177-mr. blackpool’—wind springing up very fast—‘may [I]92-mr. bounderby take the liberty of asking [you]92-mr. bounderby how it happens that [you]92-mr. bounderby refused to be in this Combination ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ How ’[0-i] t happens ? ’ ‘[92-mr. bounderby] Ah ! ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , with [his]92-mr. bounderby thumbs in the arms of [his]92-mr. bounderby coat , and jerking [his]92-mr. bounderby head and shutting [his]92-mr. bounderby eyes in confidence with the opposite wall : ‘[92-mr. bounderby] how it happens . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’d leefer not coom to ’ t , [sir]2713-sir ; but sin [you]0-i put th ’[0-i] question — an ’ not want’n t ’[0-i] be ill - manner’n — [I’ll]0-i answer . Look how [you]1457-you considers of [us]1451-us , and writes of [us]1451-us , and talks of [us]1451-us , and goes up wi ’ yor deputations to Secretaries o ’[1457-you] State ’bout [us]1451-us , and how [yo]1457-you are awlus right , and how [we]1451-us are awlus wrong , and never had’n no reason in [us]1451-us sin ever [we]1451-us were born . Look how this ha growen an ’[2713-sir] growen , [sir]2713-sir , bigger an ’ bigger , broader an ’[2713-sir] broader , harder an ’ harder , fro year to year , fro generation unto generation . [Mischeevous strangers]4063-mischeevous strangers ! ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen , with an anxious smile ; ‘ when [ha]4064-ha [we]1463-we not heern , [I]137-stephen am sure , sin ever [we]1463-we can call to mind , o ’[137-stephen] [th ’ mischeevous strangers]4065-th ’ mischeevous strangers ! ’[2713-sir] Tis not by _ [them]1468-them _ the trouble ’s made , [sir]2713-sir . ’ Tis not wi ’[1468-them] _ [them]1468-them _ ’ t commences . [I]0-i ha no favour for ’em[0-i] — [I]0-i ha no reason to favour ’em — but ’[137-stephen] tis hopeless and useless to dream o ’ takin [them]1468-them fro [their]1468-them trade , ’[4065-th ’ mischeevous strangers] stead o ’ takin [their]1468-them trade fro [them]1468-them ! Aw that ’s now about [me]0-i in [this room]4066-this room were heer afore [I]0-i coom , an ’[0-i] will be heer when [I]0-i am gone . Put that clock aboard [a ship]1470-a ship an ’ pack it off to [Norfolk Island]37-norfolk island , an ’[0-i] the time will go on just the same . So ’ tis wi ’[0-i] [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge every bit . ’ Reverting for a moment to [his]2713-sir former refuge , [he]2713-sir observed a cautionary movement of [her]4067-her eyes towards the door . Stepping back , [he]2713-sir put [his]2713-sir hand upon the lock . But [he]2713-sir had not spoken out of [his]2713-sir own will and desire ; and [he]2713-sir felt it in [his]2713-sir heart a noble return for [his]2713-sir late injurious treatment to be faithful to the last to [those who had repudiated [him]2713-sir]4068-those who had repudiated him . [He]2713-sir stayed to finish what was in [his]2713-sir mind . ‘[2713-sir] [Sir]2713-sir , [I]0-i canna , wi ’ [my]2713-sir little learning an ’[2713-sir] [my]0-i common way , tell [the genelman]1472-the genelman what will better aw this — though [some working men o ’]4069-some working men o ’ [this town]3717-this town could , above [my]2713-sir powers — but [I]2713-sir can tell [him]1472-the genelman what [I]2713-sir know will never do ’[2713-sir] t. The strong hand will never do ’ t. Vict’ry and triumph will never do ’[2713-sir] t. Agreeing fur to mak one side unnat’rally [awlus]178-awlus and for ever right , and toother side unnat’rally [awlus]178-awlus and for ever wrong , will never , never do ’ t. Nor yet lettin alone will never do ’[2713-sir] t. Let [thousands upon thousands]1473-thousands upon thousands alone , aw leading the like lives and aw faw’en into the like muddle , and [they]1474-they will be as one , and [yo]1475-yo will be as anoother , wi ’ [a black unpassable world]4071-a black unpassable world betwixt [yo]1475-yo , just as long or short a time as sich - like misery can last . Not drawin nigh to fok , wi ’[1475-yo] kindness and patience an ’ cheery ways , that so draws nigh to [one another]2898-one another in [their]1474-they monny troubles , and so cherishes [one another]2898-one another in [their]1474-they distresses wi ’[1475-yo] what [they]1474-they need [themseln]1476-themseln — like , [I]0-i humbly believe , as [no people the genelman ha seen in aw [his]1478-his travels]1477-no people the genelman ha seen in aw his travels can beat — will never do ’ t till th ’[0-i] Sun turns t ’ ice . Most o ’[0-i] aw , rating ’em as so much Power , and reg’latin ’em[1474-they] as if [they]1474-they was figures in a soom , or machines : wi’out loves and likens , wi’out memories and inclinations , wi’out [souls to weary and souls to hope]1479-souls to weary and souls to hope — when aw goes quiet , draggin on wi ’ ’em[1474-they] as if [they]1474-they ’d nowt o ’ th ’[0-i] kind , and when aw goes onquiet , reproachin [’em]4074-’em for [their]1474-they want o ’[1474-they] sitch humanly feelins in [their]1474-they dealins wi ’ yo — this will never do ’[1474-they] t , [sir]2713-sir , till [God]126-god ’s work is onmade . ’ [Stephen]137-stephen stood with the open door in [his]137-stephen hand , waiting to know if anything more were expected of [him]137-stephen . ‘[1474-they] Just stop a moment , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , excessively red in the face . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]2713-sir , the last time [you]2713-sir were [here]354-here with a grievance , that [you]2713-sir had better turn about and come out of that . And [I]0-i also told [you]2713-sir , if [you]2713-sir remember , that [I]0-i was up to the gold spoon look - out . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i were not up to ’ t [myseln]4075-myseln , [sir]2713-sir ; [I]92-mr. bounderby do assure [yo]2713-sir . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Now it ’s clear to [me]92-mr. bounderby , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ that [you]2713-sir are one of [those chaps who have always got a grievance]4077-those chaps who have always got a grievance . And [you]2713-sir go about , sowing it and raising crops . That ’s the business of _ [your]2713-sir _ life , [[my]92-mr. bounderby friend]3004-my friend . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Stephen]137-stephen shook [his]137-stephen head , mutely protesting that indeed [he]137-stephen had other business to do for [his]137-stephen life . ‘ [You]2713-sir are such [a waspish , raspish , ill - conditioned chap]4079-a waspish , raspish , ill - conditioned chap , [you]2713-sir see , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ that even [[your]2713-sir own Union]4080-your own union , [the men who know [you]2713-sir best]4081-the men who know you best , will have nothing to do with [you]2713-sir . [I]92-mr. bounderby never thought [those fellows]4082-those fellows could be right in anything ; but [I]92-mr. bounderby tell [you]2713-sir what ! [I]92-mr. bounderby so far go along with [them]4082-those fellows for a novelty , that _ [I_’ll]92-mr. bounderby have nothing to do with [you]2713-sir either . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Stephen]137-stephen raised [his]137-stephen eyes quickly to [his]137-stephen face . ‘ [You]137-stephen can finish off what [you]137-stephen ’re[137-stephen] at , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , with a meaning nod , ‘[137-stephen] and then go elsewhere . ’ ‘[2713-sir] [Sir]2713-sir , [yo]2713-sir know weel , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen expressively , ‘[2713-sir] that if [I]0-i canna get work wi ’ [yo]2713-sir , [I]2713-sir canna get it elsewheer . ’[2713-sir] The reply was , ‘ What [I]137-stephen know , [I]137-stephen know ; and what [you]137-stephen know , [you]137-stephen know . [I]137-stephen have no more to say about it . ’[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen glanced at [Louisa]91-louisa again , but [her]91-louisa eyes were raised to [his]137-stephen no more ; therefore , with a sigh , and saying , barely above [his]137-stephen breath , ‘ [Heaven]80-heaven help [us]4083-us aw in [this world]961-this world ! ’[137-stephen] [he]137-stephen departed . CHAPTER VI FADING AWAY IT was falling dark when [Stephen]137-stephen came out of [[Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s house]3652-mr. bounderby ’s house . The shadows of night had gathered so fast , that [he]137-stephen did not look about [him]137-stephen when [he]137-stephen closed the door , but plodded straight along [the street]448-the street . Nothing was further from [his]137-stephen thoughts than [the curious old woman [he]137-stephen had encountered on [his]137-stephen previous visit to [the same house]1486-the same house]1485-the curious old woman he had encountered on his previous visit to the same house , when [he]137-stephen heard a step behind [him]137-stephen that [he]137-stephen knew , and turning , saw [her]1485-the curious old woman he had encountered on his previous visit to the same house in [Rachael]140-rachael ’s company . [He]137-stephen saw [Rachael]140-rachael first , as [he]137-stephen had heard [her]1485-the curious old woman he had encountered on his previous visit to the same house only . ‘ Ah , [Rachael]140-rachael , [[my]140-rachael dear]3090-my dear ! [Missus]4086-missus , [thou]4087-thou wi ’[140-rachael] [her]140-rachael ! ’ ‘[140-rachael] Well , and now [you]137-stephen are surprised to be sure , and with reason [I]0-i must say , ’ [the old woman]901-the old woman returned . ‘[137-stephen] Here [I]0-i am again , [you]137-stephen see . ’ ‘[137-stephen] But how wi ’ [Rachael]140-rachael ? ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen , falling into [their]1487-their step , walking between [them]1487-their , and looking from [the one]1488-the one to the other . ‘ Why , [I]901-the old woman come to be with [this good lass]4089-this good lass pretty much as [I]901-the old woman came to be with [you]137-stephen , ’[901-the old woman] said [the old woman]901-the old woman , cheerfully , taking the reply upon [herself]901-the old woman . ‘ [My]901-the old woman visiting time is later this year than usual , for [I]901-the old woman have been rather troubled with shortness of breath , and so put it off till the weather was fine and warm . For the same reason [I]901-the old woman do n’t make all [my]901-the old woman journey in one day , but divide it into two days , and get a bed to - night at [the Travellers ’[901-the old woman] Coffee House]4090-the travellers ’ coffee house down by [the railroad]3601-the railroad ( [a nice clean house]1491-a nice clean house ) , and go back [Parliamentary]20-parliamentary , at six in the morning . Well , but what has this to do with [this good lass]4089-this good lass , says [you]1493-you ? [I]0-i ’m going to tell [you]1493-you . [I]901-the old woman have heard of [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby being married . [I]901-the old woman read it in the paper , where it looked grand — oh , it looked fine ! ’[901-the old woman] [the old woman]901-the old woman dwelt on it with strange enthusiasm : ‘ and [I]901-the old woman want to see [[his]92-mr. bounderby wife]972-his wife . [I]901-the old woman have never seen [her]972-his wife yet . Now , if [you]1493-you ’ll believe [me]901-the old woman , [she]972-his wife has n’t come out of [that house]4092-that house since noon to - day . So not to give [her]972-his wife up too easily , [I]901-the old woman was waiting about , a little last bit more , when [I]901-the old woman passed close to [this good lass]4089-this good lass two or three times ; and [her]972-his wife face being so friendly [I]901-the old woman spoke to [her]972-his wife , and [she]972-his wife spoke to [me]901-the old woman . There ! ’[901-the old woman] said [the old woman]901-the old woman to [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘ [you]137-stephen can make all the rest out for [yourself]137-stephen now , a deal shorter than [I]901-the old woman can , [I]901-the old woman dare say ! ’[901-the old woman] Once again , [Stephen]137-stephen had to conquer an instinctive propensity to dislike [this old woman]441-this old woman , though [her]441-this old woman manner was as honest and simple as a manner possibly could be . With a gentleness that was as natural to [him]137-stephen as [he]137-stephen knew it to be to [Rachael]140-rachael , [he]137-stephen pursued the subject that interested [her]441-this old woman in [her]441-this old woman old age . ‘ Well , [missus]3363-missus , ’[137-stephen] said [he]137-stephen , ‘ [I]137-stephen ha seen [the lady]730-the lady , and [she]730-the lady were young and hansom . Wi ’[137-stephen] fine dark thinkin eyes , and a still way , [Rachael]140-rachael , as [I]0-i ha never seen the like on . ’ ‘[1497-young and handsome] [Young and handsome]1497-young and handsome . Yes ! ’ cried [the old woman]901-the old woman , quite delighted . ‘[1497-young and handsome] As bonny as a rose ! And what [a happy wife]1498-a happy wife ! ’ ‘[3363-missus] Aye , [missus]3363-missus , [I]0-i suppose [she]441-this old woman be , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen . But with a doubtful glance at [Rachael]140-rachael . ‘[441-this old woman] Suppose [she]441-this old woman be ? [She]441-this old woman must be . [She]441-this old woman ’s [[[your]137-stephen master]3244-your master ’s wife]1501-your master ’s wife , ’ returned [the old woman]901-the old woman . [Stephen]137-stephen nodded assent . ‘[441-this old woman] Though as to [master]2922-master , ’ said [he]3244-your master , glancing again at [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘[2922-master] not [master onny]1503-master onny more . That ’s aw enden ’ twixt [him]2922-master and [me]140-rachael . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Have [you]137-stephen left [his]2922-master work , [Stephen]137-stephen ? ’[140-rachael] asked [Rachael]140-rachael , anxiously and quickly . ‘ Why , [Rachael]140-rachael , ’[3244-your master] [he]3244-your master replied , ‘ whether [I]3244-your master ha lef’n [his]2922-master work , or whether [his]2922-master work ha lef’n [me]3244-your master , cooms t ’[3244-your master] th ’ same . [His]2922-master work and [me]140-rachael are parted . ’[140-rachael] Tis as weel so — better , [I]0-i were thinkin when [yo]1504-yo coom up wi ’ [me]140-rachael . It would ha brought’n trouble upon trouble if [I]140-rachael had stayed [theer]1504-yo . Haply ’[140-rachael] tis a kindness to [monny]1374-monny that [I]0-i go ; haply ’ tis a kindness to [myseln]1374-monny ; anyways it mun be done . [I]140-rachael mun turn [my]140-rachael face fro [Coketown]4-coketown fur th ’[140-rachael] time , and seek a fort’n , [dear]2972-dear , by beginnin fresh . ’ ‘[2972-dear] Where will [you]0-i go , [Stephen]137-stephen ? ’ ‘[137-stephen] [I]0-i donno t’night , ’ said [he]0-i , lifting off [his]0-i hat , and smoothing [his]0-i thin hair with the flat of [his]0-i hand . ‘[0-i] But [I]0-i ’m not goin t’night , [Rachael]140-rachael , nor yet t’morrow . ’[0-i] Tan’t easy overmuch t ’ know wheer t ’[0-i] turn , but a good heart will coom to [me]0-i . ’ Herein , too , the sense of even thinking unselfishly aided [him]0-i . Before [he]0-i had so much as closed [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s door , [he]0-i had reflected that at least [his]0-i being obliged to go away was good for [her]140-rachael , as it would save [her]140-rachael from the chance of being brought into question for not withdrawing from [him]0-i . Though it would cost [him]0-i a hard pang to leave [her]140-rachael , and though [he]0-i could think of no similar place in which [his]0-i condemnation would not pursue [him]0-i , perhaps it was almost a relief to be forced away from the endurance of the last four days , even to unknown difficulties and distresses . So [he]0-i said , with truth , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m more leetsome , [Rachael]140-rachael , under ’[0-i] t , than [I]0-i could’n [ha]1507-ha believed . ’ It was not [her]140-rachael part to make [his]0-i burden heavier . [She]140-rachael answered with [her]140-rachael comforting smile , and [the three]4098-the three walked on together . Age , especially when it strives to be self - reliant and cheerful , finds much consideration among [the poor]4099-the poor . [The old woman]901-the old woman was so decent and contented , and made so light of [her]901-the old woman infirmities , though [they]4098-the three had increased upon [her]901-the old woman since [her]901-the old woman former interview with [Stephen]137-stephen , that [they]4098-the three both took an interest in [her]901-the old woman . [She]140-rachael was too sprightly to allow of [their]4098-the three walking at a slow pace on [her]140-rachael account , but [she]140-rachael was very grateful to be talked to , and very willing to talk to any extent : so , when [they]4098-the three came to [[their]4098-the three part of [the town]317-the town]4101-their part of the town , [she]140-rachael was more brisk and vivacious than ever . ‘[0-i] Come to [[my]0-i poor place]1508-my poor place , [missus]3363-missus , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘[3363-missus] and tak a coop o ’ tea . [Rachael]140-rachael will coom then ; and arterwards [I]0-i ’ll see [thee]3363-missus safe t ’[0-i] [[thy]3363-missus Travellers ’ lodgin]4103-thy travellers ’ lodgin . ’[4103-thy travellers ’ lodgin] T may be long , [Rachael]140-rachael , ere ever [I]0-i ha th ’ chance o ’[140-rachael] [thy]3363-missus coompany agen . ’ [They]4098-the three complied , and [the three]4098-the three went on to [the house where [he]0-i lodged]4105-the house where he lodged . When [they]4098-the three turned into [a narrow street]4106-a narrow street , [Stephen]137-stephen glanced at [his]137-stephen window with a dread that always haunted [[his]137-stephen desolate home]4107-his desolate home ; but [it]4107-his desolate home was open , as [he]137-stephen had left [it]4107-his desolate home , and [no one]545-no one was [there]412-there . The evil spirit of [his]137-stephen life had flitted away again , months ago , and [he]137-stephen had heard no more of [her]140-rachael since . The only evidence of [her]140-rachael last return now , were the scantier moveables in [[his]137-stephen room]3401-his room , and the grayer hair upon [his]137-stephen head . [He]137-stephen lighted a candle , set out [his]137-stephen little tea - board , got hot water from below , and brought in small portions of tea and sugar , a loaf , and some butter from [the nearest shop]4111-the nearest shop . The bread was new and crusty , the butter fresh , and the sugar lump , of course — in fulfilment of the standard testimony of [the Coketown magnates]4112-the coketown magnates , that [these people]3064-these people lived like [princes]3122-princes , [sir]2713-sir . [Rachael]140-rachael made the tea ( so large a party necessitated the borrowing of a cup ) , and [the visitor]1151-the visitor enjoyed it mightily . It was the first glimpse of sociality [the host]4117-the host had had for many days . [He]137-stephen too , with [the world]2766-the world a wide heath before [him]137-stephen , enjoyed the meal — again in corroboration of [the magnates]4119-the magnates , as exemplifying the utter want of calculation on the part of [these people]3064-these people , [sir]2713-sir . ‘[140-rachael] [I]0-i ha never thowt yet , [missus]3363-missus , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘[3363-missus] o ’ askin [thy]3363-missus name . ’[1511-the old lady] [The old lady]1511-the old lady announced [herself]1511-the old lady as ‘ [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler . ’[1511-the old lady] ‘ A widder , [I]137-stephen think ? ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen . ‘ Oh , many long years ! ’[1511-the old lady] [[Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler ’s husband]1512-mrs. pegler ’s husband ( one of the best on record ) was already dead , by [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler ’s calculation , when [Stephen]137-stephen was born . ‘ ’[179-mrs. pegler] Twere a bad job , too , to lose so good a one , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen . ‘[179-mrs. pegler] [Onny children]1513-onny children ? ’ [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler ’s cup , rattling against [her]179-mrs. pegler saucer as [she]179-mrs. pegler held it , denoted some nervousness on [her]179-mrs. pegler part . ‘[179-mrs. pegler] No , ’ [she]179-mrs. pegler said . ‘[179-mrs. pegler] Not now , not now . ’ ‘[137-stephen] Dead , [Stephen]137-stephen , ’ [Rachael]140-rachael softly hinted . ‘[137-stephen] [I]0-i ’m sooary [I]179-mrs. pegler ha spok’n on ’[179-mrs. pegler] t , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , ‘[179-mrs. pegler] [I]0-i ought t ’ hadn in [my]0-i mind as [I]0-i might touch a sore place . [I]0-i — [I]0-i blame [myseln]0-i . ’[0-i] While [he]0-i excused [himself]0-i , [the old lady]1511-the old lady ’s cup rattled more and more . ‘ [I]1511-the old lady had [a son]4122-a son , ’[1511-the old lady] [she]1511-the old lady said , curiously distressed , and not by any of the usual appearances of sorrow ; ‘ and [he]4122-a son did well , wonderfully well . But [he]4122-a son is not to be spoken of if [you]0-i please . [He]4122-a son is — ’[1511-the old lady] Putting down [her]1511-the old lady cup , [she]1511-the old lady moved [her]1511-the old lady hands as if [she]1511-the old lady would have added , by [her]1511-the old lady action , ‘ dead ! ’[1511-the old lady] Then [she]1511-the old lady said aloud , ‘ [I]1511-the old lady have lost [him]4122-a son . ’[1511-the old lady] [Stephen]137-stephen had not yet got the better of [his]0-i having given [the old lady]1511-the old lady pain , when [[his]137-stephen landlady]1516-his landlady came stumbling up [the narrow stairs]1517-the narrow stairs , and calling [him]137-stephen to the door , whispered in [his]137-stephen ear . [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler was by no means deaf , for [she]179-mrs. pegler caught a word as it was uttered . ‘ [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ! ’[1511-the old lady] [she]1511-the old lady cried , in a suppressed voice , starting up from the table . ‘ Oh hide [me]1511-the old lady ! Do n’t let [me]1511-the old lady be seen for [the world]2766-the world . Do n’t let [him]92-mr. bounderby come up till [I]1511-the old lady ’ve got away . Pray , pray ! ’[1511-the old lady] [She]1511-the old lady trembled , and was excessively agitated ; getting behind [Rachael]140-rachael , when [Rachael]140-rachael tried to reassure [her]1511-the old lady ; and not seeming to know what [she]1511-the old lady was about . ‘ But hearken , [missus]3363-missus , hearken , ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen , astonished . ‘ ’[137-stephen] Tisn’t [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ; ’ tis [[his]92-mr. bounderby wife]972-his wife . [Yo’r]137-stephen not fearfo ’[137-stephen] o ’ [her]972-his wife . [Yo]137-stephen was hey - go - mad about [her]972-his wife , but an hour sin . ’[137-stephen] ‘ But are [you]137-stephen sure it ’s [the lady]730-the lady , and not [the gentleman]284-the gentleman ? ’[1511-the old lady] [she]1511-the old lady asked , still trembling . ‘ Certain sure ! ’[1511-the old lady] ‘ Well then , pray do n’t speak to [me]901-the old woman , nor yet take any notice of [me]901-the old woman , ’[901-the old woman] said [the old woman]901-the old woman . ‘ Let [me]901-the old woman be quite to [myself]901-the old woman in this corner . ’[901-the old woman] [Stephen]137-stephen nodded ; looking to [Rachael]140-rachael for an explanation , which [she]140-rachael was quite unable to give [him]137-stephen ; took the candle , went [downstairs]3101-downstairs , and in a few moments returned , lighting [Louisa]91-louisa into [the room]2859-the room . [She]91-louisa was followed by [the whelp]1268-the whelp . [Rachael]140-rachael had risen , and stood apart with [her]140-rachael shawl and bonnet in [her]140-rachael hand , when [Stephen]137-stephen , [himself]137-stephen profoundly astonished by this visit , put the candle on the table . Then [he]137-stephen too stood , with [his]137-stephen doubled hand upon the table near it , waiting to be addressed . For the first time in [her]91-louisa life [Louisa]91-louisa had come into [one of [the dwellings of [the Coketown Hands]145-the coketown hands]1523-the dwellings of the coketown hands]1522-one of the dwellings of the coketown hands ; for the first time in [her]91-louisa life [she]91-louisa was face to face with anything like individuality in connection with [them]145-the coketown hands . [She]91-louisa knew of [their]145-the coketown hands existence by hundreds and by [thousands]1524-thousands . [She]91-louisa knew what results in work a given number of [them]145-the coketown hands would produce in a given space of time . [She]91-louisa knew [them]145-the coketown hands in crowds passing to and from [[their]145-the coketown hands nests]1525-their nests , like ants or beetles . But [she]91-louisa knew from [her]91-louisa reading infinitely more of the ways of toiling insects than of [these toiling men]1526-these toiling men and [women]574-women . Something to be worked so much and paid so much , and there ended ; something to be infallibly settled by laws of supply and demand ; something that blundered against those laws , and floundered into difficulty ; something that was a little pinched when wheat was dear , and over - ate itself when wheat was cheap ; something that increased at such a rate of percentage , and yielded such another percentage of crime , and such another percentage of [pauperism]1528-pauperism ; something wholesale , of which vast fortunes were made ; something that occasionally rose like [a sea]1529-a sea , and did some harm and waste ( chiefly to itself ) , and fell again ; this [she]91-louisa knew the Coketown Hands to be . But , [she]91-louisa had scarcely thought more of separating them into units , than of separating [the sea]697-the sea itself into its component drops . [She]91-louisa stood for some moments looking round [the room]2859-the room . From the few chairs , the few books , the common prints , and the bed , [she]91-louisa glanced to [the two women]1532-the two women , and to [Stephen]137-stephen . ‘ [I]91-louisa have come to speak to [you]137-stephen , in consequence of what passed just now . [I]91-louisa should like to be serviceable to [you]137-stephen , if [you]137-stephen will let [me]91-louisa . Is this [[your]137-stephen wife]887-your wife ? ’[91-louisa] [Rachael]140-rachael raised [her]140-rachael eyes , and they sufficiently answered no , and dropped again . ‘ [I]91-louisa remember , ’[91-louisa] said [Louisa]91-louisa , reddening at [her]91-louisa mistake ; ‘ [I]91-louisa recollect , now , to have heard [your]137-stephen domestic misfortunes spoken of , though [I]91-louisa was not attending to the particulars at the time . It was not [my]91-louisa meaning to ask a question that would give pain to [any one here]4129-any one here . If [I]91-louisa should ask any other question that may happen to have that result , give [me]91-louisa credit , if [you]137-stephen please , for being in ignorance how to speak to [you]137-stephen as [I]91-louisa ought . ’[91-louisa] As [Stephen]137-stephen had but a little while ago instinctively addressed [himself]137-stephen to [her]91-louisa , so [she]91-louisa now instinctively addressed [herself]91-louisa to [Rachael]140-rachael . [Her]91-louisa manner was short and abrupt , yet faltering and timid . ‘ [He]137-stephen has told [you]137-stephen what has passed between [himself]137-stephen and [[my]91-louisa husband]3766-my husband ? [You]137-stephen would be [[his]137-stephen first resource]4131-his first resource , [I]91-louisa think . ’[91-louisa] ‘ [I]140-rachael have heard the end of it , [young lady]4132-young lady , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael . ‘ Did [I]140-rachael understand , that , being rejected by [one employer]4133-one employer , [he]137-stephen would probably be rejected by all ? [I]140-rachael thought [he]137-stephen said as much ? ’[140-rachael] ‘ The chances are very small , [young lady]4132-young lady — next to nothing — for [a man who gets a bad name among [them]4136-them]4135-a man who gets a bad name among them . ’[91-louisa] ‘ What shall [I]91-louisa understand that [you]91-louisa mean by a bad name ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ The name of being troublesome . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Then , by the prejudices of [[his]137-stephen own class]833-his own class , and by the prejudices of the other , [he]137-stephen is sacrificed alike ? Are the two so deeply separated in [this town]3717-this town , that there is no place whatever for [an honest workman]4139-an honest workman between [them]4140-them ? ’[140-rachael] [Rachael]140-rachael shook [her]140-rachael head in silence . ‘ [He]137-stephen fell into suspicion , ’[91-louisa] said [Louisa]91-louisa , ‘ with [[his]137-stephen fellow - weavers]4141-his fellow - weavers , because — [he]137-stephen had made a promise not to be [one of [them]4141-his fellow - weavers]4142-one of them . [I]91-louisa think it must have been to [you]140-rachael that [he]137-stephen made that promise . Might [I]91-louisa ask [you]140-rachael why [he]137-stephen made it ? ’[91-louisa] [Rachael]140-rachael burst into tears . ‘ [I]137-stephen did n’t seek it of [him]137-stephen , [poor lad]4143-poor lad . [I]137-stephen prayed [him]137-stephen to avoid trouble for [his]137-stephen own good , little thinking [he]137-stephen ’d come to it through [me]137-stephen . But [I]137-stephen know [he]137-stephen ’d die a hundred deaths , ere ever [he]137-stephen ’d break [his]137-stephen word . [I]137-stephen know that of [him]137-stephen well . ’[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen had remained quietly attentive , in [his]137-stephen usual thoughtful attitude , with [his]137-stephen hand at [his]137-stephen chin . [He]137-stephen now spoke in a voice rather less steady than usual . ‘ [No one]545-no one , excepting [myseln]4145-myseln , can ever know what honour , an ’[137-stephen] what love , an ’ respect , [I]137-stephen bear to [Rachael]140-rachael , or wi ’[137-stephen] what cause . When [I]0-i passed [that promess]1533-that promess , [I]0-i towd [her]1533-that promess true , [she]1533-that promess were [th ’ Angel o ’]4146-th ’ angel o ’[4146-th ’ angel o ’] [my]0-i life . ’ Twere [a solemn promess]4147-a solemn promess . ’[1533-that promess] Tis gone fro ’ [me]91-louisa , for ever . ’[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa turned [her]91-louisa head to [him]137-stephen , and bent it with a deference that was new in [her]91-louisa . [She]91-louisa looked from [him]137-stephen to [Rachael]140-rachael , and [her]91-louisa features softened . ‘ What will [you]137-stephen do ? ’[91-louisa] [she]91-louisa asked [him]137-stephen . And [her]91-louisa voice had softened too . ‘ Weel , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen , making the best of it , with a smile ; ‘ when [I]137-stephen ha finished off , [I]137-stephen mun quit this part , and try another . Fortnet or misfortnet , [a man]3830-a man can but try ; there ’s nowt to be done wi’out tryin’—cept laying down and dying . ’[137-stephen] ‘ How will [you]137-stephen travel ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ Afoot , [my]91-louisa kind ledy , afoot . ’[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa coloured , and a purse appeared in [her]91-louisa hand . The rustling of a bank - note was audible , as [she]91-louisa unfolded one and laid it on the table . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , will [you]140-rachael tell [him]137-stephen — for [you]140-rachael know how , without offence — that this is freely [his]137-stephen , to help [him]137-stephen on [his]137-stephen way ? Will [you]140-rachael entreat [him]137-stephen to take it ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ [I]91-louisa canna do that , [young lady]4132-young lady , ’[91-louisa] [she]91-louisa answered , turning [her]91-louisa head aside . ‘ Bless [you]140-rachael for thinking o ’[91-louisa] [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad wi ’ such tenderness . [She]91-louisa stretched out [hers]91-louisa , as if [she]91-louisa would have touched [him]4151-this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview ; then checked [herself]91-louisa , and remained still . ‘[91-louisa] Not e’en [Rachael]140-rachael , ’ said [Stephen]137-stephen , when [he]137-stephen stood again with [his]137-stephen face uncovered , ‘[1535-mak] could [mak]1535-mak sitch a kind offerin , by onny words , kinder . T ’ show that [I]3830-a man ’m[3830-a man] not [a man]3830-a man wi’out reason and gratitude , [I]0-i ’ll tak two pound . [I]0-i ’ll borrow ’ t for t ’[0-i] pay ’ t back . ’[0-i] Twill be the sweetest work as ever [I]0-i ha done , that puts it in [my]0-i power t ’ acknowledge once more [my]140-rachael lastin thankfulness for this present action . ’[140-rachael] [She]140-rachael was fain to take up the note again , and to substitute the much smaller sum [he]0-i had named . [He]0-i was neither courtly , nor handsome , nor picturesque , in any respect ; and yet [his]0-i manner of accepting it , and of expressing [his]0-i thanks without more words , had a grace in it that [Lord Chesterfield]180-lord chesterfield could not have taught [[his]180-lord chesterfield son]3997-his son in a century . [Tom]75-tom had sat upon the bed , swinging one leg and sucking [his]75-tom walking - stick with sufficient unconcern , until the visit had attained this stage . Seeing [[his]75-tom sister]644-his sister ready to depart , [he]75-tom got up , rather hurriedly , and put in a word . ‘ Just wait a moment , [Loo]100-loo ! Never mind a light , [man]2923-man ! ’[75-tom] [Tom]75-tom was remarkably impatient of [his]75-tom moving towards the cupboard , to get one . ‘ It do n’t want a light . ’[137-stephen] [Stephen]137-stephen followed [him]75-tom out , and [Tom]75-tom closed [the room]2859-the room door , and held the lock in [his]75-tom hand . ‘ [I]75-tom say ! ’[75-tom] [he]75-tom whispered . ‘ [I]75-tom think [I]75-tom can do [you]137-stephen a good turn . When are [you]137-stephen off ? ’[75-tom] ‘ T ’[137-stephen] day ’s Monday , ’ replied [Stephen]137-stephen , considering . ‘[137-stephen] Why , [sir]2713-sir , Friday or Saturday , nigh ’bout . ’[75-tom] ‘ Friday or Saturday , ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom . ‘ Now look here ! [You]137-stephen are sure [you]137-stephen understand . ’[1541-i] [He]1541-i had wormed a finger , in the darkness , through a button - hole of [Stephen]137-stephen ’s coat , and was screwing that corner of the garment tight up round and round , in an extraordinary manner . ‘ [I]137-stephen understand , [sir]2713-sir , ’[137-stephen] said [Stephen]137-stephen . ‘ Now look here ! ’[75-tom] repeated [Tom]75-tom . ‘ Be sure [you]137-stephen do n’t make any mistake then , and do n’t forget . [You]1542-you ’re[75-tom] all right , are [you]1542-you ? [You]1542-you understand all about it ? Very well then .
