A curious passive inattention had such possession of [her]91-louisa , that the presence of [[her]91-louisa little sister]2017-her little sister in [the room]2859-the room did not attract [her]91-louisa notice for some time . Even when [their]2019-their eyes had met , and [[her]91-louisa sister]4377-her sister had approached the bed , [Louisa]91-louisa lay for minutes looking at [her]4377-her sister in silence , and suffering [her]4377-her sister timidly to hold [her]4377-her sister passive hand , before [she]91-louisa asked : ‘ When was [I]91-louisa brought to [this room]4066-this room ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ Last night , [Louisa]91-louisa . ’[91-louisa] ‘ Who brought [me]91-louisa [here]354-here ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ [Sissy]76-sissy , [I]91-louisa believe . ’[91-louisa] ‘ Why do [you]91-louisa believe so ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ Because [I]91-louisa found [her]2017-her little sister [here]354-here this morning . [She]2017-her little sister did n’t come to [my]91-louisa bedside to wake [me]91-louisa , as [she]2017-her little sister always does ; and [I]91-louisa went to look for [her]2017-her little sister . [She]2017-her little sister was not in [[her]2017-her little sister own room]4549-her own room either ; and [I]91-louisa went looking for [her]2017-her little sister all over [the house]2875-the house , until [I]91-louisa found [her]2017-her little sister here taking care of [you]91-louisa and cooling [your]91-louisa head . Will [you]91-louisa see [father]2723-father ? [Sissy]76-sissy said [I]91-louisa was to tell [him]2723-father when [you]91-louisa woke . ’[91-louisa] ‘ What a beaming face [you]2021-her young sister have , [Jane]99-jane ! ’[91-louisa] said [Louisa]91-louisa , as [[her]91-louisa young sister]2021-her young sister — timidly still — bent down to kiss [her]91-louisa . ‘ Have [I]91-louisa ? [I]91-louisa am very glad [you]2021-her young sister think so . [I]91-louisa am sure it must be [Sissy]76-sissy ’s doing . ’[91-louisa] The arm [Louisa]91-louisa had begun to twine around [her]91-louisa neck , unbent itself . ‘ [You]91-louisa can tell [father]2723-father if [you]91-louisa will . ’[91-louisa] Then , staying [her]91-louisa for a moment , [she]91-louisa said , ‘ It was [you]2723-father who made [[my]91-louisa room]1026-my room so cheerful , and gave [it]1026-my room this look of welcome ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ Oh no , [Louisa]91-louisa , it was done before [I]91-louisa came . It was — ’[91-louisa] [Louisa]91-louisa turned upon [her]91-louisa pillow , and heard no more . When [[her]91-louisa sister]4377-her sister had withdrawn , [she]91-louisa turned [her]91-louisa head back again , and lay with [her]91-louisa face towards the door , until it opened and [[her]91-louisa father]335-her father entered . [He]335-her father had a jaded anxious look upon [him]335-her father , and [his]335-her father hand , usually steady , trembled in [hers]91-louisa . [He]335-her father sat down at the side of the bed , tenderly asking how [she]91-louisa was , and dwelling on the necessity of [her]91-louisa keeping very quiet after [her]91-louisa agitation and exposure to the weather last night . [He]335-her father spoke in a subdued and troubled voice , very different from [his]335-her father usual dictatorial manner ; and was often at a loss for words . ‘ [[My]335-her father dear]3090-my dear [Louisa]91-louisa . [[My]335-her father poor daughter]4555-my poor daughter . ’[335-her father] [He]335-her father was so much at a loss at [that place]4386-that place , that [he]335-her father stopped altogether . [He]335-her father tried again . ‘ [[My]335-her father unfortunate child]4556-my unfortunate child . ’[335-her father] [The place]329-the place was so difficult to get over , that [he]335-her father tried again . ‘ It would be hopeless for [me]335-her father , [Louisa]91-louisa , to endeavour to tell [you]91-louisa how overwhelmed [I]335-her father have been , and still am , by what broke upon [me]335-her father last night . The ground on which [I]335-her father stand has ceased to be solid under [my]335-her father feet . The only support on which [I]335-her father leaned , and the strength of which it seemed , and still does seem , impossible to question , has given way in an instant . [I]335-her father am stunned by these discoveries . [I]335-her father have no selfish meaning in what [I]335-her father say ; but [I]335-her father find the shock of what broke upon [me]335-her father last night , to be very heavy indeed . ’[335-her father] [She]2026-she could give [him]335-her father no comfort herein . [She]2026-she had suffered the wreck of [her]2026-she whole life upon [the rock]2027-the rock . ‘ [I]2028-i will not say , [Louisa]91-louisa , that if [you]91-louisa had by any happy chance undeceived [me]2028-i some time ago , it would have been better for [us]4557-us both ; better for [your]91-louisa peace , and better for [mine]2028-i . For [I]2028-i am sensible that it may not have been a part of [my]2028-i system to invite any confidence of that kind . [I]2028-i had proved [my]2028-i — [my]2028-i system to [myself]2028-i , and [I]2028-i have rigidly administered it ; and [I]2028-i must bear the responsibility of its failures . [I]2028-i only entreat [you]91-louisa to believe , [[my]2028-i favourite child]3539-my favourite child , that [I]2028-i have meant to do right . ’[2028-i] [He]2028-i said it earnestly , and to do [him]2028-i justice [he]2028-i had . In gauging fathomless deeps with [his]2028-i little mean excise - rod , and in staggering over [the universe]2029-the universe with [his]2028-i rusty stiff - legged compasses , [he]2028-i had meant to do great things . Within the limits of [his]2028-i short tether [he]2028-i had tumbled about , annihilating the flowers of existence with greater singleness of purpose than [many of [the blatant personages whose company [he]2028-i kept]2031-the blatant personages whose company he kept]2030-many of the blatant personages whose company he kept . ‘ [I]2028-i am well assured of what [you]91-louisa say , [father]2723-father . [I]2028-i know [I]2028-i have been [[your]91-louisa favourite child]4560-your favourite child . [I]2028-i know [you]91-louisa have intended to make [me]2028-i happy . [I]2028-i have never blamed [you]91-louisa , and [I]2028-i never shall . ’[2028-i] [He]2028-i took [her]2032-you outstretched hand , and retained it in [his]2028-i . ‘ [[My]2028-i dear]3090-my dear , [I]2028-i have remained all night at [my]2028-i table , pondering again and again on what has so painfully passed between [us]4562-us . When [I]2028-i consider [your]2032-you character ; when [I]2028-i consider that what has been known to [me]2028-i for hours , has been concealed by [you]2032-you for years ; when [I]2028-i consider under what immediate pressure it has been forced from [you]2032-you at last ; [I]2028-i come to the conclusion that [I]2028-i can not but mistrust [myself]2028-i . ’[2028-i] [He]2028-i might have added more than all , when [he]2028-i saw the face now looking at [him]2028-i . [He]2028-i did add it in effect , perhaps , as [he]2028-i softly moved [her]2033-her scattered hair from [her]2033-her forehead with [his]2028-i hand . Such little actions , slight in [another man]3357-another man , were very noticeable in [him]2028-i ; and [[his]2028-i daughter]345-his daughter received them as if they had been words of contrition . ‘ But , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , slowly , and with hesitation , as well as with a wretched sense of happiness , ‘ if [I]75-tom see reason to mistrust [myself]75-tom for the past , [Louisa]91-louisa , [I]75-tom should also mistrust [myself]75-tom for the present and the future . To speak unreservedly to [you]91-louisa , [I]75-tom do . [I]75-tom am far from feeling convinced now , however differently [I]75-tom might have felt only this time yesterday , that [I]75-tom am fit for the trust [you]91-louisa repose in [me]75-tom ; that [I]75-tom know how to respond to the appeal [you]91-louisa have come [home]336-home to make to [me]75-tom ; that [I]75-tom have the right instinct — supposing it for the moment to be some quality of that nature — how to help [you]91-louisa , and to set [you]91-louisa right , [[my]75-tom child]1047-my child . ’[75-tom] [She]2036-her had turned upon [her]2036-her pillow , and lay with [her]2036-her face upon [her]2036-her arm , so that [he]2037-i could not see it . All [her]2036-her wildness and passion had subsided ; but , though softened , [she]2036-her was not in tears . [[Her]2036-her father]335-her father was changed in nothing so much as in the respect that [he]2037-i would have been glad to see [her]2036-her in tears . ‘ [Some persons]4565-some persons hold , ’[2037-i] [he]2037-i pursued , still hesitating , ‘ that there is a wisdom of the Head , and that there is a wisdom of the Heart . [I]2037-i have not supposed so ; but , as [I]2037-i have said , [I]2037-i mistrust [myself]2037-i now . [I]2037-i have supposed the head to be all - sufficient . It may not be all - sufficient ; how can [I]2037-i venture this morning to say it is ! If that other kind of wisdom should be what [I]2037-i have neglected , and should be the instinct that is wanted , [Louisa]91-louisa — ’[2037-i] [He]2037-i suggested it very doubtfully , as if [he]2037-i were half unwilling to admit it even now . [She]2036-her made [him]2037-i no answer , lying before [him]2037-i on [her]2036-her bed , still half - dressed , much as [he]2037-i had seen [her]2036-her lying on the floor of [[his]2037-i room]3401-his room last night . ‘ [Louisa]91-louisa , ’[2037-i] and [his]2037-i hand rested on [her]2036-her hair again , ‘ [I]2037-i have been absent from [here]354-here , [[my]2037-i dear]3090-my dear , a good deal of late ; and though [[your]2036-her sister]2822-your sister ’s training has been pursued according to — the system , ’[2037-i] [he]2037-i appeared to come to that word with great reluctance always , ‘ it has necessarily been modified by daily associations begun , in [her]2822-your sister case , at an early age . [I]2037-i ask [you]91-louisa — ignorantly and humbly , [[my]2037-i daughter]4569-my daughter — for the better , do [you]91-louisa think ? ’[2037-i] ‘ [Father]106-father , ’[2036-her] [she]2036-her replied , without stirring , ‘ if any harmony has been awakened in [her]2822-your sister young breast that was mute in [mine]2037-i until it turned to discord , let [her]2822-your sister thank [Heaven]80-heaven for it , and go upon [her]2822-your sister happier way , taking it as [her]2822-your sister greatest blessing that [she]2822-your sister has avoided [my]2036-her way . ’[2036-her] ‘ O [[my]2040-he child]1047-my child , [[my]2040-he child]1047-my child ! ’[2040-he] [he]2040-he said , in a forlorn manner , ‘ [I]2040-he am [an unhappy man]4572-an unhappy man to see [you]2041-she thus ! What avails it to [me]2040-he that [you]2041-she do not reproach [me]2040-he , if [I]2040-he so bitterly reproach [myself]2040-he ! ’[2040-he] [He]2040-he bent [his]2040-he head , and spoke low to [her]2041-she . ‘ [Louisa]91-louisa , [I]2040-he have a misgiving that some change may have been slowly working about [me]2040-he in [this house]3165-this house , by mere love and gratitude : that what the Head had left undone and could not do , the Heart may have been doing silently . Can it be so ? ’[2040-he] [She]2041-she made [him]2040-he no reply . ‘ [I]2041-she am not too proud to believe it , [Louisa]91-louisa . How could [I]2041-she be arrogant , and [you]91-louisa before [me]2041-she ! Can it be so ? Is it so , [[my]2041-she dear]3090-my dear ? ’[2041-she] [He]2040-he looked upon [her]2041-she once more , lying cast away there ; and without another word went out of [the room]2859-the room . [He]2040-he had not been long gone , when [she]2041-she heard a light tread near the door , and knew that [some one]973-some one stood beside [her]2041-she . [She]2041-she did not raise [her]2041-she head . A dull anger that [she]2041-she should be seen in [her]2041-she distress , and that the involuntary look [she]2041-she had so resented should come to this fulfilment , smouldered within [her]2041-she like an unwholesome fire . [All closely imprisoned forces]2044-all closely imprisoned forces rend and destroy . The air that would be healthful to [the earth]3171-the earth , the water that would enrich it , the heat that would ripen it , tear it when caged up . So in [her]2041-she bosom even now ; the strongest qualities [she]2041-she possessed , long turned upon themselves , became a heap of obduracy , that rose against [a friend]3703-a friend . It was well that soft touch came upon [her]2041-she neck , and that [she]2041-she understood [herself]2041-she to be supposed to have fallen asleep . The sympathetic hand did not claim [her]2041-she resentment . Let it lie there , let it lie . It lay there , warming into life a crowd of gentler thoughts ; and [she]2041-she rested . As [she]2041-she softened with the quiet , and the consciousness of being so watched , some tears made their way into [her]2041-she eyes . The face touched [hers]2041-she , and [she]2041-she knew that there were tears upon it too , and [she]2041-she the cause of them . As [Louisa]91-louisa feigned to rouse [herself]91-louisa , and sat up , [Sissy]76-sissy retired , so that [she]2041-she stood placidly near the bedside . ‘ [I]2041-she hope [I]2041-she have not disturbed [you]91-louisa . [I]2041-she have come to ask if [you]76-sissy would let [me]2041-she stay with [you]76-sissy ? ’[2041-she] ‘ Why should [you]76-sissy stay with [me]2041-she ? [[My]2041-she sister]664-my sister will miss [you]91-louisa . [You]91-louisa are everything to [her]664-my sister . ’[2041-she] ‘ Am [I]76-sissy ? ’[76-sissy] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , shaking [her]76-sissy head . ‘ [I]76-sissy would be something to [you]91-louisa , if [I]76-sissy might . ’[76-sissy] ‘ What ? ’[91-louisa] said [Louisa]91-louisa , almost sternly . ‘ Whatever [you]76-sissy want most , if [I]91-louisa could be that . At all events , [I]91-louisa would like to try to be as near it as [I]91-louisa can . And however far off that may be , [I]91-louisa will never tire of trying . Will [you]76-sissy let [me]91-louisa ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ [[My]76-sissy father]1699-my father sent [you]76-sissy to ask [me]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] ‘ No indeed , ’[76-sissy] replied [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘ [He]1699-my father told [me]91-louisa that [I]91-louisa might come in now , but [he]1699-my father sent [me]91-louisa away from [the room]2859-the room this morning — or at least — ’[91-louisa] [She]91-louisa hesitated and stopped . ‘ At least , what ? ’[91-louisa] said [Louisa]91-louisa , with [her]91-louisa searching eyes upon [her]91-louisa . ‘ [I]91-louisa thought it best [myself]91-louisa that [I]91-louisa should be sent away , for [I]91-louisa felt very uncertain whether [you]76-sissy would like to find [me]91-louisa [here]354-here . ’[91-louisa] ‘ Have [I]76-sissy always hated [you]76-sissy so much ? ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]2047-i hope not , for [I]2047-i have always loved [you]76-sissy , and have always wished that [you]76-sissy should know it . But [you]76-sissy changed to [me]2047-i a little , shortly before [you]76-sissy left [home]336-home . Not that [I]2047-i wondered at it . [You]76-sissy knew so much , and [I]2047-i knew so little , and it was so natural in many ways , going as [you]76-sissy were among [other friends]4580-other friends , that [I]2047-i had nothing to complain of , and was not at all hurt . ’[2047-i] [Her]2047-i colour rose as [she]2047-i said it modestly and hurriedly . [Louisa]91-louisa understood the loving pretence , and [her]91-louisa heart smote [her]91-louisa . ‘ May [I]76-sissy try ? ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , emboldened to raise [her]76-sissy hand to the neck that was insensibly drooping towards [her]91-louisa . [Louisa]91-louisa , taking down the hand that would have embraced [her]91-louisa in another moment , held it in one of [hers]91-louisa , and answered : ‘ First , [Sissy]76-sissy , do [you]76-sissy know what [I]91-louisa am ? [I]91-louisa am so proud and so hardened , so confused and troubled , so resentful and unjust to [every one]1571-every one and to [myself]91-louisa , that everything is stormy , dark , and wicked to [me]91-louisa . Does not that repel [you]76-sissy ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ No ! ’[91-louisa] ‘ [I]91-louisa am so unhappy , and all that should have made [me]91-louisa otherwise is so laid waste , that if [I]91-louisa had been bereft of sense to this hour , and instead of being as learned as [you]76-sissy think [me]91-louisa , had to begin to acquire the simplest truths , [I]91-louisa could not want a guide to peace , contentment , honour , all the good of which [I]91-louisa am quite devoid , more abjectly than [I]91-louisa do . Does not that repel [you]76-sissy ? ’[91-louisa] ‘ No ! ’[91-louisa] In the innocence of [her]91-louisa brave affection , and the brimming up of [her]91-louisa old devoted spirit , [the once deserted girl]2048-the once deserted girl shone like a beautiful light upon the darkness of the other . [Louisa]91-louisa raised the hand that it might clasp [her]91-louisa neck and join its fellow there . [She]91-louisa fell upon [her]91-louisa knees , and clinging to [[this stroller]2049-this stroller ’s child]2050-this stroller ’s child looked up at [her]91-louisa almost with veneration . ‘ Forgive [me]2050-this stroller ’s child , pity [me]2050-this stroller ’s child , help [me]2050-this stroller ’s child ! Have compassion on [my]2050-this stroller ’s child great need , and let [me]2050-this stroller ’s child lay this head of mine upon a loving heart ! ’[2050-this stroller ’s child] ‘ O lay it here ! ’[76-sissy] cried [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘ Lay it here , [[my]76-sissy dear]3090-my dear . ’[76-sissy] CHAPTER II [VERY RIDICULOUS MR . JAMES HARTHOUSE]162-mr. harthouse passed a whole night and a day in a state of so much hurry , that [the World]46-the world , with [its]46-the world best glass in [his]162-mr. harthouse eye , would scarcely have recognized [him]162-mr. harthouse during that insane interval , as [the brother Jem of [the honourable and jocular member]1610-the honourable and jocular member]2051-the brother jem of the honourable and jocular member . [He]162-mr. harthouse was positively agitated . [He]162-mr. harthouse several times spoke with an emphasis , similar to the vulgar manner . [He]162-mr. harthouse went in and went out in an unaccountable way , like [a man without an object]2053-a man without an object . [He]162-mr. harthouse rode like [a highwayman]2054-a highwayman . In a word , [he]162-mr. harthouse was so horribly bored by existing circumstances , that [he]162-mr. harthouse forgot to go in for boredom in the manner prescribed by [the authorities]2055-the authorities . After putting [his]162-mr. harthouse horse at [Coketown]4-coketown through the storm , as if it were a leap , [he]162-mr. harthouse waited up all night : from time to time ringing [his]162-mr. harthouse bell with the greatest fury , charging [the porter who kept watch with delinquency in withholding letters or messages that could not fail to have been entrusted to [him]162-mr. harthouse]2056-the porter who kept watch with delinquency in withholding letters or messages that could not fail to have been entrusted to him , and demanding restitution on the spot . The dawn coming , the morning coming , and the day coming , and neither message nor letter coming with either , [he]162-mr. harthouse went down to [the country house]1925-the country house . There , the report was , [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby away , and [Mrs. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby in [town]427-town . Left for [town]427-town suddenly last evening . Not even known to be gone until receipt of message , importing that [her]2060-her return was not to be expected for the present . In these circumstances [he]162-mr. harthouse had nothing for it but to follow [her]2060-her to [town]427-town . [He]162-mr. harthouse went to [the house in [town]427-town]2062-the house in town . [Mrs. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby not [there]412-there . [He]162-mr. harthouse looked in at [the Bank]3460-the bank . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby away and [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby away . [Mrs. Sparsit]2066-mrs. sparsit away ? Who could have been reduced to sudden extremity for the company of [that griffin]2067-that griffin ! ‘ Well ! [I]75-tom do n’t know , ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom , who had [his]75-tom own reasons for being uneasy about it . ‘ [She]2060-her was off somewhere at daybreak this morning . [She]2060-her ’s always full of mystery ; [I]75-tom hate [her]2060-her . So [I]75-tom do [that white chap]4583-that white chap ; [he]4583-that white chap ’s always got [his]4583-that white chap blinking eyes upon [a fellow]1703-a fellow . ’[75-tom] ‘ Where were [you]75-tom last night , [Tom]75-tom ? ’[2066-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Where was [I]75-tom last night ! ’[75-tom] said [Tom]75-tom . ‘ Come ! [I]75-tom like that . [I]75-tom was waiting for [you]75-tom , [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , till it came down as _ [I]75-tom _ never saw it come down before . Where was [I]75-tom too ! Where were [you]75-tom , [you]75-tom mean . ’[75-tom] ‘ [I]2066-mrs. sparsit was prevented from coming — detained . ’[2066-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Detained ! ’[75-tom] murmured [Tom]75-tom . ‘ [Two of [us]4585-two of us]4585-two of us were detained . [I]75-tom was detained looking for [you]75-tom , till [I]75-tom lost [every train]4586-every train but the mail . It would have been a pleasant job to go down by that on such a night , and have to walk [home]336-home through [a pond]4588-a pond . [I]75-tom was obliged to sleep in [town]427-town after all . ’[75-tom] ‘ Where ? ’[2066-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Where ? Why , in [my]75-tom own bed at [Bounderby ’s]92-mr. bounderby . ’[75-tom] ‘ Did [you]75-tom see [[your]75-tom sister]2822-your sister ? ’[75-tom] ‘ How [the deuce]4591-the deuce , ’[75-tom] returned [Tom]75-tom , staring , ‘ could [I]75-tom see [[my]75-tom sister]664-my sister when [she]2070-she was fifteen miles off ? ’[75-tom] Cursing these quick retorts of [the young gentleman to whom [he]2068-the young gentleman to whom he was so true a friend was so true [a friend]3703-a friend]2068-the young gentleman to whom he was so true a friend , [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse disembarrassed [himself]162-mr. harthouse of that interview with the smallest conceivable amount of ceremony , and debated for the hundredth time what all this could mean ? [He]162-mr. harthouse made only one thing clear . It was , that whether [she]2070-she was in [town]427-town or out of [town]427-town , whether [he]162-mr. harthouse had been premature with [her]2070-she who was so hard to comprehend , or [she]2070-she had lost courage , or [they]2073-they were discovered , or some mischance or mistake , at present incomprehensible , had occurred , [he]162-mr. harthouse must remain to confront [his]162-mr. harthouse fortune , whatever it was . [The hotel where [he]162-mr. harthouse was known to live when condemned to [that region of blackness]2075-that region of blackness]2074-the hotel where he was known to live when condemned to that region of blackness , was the stake to which [he]162-mr. harthouse was tied . As to all the rest — What will be , will be . ‘ So , whether [I]162-mr. harthouse am waiting for a hostile message , or an assignation , or a penitent remonstrance , or an impromptu wrestle with [[my]162-mr. harthouse friend]3004-my friend [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby in the Lancashire manner — which would seem as likely as anything else in the present state of affairs — [I’ll]162-mr. harthouse dine , ’[162-mr. harthouse] said [Mr. James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse . ‘ [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby has the advantage in point of weight ; and if anything of a British nature is to come off between [us]4594-us , it may be as well to be in training . ’[162-mr. harthouse] Therefore [he]162-mr. harthouse rang the bell , and tossing [himself]162-mr. harthouse negligently on a sofa , ordered ‘ Some dinner at six — with a beefsteak in it , ’[162-mr. harthouse] and got through the intervening time as well as [he]162-mr. harthouse could . That was not particularly well ; for [he]162-mr. harthouse remained in the greatest perplexity , and , as the hours went on , and no kind of explanation offered itself , [his]162-mr. harthouse perplexity augmented at compound interest . However , [he]162-mr. harthouse took affairs as coolly as it was in human nature to do , and entertained [himself]162-mr. harthouse with the facetious idea of the training more than once . ‘ It would n’t be bad , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse yawned at one time , ‘ to give [the waiter]4595-the waiter five shillings , and throw [him]4595-the waiter . ’[162-mr. harthouse] At another time it occurred to [him]162-mr. harthouse , ‘ Or [a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone]4596-a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone might be hired by the hour . ’[162-mr. harthouse] But these jests did not tell materially on the afternoon , or [his]162-mr. harthouse suspense ; and , sooth to say , [they]2076-they both lagged fearfully . It was impossible , even before dinner , to avoid often walking about in the pattern of the carpet , looking out of the window , listening at the door for footsteps , and occasionally becoming rather hot when any steps approached [that room]2077-that room . But , after dinner , when the day turned to twilight , and the twilight turned to night , and still no communication was made to [him]162-mr. harthouse , it began to be as [he]162-mr. harthouse expressed it , ‘ like the Holy Office and slow torture . ’[162-mr. harthouse] However , still true to [his]162-mr. harthouse conviction that indifference was the genuine high - breeding ( the only conviction [he]162-mr. harthouse had ) , [he]162-mr. harthouse seized this crisis as the opportunity for ordering candles and a newspaper . [He]162-mr. harthouse had been trying in vain , for half an hour , to read this newspaper , when [the waiter]4595-the waiter appeared and said , at once mysteriously and apologetically : ‘ Beg [your]2713-sir pardon , [sir]2713-sir . [You]2713-sir ’re[4595-the waiter] wanted , [sir]2713-sir , if [you]2713-sir please . ’ A general recollection that this was the kind of thing [the Police]1761-the police said to [the swell mob]4599-the swell mob , caused [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse to ask [the waiter]4595-the waiter in return , with bristling indignation , what the Devil [he]162-mr. harthouse meant by ‘[4595-the waiter] wanted ’ ? ‘[2713-sir] Beg [your]2713-sir pardon , [sir]2713-sir . [Young lady outside]2081-young lady outside , [sir]2713-sir , wishes to see [you]2713-sir . ’ ‘[2081-young lady outside] Outside ? Where ? ’ ‘[2713-sir] Outside this door , [sir]2713-sir . ’ Giving [the waiter]4595-the waiter to [the personage before mentioned]4602-the personage before mentioned , as [a block - head duly qualified for that consignment]4603-a block - head duly qualified for that consignment , [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse hurried into [the gallery]4604-the gallery . [A young woman whom [he]162-mr. harthouse had never seen]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen stood [there]412-there . [Plainly dressed , very quiet , very pretty]4607-plainly dressed , very quiet , very pretty . As [he]162-mr. harthouse conducted [her]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen into [the room]2859-the room and placed a chair for [her]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen , [he]162-mr. harthouse observed , by the light of the candles , that [she]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen was even prettier than [he]162-mr. harthouse had at first believed . [Her]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen face was innocent and youthful , and its expression remarkably pleasant . [She]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen was not afraid of [him]162-mr. harthouse , or in any way disconcerted ; [she]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen seemed to have [her]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen mind entirely preoccupied with the occasion of [her]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen visit , and to have substituted that consideration for [herself]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen . ‘[2713-sir] [I]0-i speak to [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse ? ’ [she]4605-a young woman whom he had never seen said , when [they]4609-they were alone . ‘[0-i] To [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse . ’ [He]162-mr. harthouse added in [his]162-mr. harthouse mind , ‘[162-mr. harthouse] And [you]0-i speak to [him]162-mr. harthouse with the most confiding eyes [I]0-i ever saw , and the most earnest voice ( though so quiet ) [I]0-i ever heard . ’ ‘[0-i] If [I]0-i do not understand — and [I]0-i do not , sir’—said [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ what [your]0-i honour as [a gentleman]3743-a gentleman binds [you]0-i to , in other matters : ’[76-sissy] the blood really rose in [his]0-i face as [she]76-sissy began in these words : ‘ [I]76-sissy am sure [I]76-sissy may rely upon it to keep [my]76-sissy visit secret , and to keep secret what [I]76-sissy am going to say . [I]76-sissy will rely upon it , if [you]0-i will tell [me]76-sissy [I]76-sissy may so far trust — ’[76-sissy] ‘ [You]0-i may , [I]76-sissy assure [you]0-i . ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]2084-i am young , as [you]0-i see ; [I]2084-i am alone , as [you]0-i see . In coming to [you]0-i , [sir]2713-sir , [I]2084-i have no advice or encouragement beyond [my]2084-i own hope . ’[2084-i] [He]2084-i thought , ‘ But that is very strong , ’[2084-i] as [he]2084-i followed the momentary upward glance of [her]2085-her eyes . [He]2084-i thought besides , ‘ This is a very odd beginning . [I]2084-i do n’t see where [we]4612-we are going . ’[2084-i] ‘ [I]76-sissy think , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ [you]0-i have already guessed whom [I]76-sissy left just now ! ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]2084-i have been in the greatest concern and uneasiness during the last four - and - twenty hours ( which have appeared as many years ) , ’[2084-i] [he]2084-i returned , ‘ on [a lady]1742-a lady ’s account . The hopes [I]2084-i have been encouraged to form that [you]0-i come from [that lady]600-that lady , do not deceive [me]2084-i , [I]2084-i trust . ’[2084-i] ‘ [I]76-sissy left [her]600-that lady within an hour . ’[76-sissy] ‘ At — ! ’[2084-i] ‘ At [[her]600-that lady father]335-her father ’s . ’[76-sissy] [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse ’s face lengthened in spite of [his]162-mr. harthouse coolness , and [his]162-mr. harthouse perplexity increased . ‘ Then [I]162-mr. harthouse certainly , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse thought , ‘ do _ not _ see where [we]4616-we are going . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [She]600-that lady hurried [there]412-there last night . [She]600-that lady arrived [there]412-there in great agitation , and was insensible all through the night . [I]162-mr. harthouse live at [[her]600-that lady father]335-her father ’s , and was with [her]600-that lady . [You]162-mr. harthouse may be sure , [sir]2713-sir , [you]162-mr. harthouse will never see [her]600-that lady again as long as [you]162-mr. harthouse live . ’[162-mr. harthouse] [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse drew a long breath ; and , if ever [man]2923-man found [himself]162-mr. harthouse in the position of not knowing what to say , made the discovery beyond all question that [he]162-mr. harthouse was so circumstanced . The child - like ingenuousness with which [[his]162-mr. harthouse visitor]1233-his visitor spoke , [her]1233-his visitor modest fearlessness , [her]1233-his visitor truthfulness which put all artifice aside , [her]1233-his visitor entire forgetfulness of [herself]1233-his visitor in [her]1233-his visitor earnest quiet holding to the object with which [she]1233-his visitor had come ; all this , together with [her]1233-his visitor reliance on [his]162-mr. harthouse easily given promise — which in itself shamed [him]162-mr. harthouse — presented something in which [he]162-mr. harthouse was so inexperienced , and against which [he]162-mr. harthouse knew any of [his]162-mr. harthouse usual weapons would fall so powerless ; that not a word could [he]162-mr. harthouse rally to [his]162-mr. harthouse relief . At last [he]162-mr. harthouse said : ‘ So startling an announcement , so confidently made , and by such lips , is really disconcerting in the last degree . May [I]162-mr. harthouse be permitted to inquire , if [you]162-mr. harthouse are charged to convey that information to [me]162-mr. harthouse in those hopeless words , by [the lady of whom [we]4622-we speak]4621-the lady of whom we speak ? ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]162-mr. harthouse have no charge from [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [The drowning man]4623-the drowning man catches at the straw . With no disrespect for [your]162-mr. harthouse judgment , and with no doubt of [your]162-mr. harthouse sincerity , excuse [my]162-mr. harthouse saying that [I]162-mr. harthouse cling to the belief that there is yet hope that [I]162-mr. harthouse am not condemned to perpetual exile from [that lady]600-that lady ’s presence . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ There is not the least hope . The first object of [my]162-mr. harthouse coming [here]354-here , [sir]2713-sir , is to assure [you]2713-sir that [you]2713-sir must believe that there is no more hope of [your]2713-sir ever speaking with [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak again , than there would be if [she]4621-the lady of whom we speak had died when [she]4621-the lady of whom we speak came [home]336-home last night . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ Must believe ? But if [I]162-mr. harthouse can’t — or if [I]162-mr. harthouse should , by infirmity of nature , be obstinate — and wo n’t — ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ It is still true . There is no hope . ’[162-mr. harthouse] [James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse looked at [her]2088-her with an incredulous smile upon [his]162-mr. harthouse lips ; but [her]2088-her mind looked over and beyond [him]162-mr. harthouse , and the smile was quite thrown away . [He]162-mr. harthouse bit [his]162-mr. harthouse lip , and took a little time for consideration . ‘ Well ! If it should unhappily appear , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse said , ‘ after due pains and duty on [my]162-mr. harthouse part , that [I]162-mr. harthouse am brought to a position so desolate as this banishment , [I]162-mr. harthouse shall not become [the lady ’s persecutor]4628-the lady ’s persecutor . But [you]2713-sir said [you]2713-sir had no commission from [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak ? ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]2089-i have only the commission of [my]2089-i love for [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak , and [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak love for [me]2089-i . [I]2089-i have no other trust , than that [I]2089-i have been with [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak since [she]4621-the lady of whom we speak came [home]336-home , and that [she]4621-the lady of whom we speak has given [me]2089-i [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak confidence . [I]2089-i have no further trust , than that [I]2089-i know something of [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak character and [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak marriage . [O Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , [I]2089-i think [you]2089-i had that trust too ! ’[2089-i] [He]2089-i was touched in the cavity where [his]2089-i heart should have been — in that nest of addled eggs , where the birds of heaven would have lived if [they]2090-they had not been whistled away — by the fervour of this reproach . ‘ [I]2089-i am not [a moral sort of fellow]4630-a moral sort of fellow , ’[2089-i] [he]2089-i said , ‘ and [I]2089-i never make any pretensions to the character of [a moral sort of fellow]4630-a moral sort of fellow . [I]2089-i am as immoral as need be . At the same time , in bringing any distress upon [the lady who is the subject of the present conversation]4632-the lady who is the subject of the present conversation , or in unfortunately compromising [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak in any way , or in committing [myself]2089-i by any expression of sentiments towards [her]4621-the lady of whom we speak , not perfectly reconcilable with — in fact with — [the domestic hearth]4633-the domestic hearth ; or in taking any advantage of [[her]4621-the lady of whom we speak father]335-her father ’s being [a machine]4635-a machine , or of [[her]4621-the lady of whom we speak brother]2889-her brother ’s being a whelp , or of [[her]4621-the lady of whom we speak husband]2861-her husband ’s being [a bear]4638-a bear ; [I]2089-i beg to be allowed to assure [you]4639-you that [I]2089-i have had no particularly evil intentions , but have glided on from one step to another with a smoothness so perfectly diabolical , that [I]2089-i had not the slightest idea the catalogue was half so long until [I]2089-i began to turn it over . Whereas [I]2089-i find , ’[2089-i] said [Mr. James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , in conclusion , ‘ that it is really in several volumes . ’[162-mr. harthouse] Though [he]162-mr. harthouse said all this in [his]162-mr. harthouse frivolous way , the way seemed , for that once , a conscious polishing of but an ugly surface . [He]162-mr. harthouse was silent for a moment ; and then proceeded with a more self - possessed air , though with traces of vexation and disappointment that would not be polished out . ‘ After what has been just now represented to [me]162-mr. harthouse , in a manner [I]162-mr. harthouse find it impossible to doubt — [I]162-mr. harthouse know of hardly any other source from which [I]162-mr. harthouse could have accepted it so readily — [I]162-mr. harthouse feel bound to say to [you]4639-you , in whom the confidence [you]4639-you have mentioned has been reposed , that [I]162-mr. harthouse can not refuse to contemplate the possibility ( however unexpected ) of [my]162-mr. harthouse seeing [the lady]730-the lady no more . [I]162-mr. harthouse am solely to blame for the thing having come to this — and — and , [I]162-mr. harthouse can not say , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse added , rather hard up for a general peroration , ‘ that [I]162-mr. harthouse have any sanguine expectation of ever becoming [a moral sort of fellow]4630-a moral sort of fellow , or that [I]162-mr. harthouse have any belief in any moral sort of fellow whatever . ’[162-mr. harthouse] [Sissy]76-sissy ’s face sufficiently showed that [her]76-sissy appeal to [him]162-mr. harthouse was not finished . ‘ [You]76-sissy spoke , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse resumed , as [she]76-sissy raised [her]76-sissy eyes to [him]162-mr. harthouse again , ‘ of [your]76-sissy first object . [I]162-mr. harthouse may assume that there is a second to be mentioned ? ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ Yes . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Will [you]76-sissy oblige [me]162-mr. harthouse by confiding it ? ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , ’[162-mr. harthouse] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , with a blending of gentleness and steadiness that quite defeated [him]162-mr. harthouse , and with a simple confidence in [his]162-mr. harthouse being bound to do what [she]76-sissy required , that held [him]162-mr. harthouse at a singular disadvantage , ‘ the only reparation that remains with [you]76-sissy , is to leave [here]354-here immediately and finally . [I]76-sissy am quite sure that [you]76-sissy can mitigate in no other way the wrong and harm [you]76-sissy have done . [I]76-sissy am quite sure that it is the only compensation [you]76-sissy have left it in [your]76-sissy power to make . [I]76-sissy do not say that it is much , or that it is enough ; but it is something , and it is necessary . Therefore , though without any other authority than [I]76-sissy have given [you]76-sissy , and even without the knowledge of [any other person than [yourself]76-sissy and [myself]76-sissy]4643-any other person than yourself and myself , [I]76-sissy ask [you]76-sissy to depart from [this place]656-this place to - night , under an obligation never to return to [it]656-this place . ’[76-sissy] If [she]76-sissy had asserted any influence over [him]162-mr. harthouse beyond [her]76-sissy plain faith in the truth and right of what [she]76-sissy said ; if [she]76-sissy had concealed the least doubt or irresolution , or had harboured for the best purpose any reserve or pretence ; if [she]76-sissy had shown , or felt , the lightest trace of any sensitiveness to [his]162-mr. harthouse ridicule or [his]162-mr. harthouse astonishment , or any remonstrance [he]162-mr. harthouse might offer ; [he]162-mr. harthouse would have carried it against [her]76-sissy at this point . But [he]162-mr. harthouse could as easily have changed a clear sky by looking at it in surprise , as affect [her]76-sissy . ‘ But do [you]76-sissy know , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse asked , quite at a loss , ‘ the extent of what [you]76-sissy ask ? [You]76-sissy probably are not aware that [I]162-mr. harthouse am here on a public kind of business , preposterous enough in itself , but which [I]162-mr. harthouse have gone in for , and sworn by , and am supposed to be devoted to in quite a desperate manner ? [You]76-sissy probably are not aware of that , but [I]162-mr. harthouse assure [you]76-sissy it ’s the fact . ’[162-mr. harthouse] It had no effect on [Sissy]76-sissy , fact or no fact . ‘ Besides which , ’[162-mr. harthouse] said [Mr. Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , taking a turn or two across [the room]2859-the room , dubiously , ‘ it ’s so alarmingly absurd . It would make [a man]3830-a man so ridiculous , after going in for [these fellows]1763-these fellows , to back out in such an incomprehensible way . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]76-sissy am quite sure , ’[76-sissy] repeated [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ that it is the only reparation in [your]162-mr. harthouse power , [sir]2713-sir . [I]76-sissy am quite sure , or [I]76-sissy would not have come [here]354-here . ’[76-sissy] [He]162-mr. harthouse glanced at [her]76-sissy face , and walked about again . ‘ Upon [my]162-mr. harthouse soul , [I]162-mr. harthouse do n’t know what to say . So immensely absurd ! ’[162-mr. harthouse] It fell to [his]162-mr. harthouse lot , now , to stipulate for secrecy . ‘ If [I]162-mr. harthouse were to do such a very ridiculous thing , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse said , stopping again presently , and leaning against the chimney - piece , ‘ it could only be in the most inviolable confidence . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]76-sissy will trust to [you]162-mr. harthouse , [sir]2713-sir , ’[76-sissy] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ and [you]162-mr. harthouse will trust to [me]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] [His]162-mr. harthouse leaning against the chimney - piece reminded [him]162-mr. harthouse of the night with the whelp . It was [the self - same chimney - piece]2092-the self - same chimney - piece , and somehow [he]162-mr. harthouse felt as if _ [he]162-mr. harthouse _ were the whelp to - night . [He]162-mr. harthouse could make no way at all . ‘ [I]162-mr. harthouse suppose [a man]3830-a man never was placed in a more ridiculous position , ’[162-mr. harthouse] [he]162-mr. harthouse said , after looking down , and looking up , and laughing , and frowning , and walking off , and walking back again . ‘ But [I]162-mr. harthouse see no way out of it . What will be , will be . _ This _ will be , [I]162-mr. harthouse suppose . [I]162-mr. harthouse must take off [myself]162-mr. harthouse , [I]162-mr. harthouse imagine — in short , [I]162-mr. harthouse engage to do it . ’[162-mr. harthouse] [Sissy]76-sissy rose . [She]76-sissy was not surprised by the result , but [she]76-sissy was happy in it , and [her]76-sissy face beamed brightly . ‘ [You]162-mr. harthouse will permit [me]162-mr. harthouse to say , ’[162-mr. harthouse] continued [Mr. James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , ‘ that [I]162-mr. harthouse doubt if [any other ambassador]4651-any other ambassador , or [ambassadress]4652-ambassadress , could have addressed [me]162-mr. harthouse with the same success . [I]162-mr. harthouse must not only regard [myself]162-mr. harthouse as being in a very ridiculous position , but as being vanquished at all points . Will [you]162-mr. harthouse allow [me]162-mr. harthouse the privilege of remembering [[my]162-mr. harthouse enemy]4653-my enemy ’s name ? ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ _ [My]208-the ambassadress _ name ? ’[208-the ambassadress] said [the ambassadress]208-the ambassadress . ‘ The only name [I]208-the ambassadress could possibly care to know , to - night . ’[208-the ambassadress] ‘ [Sissy Jupe]76-sissy . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ Pardon [my]208-the ambassadress curiosity at parting . Related to [the family]1017-the family ? ’[208-the ambassadress] ‘ [I]76-sissy am only [a poor girl]4655-a poor girl , ’[76-sissy] returned [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘ [I]76-sissy was separated from [[my]76-sissy father]1699-my father — [he]1699-my father was only [a stroller]4657-a stroller — and taken pity on by [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . [I]76-sissy have lived in [the house]2875-the house ever since . ’[76-sissy] [She]76-sissy was gone . ‘ [It]4659-it wanted this to complete the defeat , ’[162-mr. harthouse] said [Mr. James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse , sinking , with a resigned air , on the sofa , after standing transfixed a little while . ‘ The defeat may now be considered perfectly accomplished . Only [a poor girl]4655-a poor girl — only [a stroller]4657-a stroller — only [James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse made nothing of — only [James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse a Great Pyramid of failure . ’[162-mr. harthouse] [The Great Pyramid]48-the great pyramid put it into [his]162-mr. harthouse head to go up [the Nile]49-the nile . [He]162-mr. harthouse took a pen upon the instant , and wrote the following note ( in appropriate hieroglyphics ) to [[his]162-mr. harthouse brother]1227-his brother : [Dear Jack,—All]209-dear jack,—all up at [Coketown]4-coketown . Bored out of [the place]329-the place , and going in for camels . [Affectionately]210-affectionately , [JEM]162-mr. harthouse . [He]162-mr. harthouse rang the bell . ‘ Send [[my]162-mr. harthouse fellow]4662-my fellow here . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ Gone to bed , [sir]2713-sir . ’[162-mr. harthouse] ‘ Tell [him]4662-my fellow to get up , and pack up . ’[162-mr. harthouse] [He]162-mr. harthouse wrote two more notes . One , to [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , announcing [his]92-mr. bounderby retirement from [that part of [the country]2802-the country]2095-that part of the country , and showing where [he]92-mr. bounderby would be found for the next fortnight . The other , similar in effect , to [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . Almost as soon as the ink was dry upon [their]2097-their superscriptions , [he]162-mr. harthouse had left [the tall chimneys of [Coketown]4-coketown]2098-the tall chimneys of coketown behind , and was in [a railway carriage]2099-a railway carriage , tearing and glaring over [the dark landscape]2100-the dark landscape . [The moral sort of fellows]2101-the moral sort of fellows might suppose that [Mr. James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse derived some comfortable reflections afterwards , from this prompt retreat , as one of [his]162-mr. harthouse few actions that made any amends for anything , and as a token to [himself]162-mr. harthouse that [he]162-mr. harthouse had escaped the climax of a very bad business . But it was not so , at all . A secret sense of having failed and been ridiculous — a dread of what [other fellows who went in for similar sorts of things]2102-other fellows who went in for similar sorts of things , would say at [his]162-mr. harthouse expense if [they]2102-other fellows who went in for similar sorts of things knew it — so oppressed [him]162-mr. harthouse , that what was about the very best passage in [his]162-mr. harthouse life was the one of all others [he]162-mr. harthouse would not have owned to on any account , and the only one that made [him]162-mr. harthouse ashamed of [himself]162-mr. harthouse . CHAPTER III VERY DECIDED [THE indefatigable Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , with a violent cold upon [her]2103-her , [her]2103-her voice reduced to a whisper , and [her]2103-her stately frame so racked by continual sneezes that it seemed in danger of dismemberment , gave chase to [[her]2103-her patron]3087-her patron until [she]2103-her found [him]3087-her patron in [the metropolis]2105-the metropolis ; and there , majestically sweeping in upon [him]3087-her patron at [[his]3087-her patron hotel in [St. James ’s Street]50-st. james ’s street]2106-his hotel in st. james ’s street , exploded the combustibles with which [she]2103-her was charged , and blew up . Having executed [her]2103-her mission with infinite relish , [this high - minded woman]2107-this high - minded woman then fainted away on [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s coat - collar . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s first procedure was to shake [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby off , and leave [her]2103-her to progress as [she]2103-her might through various stages of suffering on the floor . [He]92-mr. bounderby next had recourse to the administration of potent restoratives , such as screwing [the patient]2108-the patient ’s thumbs , smiting [her]2108-the patient hands , abundantly watering [her]2108-the patient face , and inserting salt in [her]2108-the patient mouth . When these attentions had recovered [her]2103-her ( which [they]2109-they speedily did ) , [he]92-mr. bounderby hustled [her]2103-her into [a fast train]2110-a fast train without offering any other refreshment , and carried [her]2103-her back to [Coketown]4-coketown more dead than alive . Regarded as [a classical ruin]2111-a classical ruin , [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby was an interesting spectacle on [her]2103-her arrival at [her]2103-her journey ’s end ; but considered in any other light , the amount of damage [she]2103-her had by that time sustained was excessive , and impaired [her]2103-her claims to admiration . Utterly heedless of the wear and tear of [her]2103-her clothes and constitution , and adamant to [her]2103-her pathetic sneezes , [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby immediately crammed [her]2103-her into [a coach]3320-a coach , and bore [her]2103-her off to [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge . ‘ Now , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , bursting into [[[his]92-mr. bounderby father - in - law]2113-his father - in - law ’s room]2114-his father - in - law ’s room late at night ; ‘ here ’s [a lady here]4664-a lady here — [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby — [you]92-mr. bounderby know [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby — who has something to say to [you]92-mr. bounderby that will strike [you]92-mr. bounderby dumb . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [You]92-mr. bounderby have missed [my]75-tom letter ! ’[75-tom] exclaimed [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , surprised by the apparition . ‘ Missed [your]75-tom letter , [sir]2713-sir ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] bawled [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ The present time is no time for letters . [No man]3980-no man shall talk to [Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown about letters , with [his]96-josiah bounderby mind in the state it ’s in now . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , in a tone of temperate remonstrance , ‘ [I]75-tom speak of a very special letter [I]75-tom have written to [you]96-josiah bounderby , in reference to [Louisa]91-louisa . ’[75-tom] ‘ [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , ’[96-josiah bounderby] replied [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby , knocking the flat of [his]96-josiah bounderby hand several times with great vehemence on the table , ‘ [I]96-josiah bounderby speak of a very special messenger that has come to [me]96-josiah bounderby , in reference to [Louisa]91-louisa . [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]350-ma’am , stand forward ! ’[96-josiah bounderby] [That unfortunate lady]2115-that unfortunate lady hereupon essaying to offer testimony , without any voice and with painful gestures expressive of an inflamed throat , became so aggravating and underwent so many facial contortions , that [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , unable to bear it , seized [her]2115-that unfortunate lady by the arm and shook [her]2115-that unfortunate lady . ‘ If [you]350-ma’am ca n’t get it out , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ leave _ [me]92-mr. bounderby _ to get it out . This is not a time for [a lady , however highly connected]4669-a lady , however highly connected , to be totally inaudible , and seemingly swallowing marbles . [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby latterly found [herself]92-mr. bounderby , by accident , in a situation to overhear a conversation out of doors between [[your]350-ma’am daughter]4670-your daughter and [[your]350-ma’am precious gentleman - friend]4671-your precious gentleman - friend , [Mr. James Harthouse]162-mr. harthouse . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Indeed ! ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . ‘ Ah ! Indeed ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] cried [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ And in that conversation — ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ It is not necessary to repeat its tenor , [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . [She]4670-your daughter is here . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Here ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [[My]92-mr. bounderby dear]3090-my dear [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , let [me]92-mr. bounderby beg [you]92-mr. bounderby to restrain these loud out - breaks , on all accounts . [Louisa]91-louisa is here . [She]91-louisa hurried by [the train]4477-the train to [town]427-town , [she]91-louisa ran from [town]427-town to [this house]3165-this house , through a raging storm , and presented [herself]91-louisa before [me]92-mr. bounderby in a state of distraction . Of course , [she]91-louisa has remained [here]354-here ever since . Let [me]92-mr. bounderby entreat [you]92-mr. bounderby , for [your]92-mr. bounderby own sake and for [hers]91-louisa , to be more quiet . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby silently gazed about [him]92-mr. bounderby for some moments , in every direction except [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby ’s direction ; and then , abruptly turning upon [the niece of [Lady Scadgers]122-lady scadgers]2117-the niece of lady scadgers , said to [that wretched woman]2118-that wretched woman : ‘ Now , [ma’am]350-ma’am ! [We]4684-we shall be happy to hear any little apology [you]92-mr. bounderby may think proper to offer , for going about [the country]2802-the country at express pace , with no other luggage than [a Cock - and - a - Bull]4686-a cock - and - a - bull , [ma’am]350-ma’am ! ’[2117-the niece of lady scadgers] ‘ [Sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] whispered [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ [my]2118-that wretched woman nerves are at present too much shaken , and [my]2118-that wretched woman health is at present too much impaired , in [your]2713-sir service , to admit of [my]2118-that wretched woman doing more than taking refuge in tears . ’[2118-that wretched woman] ( Which [she]2118-that wretched woman did . ) ‘ Well , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ without making any observation to [you]350-ma’am that may not be made with propriety to [a woman of good family]4690-a woman of good family , what [I]92-mr. bounderby have got to add to that , is that there is something else in which it appears to [me]92-mr. bounderby [you]350-ma’am may take refuge , namely , [a coach]3320-a coach . And [the coach in which [we]4693-we came here]4692-the coach in which we came here being at the door , [you]350-ma’am ’ll allow [me]92-mr. bounderby to hand [you]350-ma’am down to [it]4692-the coach in which we came here , and pack [you]350-ma’am home to [the Bank]3460-the bank : where the best course for [you]350-ma’am to pursue , will be to put [your]350-ma’am feet into the hottest water [you]350-ma’am can bear , and take a glass of scalding rum and butter after [you]350-ma’am get into bed . ’[92-mr. bounderby] With these words , [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby extended [his]92-mr. bounderby right hand to [the weeping lady]2119-the weeping lady , and escorted [her]2119-the weeping lady to the conveyance in question , shedding many plaintive sneezes by the way . [He]92-mr. bounderby soon returned alone . ‘ Now , as [you]350-ma’am showed [me]92-mr. bounderby in [your]350-ma’am face , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , that [you]350-ma’am wanted to speak to [me]92-mr. bounderby , ’[92-mr. bounderby] [he]92-mr. bounderby resumed , ‘ here [I]92-mr. bounderby am . But , [I]92-mr. bounderby am not in a very agreeable state , [I]92-mr. bounderby tell [you]350-ma’am plainly : not relishing this business , even as it is , and not considering that [I]92-mr. bounderby am at any time as dutifully and submissively treated by [[your]350-ma’am daughter]4670-your daughter , as [Josiah Bounderby of Coketown]96-josiah bounderby ought to be treated by [[his]96-josiah bounderby wife]972-his wife . It was [his]92-mr. bounderby amiable nature . ‘ [[My]75-tom dear]3090-my dear [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ’[75-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom began in reply . ‘ Now , [you]350-ma’am ’ll excuse [me]92-mr. bounderby , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ but [I]92-mr. bounderby do n’t want to be too dear . And [he]75-tom sat for a little while pondering . ‘[0-i] [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , [I]0-i see reason to doubt whether [we]2120-we have ever quite understood [Louisa]91-louisa . ’ ‘[2120-we] Who do [you]0-i mean by [We]2120-we ? ’ ‘[0-i] Let [me]0-i say [I]0-i , then , ’ [he]0-i returned , in answer to the coarsely blurted question ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i doubt whether [I]0-i have understood [Louisa]91-louisa . [I]0-i doubt whether [I]0-i have been quite right in the manner of [her]91-louisa education . ’ ‘[0-i] There [you]0-i hit it , ’ returned [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘[0-i] There [I]0-i agree with [you]0-i . [You]0-i have found it out at last , have [you]0-i ? Education ! [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]0-i what education is — To be tumbled out of doors , neck and crop , and put upon the shortest allowance of everything except blows . That ’s what _ [I]0-i _ call education . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i think [your]0-i good sense will perceive , ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom remonstrated in all humility , ‘[0-i] that whatever the merits of such a system may be , it would be difficult of general application to [girls]2709-girls . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t see it at all , [sir]2713-sir , ’ returned [the obstinate Bounderby]4701-the obstinate bounderby . ‘[0-i] Well , ’ sighed [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[0-i] [we]2123-we will not enter into the question . [I]0-i assure [you]0-i [I]0-i have no desire to be controversial . [I]0-i seek to repair what is amiss , if [I]0-i possibly can ; and [I]0-i hope [you]0-i will assist [me]0-i in a good spirit , [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , for [I]0-i have been very much distressed . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t understand [you]0-i , yet , ’ said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , with determined obstinacy , ‘[0-i] and therefore [I]0-i wo n’t make any promises . ’ ‘[92-mr. bounderby] In the course of a few hours , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom proceeded , in the same depressed and propitiatory manner , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i appear to [myself]0-i to have become better informed as to [Louisa]91-louisa ’s character , than in previous years . The enlightenment has been painfully forced upon [me]0-i , and the discovery is not [mine]0-i . [I]0-i think there are — [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , [you]0-i will be surprised to hear [me]0-i say this — [I]0-i think there are qualities in [Louisa]91-louisa , which — which have been harshly neglected , and — and a little perverted . And — and [I]0-i would suggest to [you]0-i , that — that if [you]0-i would kindly meet [me]0-i in a timely endeavour to leave [her]91-louisa to [her]91-louisa better nature for a while — and to encourage it to develop itself by tenderness and consideration — it — it would be the better for the happiness of [all of [us]2125-all of us]2125-all of us . [Louisa]91-louisa , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , shading [his]0-i face with [his]0-i hand , ‘[0-i] has always been [[my]0-i favourite child]3539-my favourite child . ’ [The blustrous Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby crimsoned and swelled to such an extent on hearing these words , that [he]92-mr. bounderby seemed to be , and probably was , on the brink of a fit . With [his]92-mr. bounderby very ears a bright purple shot with crimson , [he]92-mr. bounderby pent up [his]92-mr. bounderby indignation , however , and said : ‘[0-i] [You]0-i ’d like to keep [her]91-louisa [here]354-here for a time ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i had intended to recommend , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , that [you]92-mr. bounderby should allow [Louisa]91-louisa to remain [here]354-here on a visit , and be attended by [Sissy]76-sissy ( [I]0-i mean of course [Cecilia Jupe]76-sissy ) , who understands [her]91-louisa , and in whom [she]91-louisa trusts . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i gather from all this , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , ’ said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , standing up with [his]92-mr. bounderby hands in [his]92-mr. bounderby pockets , ‘[75-tom] that [you]92-mr. bounderby are of opinion that there ’s what [people]300-people call some incompatibility between [Loo Bounderby]100-loo and [myself]0-i . ’ ‘[300-people] [I]0-i fear there is at present a general incompatibility between [Louisa]91-louisa , and — and — and almost all the relations in which [I]0-i have placed [her]91-louisa , ’ was [[her]91-louisa father]335-her father ’s sorrowful reply . ‘[0-i] Now , look [you]92-mr. bounderby here , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , ’ said [Bounderby]100-loo the flushed , confronting [him]92-mr. bounderby with [his]92-mr. bounderby legs wide apart , [his]92-mr. bounderby hands deeper in [his]92-mr. bounderby pockets , and [his]92-mr. bounderby hair like a hayfield wherein [his]92-mr. bounderby windy anger was boisterous . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [You]92-mr. bounderby have said [your]92-mr. bounderby say ; [I]0-i am going to say mine . [I]0-i know ’em all pretty well . [They]4703-they ’re[0-i] real . When [a man]3830-a man tells [me]0-i anything about imaginative qualities , [I]0-i always tell [that man]3019-that man , whoever [he]3019-that man is , that [I]0-i know what [he]3019-that man means . [He]3019-that man means turtle soup and venison , with a gold spoon , and that [he]3019-that man wants to be set up with [a coach]3320-a coach and six . That ’s what [[your]2141-you daughter]4670-your daughter wants . Since [you]2141-you are of opinion that [she]4670-your daughter ought to have what [she]4670-your daughter wants , [I]0-i recommend [you]2141-you to provide it for [her]4670-your daughter . Because , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , [she]4670-your daughter will never have it from [me]0-i . ’ ‘[4670-your daughter] [Bounderby]100-loo , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[4670-your daughter] [I]0-i hoped , after [my]0-i entreaty , [you]100-loo would have taken a different tone . ’ ‘[100-loo] Just wait a bit , ’ retorted [Bounderby]100-loo ; ‘[100-loo] [you]100-loo have said [your]100-loo say , [I]0-i believe . [I]0-i heard [you]100-loo out ; hear [me]0-i out , if [you]100-loo please . Do n’t make [yourself]2141-you a spectacle of unfairness as well as inconsistency , because , although [I]0-i am sorry to see [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom reduced to [his]75-tom present position , [I]0-i should be doubly sorry to see [him]75-tom brought so low as that . [I]0-i ’ll give _ [you]2141-you _ to understand , in reply to that , that there unquestionably is an incompatibility of the first magnitude — to be summed up in this — that [[your]2141-you daughter]4670-your daughter do n’t properly know [[her]4670-your daughter husband]2861-her husband ’s merits , and is not impressed with such a sense as would become [her]4670-your daughter , by [George]71-george ! of the honour of [his]71-george alliance . That ’s plain speaking , [I]0-i hope . ’ ‘[100-loo] [Bounderby]100-loo , ’ urged [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[100-loo] this is unreasonable . ’ ‘[100-loo] Is it ? ’ said [Bounderby]100-loo . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am glad to hear [you]100-loo say so . Because when [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , with [his]75-tom new lights , tells [me]0-i that what [I]0-i say is unreasonable , [I]0-i am convinced at once it must be devilish sensible . With [your]2141-you permission [I]0-i am going on . [You]2141-you know [my]0-i origin ; and [you]2141-you know that for a good many years of [my]0-i life [I]0-i did n’t want a shoeing - horn , in consequence of not having a shoe . Yet [you]2141-you may believe or not , as [you]2141-you think proper , that there are [ladies]3150-ladies — [born ladies]2147-born ladies — belonging to [families]3732-families — [Families!—who]211-families!—who next to worship the ground [I]0-i walk on . ’ [He]0-i discharged this like [a Rocket]4704-a rocket , at [[his]0-i father - in - law]2113-his father - in - law ’s head . ‘[3150-ladies] Whereas [[your]2141-you daughter]4670-your daughter , ’ proceeded [Bounderby]100-loo , ‘[852-a born lady] is far from being [a born lady]852-a born lady . That [you]2141-you know , [yourself]2141-you .
