Why do [I]0-i say this ? ’ ‘[0-i] Not , [I]0-i fear , ’ observed [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , in a low voice , ‘[0-i] to spare [me]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] Hear [me]0-i out , ’ said [Bounderby]100-loo , ‘[0-i] and refrain from cutting in till [your]2141-you turn comes round . [I]0-i say this , because [highly connected females]2151-highly connected females have been astonished to see the way in which [[your]2141-you daughter]4670-your daughter has conducted [herself]4670-your daughter , and to witness [her]4670-your daughter insensibility . [They]2151-highly connected females have wondered how [I]0-i have suffered it . And [I]0-i wonder [myself]0-i now , and [I]0-i wo n’t suffer it . ’ ‘[100-loo] [Bounderby]100-loo , ’ returned [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , rising , ‘[100-loo] the less [we]2153-we say to - night the better , [I]0-i think . ’ ‘[0-i] On the contrary , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , the more [we]2153-we say to - night , the better , [I]0-i think . That is , ’ [the consideration]4706-the consideration checked [him]75-tom , ‘[0-i] till [I]0-i have said all [I]0-i mean to say , and then [I]0-i do n’t care how soon [we]2153-we stop . [I]0-i come to a question that may shorten the business . What do [you]0-i mean by the proposal [you]0-i made just now ? ’ ‘[0-i] What do [I]0-i mean , [Bounderby]100-loo ? ’ ‘[0-i] By [your]0-i visiting proposition , ’ said [Bounderby]100-loo , with an inflexible jerk of the hayfield . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i mean that [I]0-i hope [you]0-i may be induced to arrange in a friendly manner , for allowing [Louisa]91-louisa a period of repose and reflection here , which may tend to a gradual alteration for the better in many respects . ’ ‘[0-i] To a softening down of [your]0-i ideas of the incompatibility ? ’ said [Bounderby]100-loo . ‘[0-i] If [you]0-i put it in those terms . ’ ‘[0-i] What made [you]0-i think of this ? ’ said [Bounderby]100-loo . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have already said , [I]0-i fear [Louisa]91-louisa has not been understood . Is it asking too much , [Bounderby]100-loo , that [you]100-loo , so far [[her]91-louisa elder]2154-her elder , should aid in trying to set [her]91-louisa right ? [You]100-loo have accepted a great charge of [her]91-louisa ; for better for worse , for — ’ [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby may have been annoyed by the repetition of [his]92-mr. bounderby own words to [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , but [he]92-mr. bounderby cut the quotation short with an angry start . ‘[100-loo] Come ! ’ said [he]92-mr. bounderby , ‘[100-loo] [I]0-i do n’t want to be told about that . [I]0-i know what [I]0-i took [her]91-louisa for , as well as [you]100-loo do . Never [you]100-loo mind what [I]0-i took [her]91-louisa for ; that ’s [my]0-i look out . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i was merely going on to remark , [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , that [we]2155-we may all be more or less in the wrong , not even excepting [you]92-mr. bounderby ; and that some yielding on [your]92-mr. bounderby part , remembering the trust [you]92-mr. bounderby have accepted , may not only be an act of true kindness , but perhaps a debt incurred towards [Louisa]91-louisa . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i think differently , ’ blustered [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am going to finish this business according to [my]0-i own opinions . Now , [I]0-i do n’t want to make a quarrel of it with [you]100-loo , [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom . To tell [you]100-loo the truth , [I]0-i do n’t think it would be worthy of [my]0-i reputation to quarrel on such a subject . As to [[your]100-loo gentleman - friend]2156-your gentleman - friend , [he]2156-your gentleman - friend may take [himself]2156-your gentleman - friend off , wherever [he]2156-your gentleman - friend likes best . If [he]2156-your gentleman - friend falls in [my]0-i way , [I]0-i shall tell [him]2156-your gentleman - friend [my]0-i mind ; if [he]2156-your gentleman - friend do n’t fall in [my]0-i way , [I]0-i sha n’t , for it wo n’t be worth [my]0-i while to do it . As to [[your]100-loo daughter]4670-your daughter , whom [I]0-i made [Loo Bounderby]100-loo , and might have done better by leaving [Loo Gradgrind]212-loo gradgrind , if [she]4670-your daughter do n’t come [home]336-home to - morrow , by twelve o’clock at noon , [I]0-i shall understand that [she]4670-your daughter prefers to stay away , and [I]0-i shall send [her]4670-your daughter wearing apparel and so forth over here , and [you]100-loo ’ll take charge of [her]4670-your daughter for the future . What [I]0-i shall say to [people in general]709-people in general , of the incompatibility that led to [my]0-i so laying down the law , will be this . [I]0-i am [Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby , and [I]0-i had [my]0-i bringing - up ; [she]4670-your daughter ’s [the daughter of [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom]2160-the daughter of tom gradgrind , and [she]4670-your daughter had [her]4670-your daughter bringing - up ; and the two horses would n’t pull together . [I]0-i am pretty well known to be rather [an uncommon man]2161-an uncommon man , [I]0-i believe ; and [most people]4458-most people will understand fast enough that it must be [a woman rather out of the common]2163-a woman rather out of the common , also , who , in the long run , would come up to [my]0-i mark . ’ ‘[0-i] Let [me]0-i seriously entreat [you]0-i to reconsider this , [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby , ’ urged [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘[96-josiah bounderby] before [you]0-i commit [yourself]0-i to such a decision . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i always come to a decision , ’ said [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby , tossing [his]96-josiah bounderby hat on : ‘[0-i] and whatever [I]0-i do , [I]0-i do at once . [I]0-i should be surprised at [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom ’s addressing such a remark to [[Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown]388-josiah bounderby of coketown , knowing what [he]96-josiah bounderby knows of [him]75-tom , if [I]0-i could be surprised by anything [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom did , after [his]75-tom making [himself]75-tom a party to sentimental humbug . [I]0-i have given [you]0-i [my]0-i decision , and [I]0-i have got no more to say . Good night ! ’ So [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby went [home]336-home to [[his]92-mr. bounderby town house]4708-his town house to bed . At five minutes past twelve o’clock next day , [he]92-mr. bounderby directed [[Mrs. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s property]4709-mrs. bounderby ’s property to be carefully packed up and sent to [[Tom Gradgrind]75-tom ’s]4710-tom gradgrind ’s ; advertised [[his]92-mr. bounderby country retreat]4711-his country retreat for sale by private contract ; and resumed a bachelor life . CHAPTER IV LOST THE robbery at [the Bank]3460-the bank had not languished before , and did not cease to occupy a front place in the attention of [the principal of that establishment]4713-the principal of that establishment now . In boastful proof of [his]92-mr. bounderby promptitude and activity , as [a remarkable man]4714-a remarkable man , and [a self - made man]2840-a self - made man , and a commercial wonder more admirable than [Venus]213-venus , who had risen out of the mud instead of [the sea]697-the sea , [he]92-mr. bounderby liked to show how little [his]92-mr. bounderby domestic affairs abated [his]92-mr. bounderby business ardour . Consequently , in the first few weeks of [his]92-mr. bounderby resumed bachelorhood , [he]92-mr. bounderby even advanced upon [his]92-mr. bounderby usual display of bustle , and every day made such a rout in renewing [his]92-mr. bounderby investigations into the robbery , that [the officers who had it in hand]4717-the officers who had it in hand almost wished it had never been committed . [They]4717-the officers who had it in hand were at fault too , and off the scent . Although [they]4717-the officers who had it in hand had been so quiet since the first outbreak of the matter , that [most people]4458-most people really did suppose it to have been abandoned as hopeless , nothing new occurred . [No implicated man]4719-no implicated man or [woman]813-woman took untimely courage , or made a self - betraying step . More remarkable yet , [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen could not be heard of , and [the mysterious old woman]4721-the mysterious old woman remained a mystery . Things having come to this pass , and showing no latent signs of stirring beyond it , the upshot of [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s investigations was , that [he]92-mr. bounderby resolved to hazard a bold burst . [He]92-mr. bounderby drew up a placard , offering Twenty Pounds reward for the apprehension of [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , suspected of complicity in the robbery of [Coketown Bank]52-coketown bank on such a night ; [he]92-mr. bounderby described [the said Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen by dress , complexion , estimated height , and manner , as minutely as [he]92-mr. bounderby could ; [he]92-mr. bounderby recited how [he]92-mr. bounderby had left [the town]317-the town , and in what direction [he]92-mr. bounderby had been last seen going ; [he]92-mr. bounderby had the whole printed in great black letters on a staring broadsheet ; and [he]92-mr. bounderby caused the walls to be posted with it in the dead of night , so that it should strike upon the sight of [the whole population]4723-the whole population at one blow . The factory - bells had need to ring [their]4724-their loudest that morning to disperse [the groups of [workers who stood in the tardy daybreak]4726-workers who stood in the tardy daybreak]4725-the groups of workers who stood in the tardy daybreak , collected round the placards , devouring [them]4725-the groups of workers who stood in the tardy daybreak with eager eyes . Not the least eager of [the eyes assembled]4727-the eyes assembled , were the eyes of [those who could not read]4728-those who could not read . [These people]3064-these people , as [they]3064-these people listened to the friendly voice that read aloud — there was always some such ready to help [them]3064-these people — stared at the characters which meant so much with a vague awe and respect that would have been half ludicrous , if any aspect of public ignorance could ever be otherwise than threatening and full of evil . Many ears and eyes were busy with a vision of the matter of these placards , among turning spindles , rattling looms , and whirling wheels , for hours afterwards ; and when the Hands cleared out again into [the streets]2931-the streets , there were still [as many readers as before]4731-as many readers as before . [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , [the delegate]4732-the delegate , had to address [[his]169-slackbridge audience]4733-his audience too that night ; and [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge had obtained a clean bill from the printer , and had brought it in [his]169-slackbridge pocket . Oh , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends and [fellow - countrymen]3926-fellow - countrymen , [the down - trodden operatives of [Coketown]4-coketown]3924-the down - trodden operatives of coketown , oh , [[my]0-i fellow - brothers]4737-my fellow - brothers and [fellow - workmen]3930-fellow - workmen and [fellow - citizens]4739-fellow - citizens and [fellow - men]3931-fellow - men , what a to - do was there , when [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge unfolded what [he]169-slackbridge called ‘[0-i] that damning document , ’ and held it up to the gaze , and for the execration of [the working - man community]4741-the working - man community ! ‘[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i fellow - men]2165-my fellow - men , behold of what [a traitor in the camp of those great spirits who are enrolled upon the holy scroll of Justice and of Union]2166-a traitor in the camp of those great spirits who are enrolled upon the holy scroll of justice and of union , is appropriately capable ! Oh , [[my]0-i prostrate friends]2167-my prostrate friends , with the galling yoke of tyrants on [your]2167-my prostrate friends necks and the iron foot of despotism treading down [your]2167-my prostrate friends fallen forms into the dust of the earth , upon which right glad would [[your]2167-my prostrate friends oppressors]2168-your oppressors be to see [you]2167-my prostrate friends creeping on [your]2167-my prostrate friends bellies all the days of [your]2167-my prostrate friends lives , like the serpent in [the garden]4227-the garden — oh , [[my]0-i brothers]1365-my brothers , and shall [I]0-i as [a man]3830-a man not add , [[my]0-i sisters]2172-my sisters too , what do [you]2167-my prostrate friends say , _ now _ , of [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , with a slight stoop in [his]137-stephen shoulders and about five foot seven in height , as set forth in this degrading and disgusting document , this blighting bill , this pernicious placard , this abominable advertisement ; and with what majesty of denouncement will [you]2167-my prostrate friends crush the viper , who would bring this stain and shame upon [the God - like race that happily has cast [him]137-stephen out for ever ! Yes , [[my]0-i compatriots]2174-my compatriots]2173-the god - like race that happily has cast him out for ever ! yes , my compatriots , happily cast [him]137-stephen out and sent [him]137-stephen forth ! For [you]2167-my prostrate friends remember how [he]137-stephen stood here before [you]2167-my prostrate friends on [this platform]2175-this platform ; [you]2167-my prostrate friends remember how , face to face and foot to foot , [I]0-i pursued [him]137-stephen through all [his]137-stephen intricate windings ; [you]2167-my prostrate friends remember how [he]137-stephen sneaked and slunk , and sidled , and splitted of straws , until , with not an inch of ground to which to cling , [I]0-i hurled [him]137-stephen out from amongst [us]2176-us : an object for the undying finger of scorn to point at , and for the avenging fire of every free and thinking mind to scorch and scar ! And now , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends — [[my]0-i labouring friends]2178-my labouring friends , for [I]0-i rejoice and triumph in that stigma — [my]0-i [friends whose hard but honest beds are made in toil , and whose scanty but independent pots are boiled in hardship]2179-friends whose hard but honest beds are made in toil , and whose scanty but independent pots are boiled in hardship ; and now , [I]0-i say , [[my]0-i friends]3923-my friends , what appellation has [that dastard craven]2181-that dastard craven taken to [himself]137-stephen , when , with the mask torn from [his]137-stephen features , [he]137-stephen stands before [us]2176-us in all [his]137-stephen native deformity , a What ? [A thief]2182-a thief ! [A plunderer]2183-a plunderer ! [A proscribed fugitive]2184-a proscribed fugitive , with a price upon [his]137-stephen head ; a fester and a wound upon the noble character of [the Coketown operative]2185-the coketown operative ! Therefore , [[my]0-i band of [brothers]3937-brothers]2186-my band of brothers in a sacred bond , to which [[your]2188-your children]1362-your children and [[[your]2188-your children]1362-your children ’s children yet unborn]2191-your children ’s children yet unborn have set [their]2192-their infant hands and seals , [I]0-i propose to [you]2188-your on the part of [the United Aggregate Tribunal]3948-the united aggregate tribunal , ever watchful for [your]2188-your welfare , ever zealous for [your]2188-your benefit , that this meeting does Resolve : That [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , [weaver]2194-weaver , referred to in this placard , having been already solemnly disowned by [the community of [Coketown]4-coketown Hands]2195-the community of coketown hands , the same are free from the shame of [his]137-stephen misdeeds , and can not as [a class]2196-a class be reproached with [his]137-stephen dishonest actions ! ’ Thus [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge ; gnashing and perspiring after a prodigious sort . [A few stern voices]4742-a few stern voices called out ‘[92-mr. bounderby] No ! ’ and a score or two hailed , with assenting cries of ‘[92-mr. bounderby] Hear , hear ! ’ the caution from [one man]4743-one man , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , y’or over hetter in’t ; y’or a goen too fast ! ’ But these were pigmies against [an army]4744-an army ; [the general assemblage]4745-the general assemblage subscribed to the gospel according to [Slackbridge]169-slackbridge , and gave three cheers for [him]169-slackbridge , as [he]169-slackbridge sat demonstratively panting at [them]4745-the general assemblage . [These men]1334-these men and [women]574-women were yet in [the streets]2931-the streets , passing quietly to [[their]1334-these men homes]4749-their homes , when [Sissy]76-sissy , who had been called away from [Louisa]91-louisa some minutes before , returned . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] Who is it ? ’ asked [Louisa]91-louisa . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] It is [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , timid of the name , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] and [[your]169-slackbridge brother]3871-your brother [Mr. Tom]75-tom , and [a young woman who says [her]2198-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her name is [Rachael]140-rachael , and that [you]169-slackbridge know [her]2198-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her]2198-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her . ’ ‘[2198-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her] What do [they]2199-they want , [[Sissy]76-sissy dear]2200-sissy dear ? ’ ‘[2199-they] [They]2199-they want to see [you]169-slackbridge . [Rachael]140-rachael has been crying , and seems angry . ’ ‘[140-rachael] [Father]106-father , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , for [he]106-father was present , ‘[106-father] [I]0-i can not refuse to see [them]2199-they , for a reason that will explain itself . Shall [they]2199-they come in [here]354-here ? ’ As [he]106-father answered in the affirmative , [Sissy]76-sissy went away to bring [them]2199-they . [She]76-sissy reappeared with [them]2199-they directly . [Tom]75-tom was last ; and remained standing in the obscurest part of [the room]2859-the room , near the door . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [Mrs. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ’ said [[her]76-sissy husband]2861-her husband , entering with a cool nod , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i do n’t disturb [you]92-mr. bounderby , [I]0-i hope . [Tom]75-tom coughed . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [You]92-mr. bounderby have seen [me]0-i , [young lady]4132-young lady , ’ repeated [Rachael]140-rachael , as [she]140-rachael did not answer , ‘[92-mr. bounderby] once before . ’ [Tom]75-tom coughed again . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have . ’ [Rachael]140-rachael cast [her]140-rachael eyes proudly towards [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , and said , ‘[0-i] Will [you]92-mr. bounderby make it known , [young lady]4132-young lady , where , and who was there ? ’ ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i went to [the house where [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen lodged , on the night of [his]137-stephen discharge from [his]137-stephen work]2208-the house where stephen blackpool lodged , on the night of his discharge from his work , and [I]0-i saw [you]92-mr. bounderby [there]412-there . [He]137-stephen was there too ; and [an old woman who did not speak]2210-an old woman who did not speak , and whom [I]0-i could scarcely see , stood in a dark corner . [[My]0-i brother]3815-my brother was with [me]0-i . ’ ‘[3815-my brother] Why could n’t [you]92-mr. bounderby say so , [young Tom]75-tom ? ’ demanded [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘[92-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i promised [[my]0-i sister]664-my sister [I]0-i would n’t . ’ Which [Louisa]91-louisa hastily confirmed . ‘[0-i] And besides , ’ said [the whelp]1268-the whelp bitterly , ‘[664-my sister] [she]664-my sister tells [her]664-my sister own story so precious well — and so full — that what business had [I]0-i to take it out of [her]664-my sister mouth ! ’ ‘[4132-young lady] Say , [young lady]4132-young lady , if [you]4132-young lady please , ’ pursued [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘[4132-young lady] why , in an evil hour , [you]4132-young lady ever came to [Stephen]137-stephen ’s that night . ’ ‘[4132-young lady] [I]0-i felt compassion for [him]137-stephen , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa , [her]91-louisa colour deepening , ‘[0-i] and [I]0-i wished to know what [he]137-stephen was going to do , and wished to offer [him]137-stephen assistance . ’ ‘[350-ma’am] Thank [you]4132-young lady , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’ said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘[4132-young lady] Much flattered and obliged . ’ ‘[4132-young lady] Did [you]4132-young lady offer [him]137-stephen , ’ asked [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘[4132-young lady] a bank - note ? ’ ‘[4132-young lady] Yes ; but [he]137-stephen refused it , and would only take two pounds in gold . ’ [Rachael]140-rachael cast [her]140-rachael eyes towards [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby again . ‘[4132-young lady] Oh , certainly ! ’ said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘[4132-young lady] If [you]4132-young lady put the question whether [your]4132-young lady ridiculous and improbable account was true or not , [I]0-i am bound to say it ’s confirmed . ’ ‘[4132-young lady] [Young lady]4132-young lady , ’ said [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘[4132-young lady] [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen is now named as [a thief in public print all over [this town]3717-this town]2216-a thief in public print all over this town , and where else ! [The honestest lad]2218-the honestest lad , [the truest lad]2219-the truest lad , the best ! ’ [Her]4132-young lady indignation failed [her]4132-young lady , and [she]4132-young lady broke off sobbing . ‘[137-stephen] [I]0-i am very , very sorry , ’ said [Louisa]91-louisa . ‘[0-i] Oh , [young lady]4132-young lady , [young lady]4132-young lady , ’ returned [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘[4132-young lady] [I]0-i hope [you]4132-young lady may be , but [I]0-i do n’t know ! [I]0-i ca n’t say what [you]4132-young lady may ha ’ done ! The like of [you]4132-young lady do n’t know [us]4753-us , do n’t care for [us]4753-us , do n’t belong to [us]4753-us .
