[I]0-i ca n’t tell but what [you]4132-young lady may ha ’ come wi ’[0-i] some aim of [your]4132-young lady own , not mindin to what trouble [you]4132-young lady brought such as [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad . [I]0-i said then , Bless [you]4132-young lady for coming ; and [I]0-i said it of [my]0-i heart , [you]4132-young lady seemed to take so pitifully to [him]1534-the poor lad ; but [I]0-i do n’t know now , [I]0-i do n’t know ! ’ [Louisa]91-louisa could not reproach [her]4132-young lady for [her]4132-young lady unjust suspicions ; [she]4132-young lady was so faithful to [her]4132-young lady idea of [the man]3010-the man , and so afflicted . ‘[0-i] And when [I]0-i think , ’ said [Rachael]140-rachael through [her]140-rachael sobs , ‘[0-i] that [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad was so grateful , thinkin [you]4132-young lady so good to [him]1534-the poor lad — when [I]0-i mind that [he]1534-the poor lad put [his]1534-the poor lad hand over [his]1534-the poor lad hard - worken face to hide the tears that [you]4132-young lady brought up there — Oh , [I]0-i hope [you]4132-young lady may be sorry , and [ha]2224-ha ’ no bad cause to be it ; but [I]0-i do n’t know , [I]0-i do n’t know ! ’[0-i] ‘ [You]4132-young lady ’re[0-i] a pretty article , ’ growled [the whelp]1268-the whelp , moving uneasily in [his]1268-the whelp dark corner , ‘[0-i] to come here with these precious imputations ! [You]4132-young lady ought to be bundled out for not knowing how to behave [yourself]4132-young lady , and [you]4132-young lady would be by rights . ’ [She]4132-young lady said nothing in reply ; and [her]4132-young lady low weeping was the only sound that was heard , until [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby spoke . ‘[4132-young lady] Come ! ’ said [he]92-mr. bounderby , ‘[4132-young lady] [you]4132-young lady know what [you]4132-young lady have engaged to do . [You]4132-young lady had better give [your]4132-young lady mind to that ; not this . ’ ‘[4132-young lady] ’ Deed , [I]140-rachael am loath , ’[140-rachael] returned [Rachael]140-rachael , drying [her]140-rachael eyes , ‘ that [any here]4756-any here should see [me]140-rachael like this ; but [I]140-rachael wo n’t be seen so again . [Young lady]4132-young lady , when [I]140-rachael had read what ’s put in print of [Stephen]137-stephen — and what has just as much truth in it as if it had been put in print of [you]4132-young lady — [I]140-rachael went straight to [the Bank]3460-the bank to say [I]140-rachael knew where [Stephen]137-stephen was , and to give a sure and certain promise that [he]137-stephen should be here in two days . [I]140-rachael could n’t meet [wi]4759-wi ’[140-rachael] [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby then , and [[your]4132-young lady brother]3871-your brother sent [me]0-i away , and [I]0-i tried to find [you]4132-young lady , but [you]4132-young lady was not to be found , and [I]0-i went back to work . Soon as [I]0-i come out of [the Mill]53-the mill to - night , [I]0-i hastened to hear what was said of [Stephen]137-stephen — for [I]0-i know wi ’ pride [he]137-stephen will come back to shame it!—and then [I]0-i went again to seek [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , and [I]0-i found [him]137-stephen , and [I]0-i told [him]137-stephen every word [I]0-i knew ; and [he]137-stephen believed no word [I]0-i said , and brought [me]0-i here . ’[0-i] ‘ So far , that ’s true enough , ’[92-mr. bounderby] assented [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , with [his]92-mr. bounderby hands in [his]92-mr. bounderby pockets and [his]92-mr. bounderby hat on . ‘ But [I]92-mr. bounderby have known [[you]4760-you people]4054-you people before to - day , [you]4760-you ’ll observe , and [I]92-mr. bounderby know [you]4760-you never die for want of talking . Now , [I]92-mr. bounderby recommend [you]4760-you not so much to mind talking just now , as doing . [You]4760-you have undertaken to do something ; all [I]92-mr. bounderby remark upon that at present is , do it ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [I]2226-he have written to [Stephen]137-stephen by the post that went out this afternoon , as [I]2226-he have written to [him]2226-he once before sin ’[2226-he] [he]2226-he went away , ’ said [Rachael]140-rachael ; ‘[2226-he] and [he]2226-he will be here , at furthest , in two days . ’ ‘[2226-he] Then , [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]2227-you something . [You]2227-you are not aware perhaps , ’ retorted [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘[2227-you] that [you]2227-you [yourself]2227-you have been looked after now and then , not being considered quite free from suspicion in this business , on account of [most people]4458-most people being judged according to [the company [they]4458-most people keep]2229-the company they keep . [The post - office]2230-the post - office has n’t been forgotten either . What [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]2227-you is , that no letter to [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen has ever got into it . Therefore , what has become of [yours]2227-you , [I]0-i leave [you]2227-you to guess . Perhaps [you]2227-you ’re mistaken , and never wrote any . ’[2227-you] ‘ [He]2226-he had n’t been gone from [here]354-here , [young lady]4132-young lady , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael , turning appealingly to [Louisa]91-louisa , ‘ as much as a week , when [he]2226-he sent [me]140-rachael the only letter [I]140-rachael have had from [him]2226-he , saying that [he]2226-he was forced to seek work in another name . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Oh , by [George]71-george ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] cried [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , shaking [his]92-mr. bounderby head , with a whistle , ‘ [he]2226-he changes [his]2226-he name , does [he]2226-he ! That ’s rather unlucky , too , for [such an immaculate chap]4764-such an immaculate chap . It ’s considered a little suspicious in [Courts of Justice]4765-courts of justice , [I]92-mr. bounderby believe , when [an Innocent]4766-an innocent happens to have many names . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ What , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael , with the tears in [her]140-rachael eyes again , ‘ what , [young lady]4132-young lady , in the name of [Mercy]214-mercy , was left [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad to do ! [The masters]4769-the masters against [him]2226-he on one hand , [the men against [him]2226-he]4770-the men against him on the other , [he]2226-he only wantin to work hard in peace , and do what [he]2226-he felt right . Can [a man]3830-a man have no soul of [his]3830-a man own , no mind of [his]3830-a man own ? Must [he]2231-he go wrong all through wi ’[92-mr. bounderby] this side , or must [he]2231-he go wrong all through wi ’ that , or else be hunted like a hare ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Indeed , indeed , [I]91-louisa pity [him]2231-he from [my]91-louisa heart , ’[91-louisa] returned [Louisa]91-louisa ; ‘ and [I]91-louisa hope that [he]2231-he will clear [himself]2231-he . ’[91-louisa] ‘ [You]91-louisa need have no fear of that , [young lady]4132-young lady . [He]2231-he is sure ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [All the surer]4773-all the surer , [I]92-mr. bounderby suppose , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ for [your]91-louisa refusing to tell where [he]2231-he is ? Eh ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [He]2231-he shall not , through any act of [mine]92-mr. bounderby , come back wi ’[92-mr. bounderby] the unmerited reproach of being brought back . [He]2231-he shall come back of [his]2231-he own accord to clear [himself]2231-he , and put all those that have injured [his]2231-he good character , and [he]2231-he not here for its defence , to shame . [I]0-i have told [him]2231-he what has been done against [him]2231-he , ’ said [Rachael]140-rachael , throwing off all distrust as a rock throws off [the sea]697-the sea , ‘[0-i] and [he]2231-he will be here , at furthest , in two days . ’ ‘[2231-he] Notwithstanding which , ’ added [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘[2231-he] if [he]2231-he can be laid hold of any sooner , [he]2231-he shall have an earlier opportunity of clearing [himself]2231-he . As to [you]2232-you , [I]0-i have nothing against [you]2232-you ; what [you]2232-you came and told [me]0-i turns out to be true , and [I]0-i have given [you]2232-you the means of proving it to be true , and there ’s an end of it . [I]0-i wish [you]2232-you good night all ! [I]0-i must be off to look a little further into this . ’ [Tom]75-tom came out of [his]75-tom corner when [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby moved , moved with [him]75-tom , kept close to [him]75-tom , and went away with [him]75-tom . The only parting salutation of which [he]2231-he delivered [himself]2231-he was a sulky ‘[0-i] Good night , [father]2723-father ! ’ With a brief speech , and a scowl at [[his]2231-he sister]644-his sister , [he]2231-he left [the house]2875-the house . Since [his]2231-he sheet - anchor had come [home]336-home , [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom had been sparing of speech . [He]2231-he still sat silent , when [Louisa]91-louisa mildly said : ‘[2723-father] [Rachael]140-rachael , [you]140-rachael will not distrust [me]0-i one day , when [you]140-rachael know [me]0-i better . ’ ‘[140-rachael] It goes against [me]0-i , ’ [Rachael]140-rachael answered , in a gentler manner , ‘[140-rachael] to mistrust [any one]2994-any one ; but when [I]0-i am so mistrusted — when [we]2235-we all are — [I]0-i can not keep such things quite out of [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i ask [your]140-rachael pardon for having done [you]140-rachael an injury . [I]0-i do n’t think what [I]0-i said now . Yet [I]0-i might come to think it again , wi ’ [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad so wronged . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Did [you]140-rachael tell [him]1534-the poor lad in [your]140-rachael letter , ’[76-sissy] inquired [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ that suspicion seemed to have fallen upon [him]1534-the poor lad , because [he]1534-the poor lad had been seen about [the Bank]31-the bank at night ? [He]1534-the poor lad would then know what [he]1534-the poor lad would have to explain on coming back , and would be ready . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Yes , [dear]2972-dear , ’[2236-she] [she]2236-she returned ; ‘ but [I]76-sissy ca n’t guess what can have ever taken [him]1534-the poor lad [there]412-there . [He]1534-the poor lad never used to go [there]412-there . It was never in [his]1534-the poor lad way . [His]1534-the poor lad way was the same as [mine]76-sissy , and not near it . ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy had already been at [her]2236-she side asking [her]2236-she where [she]2236-she lived , and whether [she]2236-she might come to - morrow night , to inquire if there were news of [him]2237-him . ‘ [I]140-rachael doubt , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘ if [he]1534-the poor lad can be [here]354-here till next day . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Then [I]76-sissy will come next night too , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy . When [Rachael]140-rachael , assenting to this , was gone , [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom lifted up [his]75-tom head , and said to [[his]75-tom daughter]345-his daughter : ‘ [Louisa]91-louisa , [[my]75-tom dear]3090-my dear , [I]75-tom have never , that [I]75-tom know of , seen [this man]2949-this man . Do [you]91-louisa believe [him]2949-this man to be implicated ? ’[75-tom] ‘ [I]140-rachael think [I]140-rachael have believed it , [father]2723-father , though with great difficulty . [I]140-rachael do not believe it now . ’[140-rachael] ‘ That is to say , [you]91-louisa once persuaded [yourself]91-louisa to believe it , from knowing [him]2239-his to be suspected . [His]2239-his appearance and manner ; are [they]4786-they so honest ? ’[75-tom] ‘ Very honest . ’[75-tom] ‘ And [her]91-louisa confidence not to be shaken ! [I]75-tom ask [myself]75-tom , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , musing , ‘ does [the real culprit]4787-the real culprit know of these accusations ? Where is [he]2239-his ? Who is [he]2239-his ? ’[75-tom] [His]2239-his hair had latterly began to change its colour . As [he]2239-his leaned upon [his]2239-his hand again , looking gray and old , [Louisa]91-louisa , with a face of fear and pity , hurriedly went over to [him]2239-his , and sat close at [his]2239-his side . [Her]91-louisa eyes by accident met [Sissy]76-sissy ’s at the moment . [Sissy]76-sissy flushed and started , and [Louisa]91-louisa put [her]91-louisa finger on [her]91-louisa lip . Next night , when [Sissy]76-sissy returned [home]336-home and told [Louisa]91-louisa that [Stephen]137-stephen was not come , [she]76-sissy told it in a whisper . Next night again , when [she]91-louisa came [home]336-home with the same account , and added that [he]137-stephen had not been heard of , [she]91-louisa spoke in the same low frightened tone . From the moment of that interchange of looks , [they]2242-they never uttered [his]137-stephen name , or any reference to [him]137-stephen , aloud ; nor ever pursued the subject of the robbery , when [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom spoke of it . The two appointed days ran out , three days and nights ran out , and [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen was not come , and remained unheard of . On the fourth day , [Rachael]140-rachael , with unabated confidence , but considering [her]140-rachael despatch to have miscarried , went up to [the Bank]3460-the bank , and showed [her]140-rachael letter from [him]137-stephen with [his]137-stephen address , at [a working colony]2244-a working colony , one of many , not upon [the main road]2245-the main road , sixty miles away . [Messengers]2246-messengers were sent to [that place]4386-that place , and [the whole town]3620-the whole town looked for [Stephen]137-stephen to be brought in next day . During this whole time [the whelp]1268-the whelp moved about with [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby like [his]92-mr. bounderby shadow , assisting in all the proceedings . [He]137-stephen was greatly excited , horribly fevered , bit [his]137-stephen nails down to the quick , spoke in a hard rattling voice , and with lips that were black and burnt up . At the hour when [the suspected man]2250-the suspected man was looked for , [the whelp]1268-the whelp was at [the station]911-the station ; offering to wager that [he]137-stephen had made off before the arrival of [those who were sent in quest of [him]137-stephen]2253-those who were sent in quest of him , and that [he]137-stephen would not appear . [The whelp]1268-the whelp was right . [The messengers]2255-the messengers returned alone . [Rachael]140-rachael ’s letter had gone , [Rachael]140-rachael ’s letter had been delivered . [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen had decamped in that same hour ; and [no soul]2256-no soul knew more of [him]137-stephen . The only doubt in [Coketown]4-coketown was , whether [Rachael]140-rachael had written in good faith , believing that [he]137-stephen really would come back , or warning [him]137-stephen to fly . On this point opinion was divided . Six days , seven days , far on into another week . [The wretched whelp]2257-the wretched whelp plucked up a ghastly courage , and began to grow defiant . ‘ _ Was _ [the suspected fellow]4788-the suspected fellow [the thief]4789-the thief ? A pretty question ! If not , where was [the man]3010-the man , and why did [he]3010-the man not come back ? ’[2257-the wretched whelp] Where was [the man]3010-the man , and why did [he]3010-the man not come back ? In the dead of night the echoes of [his]3010-the man own words , which had rolled Heaven knows how far away in the daytime , came back instead , and abided by [him]3010-the man until morning . CHAPTER V FOUND DAY and night again , day and night again . [No Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen . Where was [the man]3010-the man , and why did [he]3010-the man not come back ? Every night , [Sissy]76-sissy went to [[Rachael]140-rachael ’s lodging]2260-rachael ’s lodging , and sat with [her]140-rachael in [[her]76-sissy small neat room]2261-her small neat room . All day , [Rachael]140-rachael toiled as [such people]2262-such people must toil , whatever [their]2262-such people anxieties . The smoke - serpents were [indifferent who was lost or found , who turned out bad or good]2263-indifferent who was lost or found , who turned out bad or good ; [the melancholy mad elephants]2264-the melancholy mad elephants , like [the Hard Fact men]2265-the hard fact men , abated nothing of [their]2264-the melancholy mad elephants set routine , whatever happened . Day and night again , day and night again . The monotony was unbroken . Even [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen ’s disappearance was falling into the general way , and becoming as monotonous a wonder as any piece of machinery in [Coketown]4-coketown . ‘ [I]140-rachael misdoubt , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘ if there is as many as twenty left in all [this place]656-this place , who have any trust in [the poor dear lad]4792-the poor dear lad now . ’[140-rachael] [She]140-rachael said it to [Sissy]76-sissy , as [they]2266-they sat in [[her]140-rachael lodging]2267-her lodging , lighted only by the lamp at [the street corner]2268-the street corner . [Sissy]76-sissy had come [there]412-there when it was already dark , to await [her]140-rachael return from work ; and [they]2266-they had since sat at the window where [Rachael]140-rachael had found [her]140-rachael , wanting no brighter light to shine on [their]2266-they sorrowful talk . ‘ If it had n’t been mercifully brought about , that [I]140-rachael was to have [you]140-rachael to speak to , ’[140-rachael] pursued [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘ times are , when [I]140-rachael think [my]140-rachael mind would not have kept right . But [I]140-rachael get hope and strength through [you]140-rachael ; and [you]140-rachael believe that though appearances may rise against [him]4793-him , [he]4793-him will be proved clear ? ’[140-rachael] ‘ [I]140-rachael do believe so , ’[140-rachael] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ with [my]140-rachael whole heart . [I]140-rachael feel so certain , [Rachael]140-rachael , that the confidence [you]140-rachael hold in [yours]140-rachael against all discouragement , is not like to be wrong , that [I]140-rachael have no more doubt of [him]4793-him than if [I]140-rachael had known [him]4793-him through as many years of trial as [you]140-rachael have . ’[140-rachael] ‘ And [I]215-rachel , [[my]215-rachel dear]3090-my dear , ’[215-rachel] said [Rachel]215-rachel , with a tremble in [her]215-rachel voice , ‘ have known [him]4793-him through [them]4795-them all , to be , according to [his]4793-him quiet ways , so faithful to everything honest and good , that if [he]4793-him was never to be heard of more , and [I]215-rachel was to live to be a hundred years old , [I]215-rachel could say with [my]215-rachel last breath , [God]126-god knows [my]215-rachel heart . [I]215-rachel have never once left trusting [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen ! ’[215-rachel] ‘ [We]4796-we all believe , up at [the Lodge]1735-the lodge , [Rachael]140-rachael , that [he]4793-him will be freed from suspicion , sooner or later . ’[140-rachael] ‘ The better [I]140-rachael know it to be so believed there , [[my]140-rachael dear]3090-my dear , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘ and the kinder [I]140-rachael feel it that [you]3090-my dear come away from [there]412-there , purposely to comfort [me]140-rachael , and keep [me]140-rachael company , and be seen wi ’[140-rachael] [me]0-i when [I]0-i am not yet free from all suspicion [myself]0-i , the more grieved [I]0-i am that [I]0-i should ever have spoken those mistrusting words to [the young lady]2270-the young lady . And yet [I]0-i — ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i do n’t mistrust [her]2270-the young lady now , [Rachael]140-rachael ? ’ ‘[0-i] Now that [you]0-i have brought [us]2271-us more together , no . But [I]0-i ca n’t at all times keep out of [my]0-i mind — ’ [Her]2270-the young lady voice so sunk into a low and slow communing with [herself]2270-the young lady , that [Sissy]76-sissy , sitting by [her]76-sissy side , was obliged to listen with attention . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t at all times keep out of [my]0-i mind , mistrustings of [some one]973-some one . [I]0-i ca n’t think [who ’ tis]4800-who ’ tis , [I]4800-who ’ tis ca n’t think how or why it may be done , but [I]4800-who ’ tis mistrust that [some one]973-some one has put [Stephen]137-stephen out of the way . [I]4800-who ’ tis mistrust that by [his]137-stephen coming back of [his]137-stephen own accord , and showing [himself]137-stephen innocent before [them]4802-them all , [some one]973-some one would be confounded , who — to prevent that — has stopped [him]137-stephen , and put [him]137-stephen out of the way . ’[4800-who ’ tis] ‘ That is a dreadful thought , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , turning pale . ‘ It _ is _ a dreadful thought to think [he]137-stephen may be murdered . ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy shuddered , and turned paler yet . ‘ When it makes its way into [my]140-rachael mind , [dear]2972-dear , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael , ‘ and it will come sometimes , though [I]140-rachael do all [I]140-rachael can to keep it out , wi ’[140-rachael] counting on to high numbers as [I]0-i work , and saying over and over again pieces that [I]0-i knew when [I]0-i were [a child]339-a child — [I]0-i fall into such a wild , hot hurry , that , however tired [I]0-i am , [I]0-i want to walk fast , miles and miles . [I]0-i must get the better of this before bed - time . [I]0-i ’ll walk [home]336-home wi ’ [you]76-sissy . ’[0-i] ‘ [He]137-stephen might fall ill upon the journey back , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , faintly offering a worn - out scrap of hope ; ‘ and in such a case , there are many places on [the road]326-the road where [he]137-stephen might stop . ’[76-sissy] ‘ But [he]137-stephen is in none of them . [He]137-stephen has been sought for in all , and [he]137-stephen ’s not [there]412-there . ’[0-i] ‘ True , ’[76-sissy] was [Sissy]76-sissy ’s reluctant admission . ‘ [He]137-stephen ’d walk the journey in two days . If [he]137-stephen was footsore and could n’t walk , [I]76-sissy sent [him]137-stephen , in the letter [he]137-stephen got , the money to ride , lest [he]137-stephen should have none of [his]137-stephen own to spare . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Let [us]2275-us hope that to - morrow will bring something better , [Rachael]140-rachael . Come into the air ! ’[76-sissy] [Her]76-sissy gentle hand adjusted [Rachael]140-rachael ’s shawl upon [her]76-sissy shining black hair in the usual manner of [her]76-sissy wearing it , and [they]2275-us went out . The night being fine , little knots of [Hands]145-the coketown hands were here and there lingering at [street corners]2276-street corners ; but it was supper - time with the greater part of [them]145-the coketown hands , and there were but [few people]2277-few people in [the streets]2931-the streets . ‘ [You]140-rachael ’re[140-rachael] not so hurried now , [Rachael]140-rachael , and [your]140-rachael hand is cooler . ’ ‘[140-rachael] [I]0-i get better , [dear]2972-dear , if [I]0-i can only walk , and breathe a little fresh . ‘ Times when [I]140-rachael ca n’t , [I]140-rachael turn weak and confused . ’[140-rachael] ‘ But [you]140-rachael must not begin to fail , [Rachael]140-rachael , for [you]140-rachael may be wanted at any time to stand by [Stephen]137-stephen . To - morrow is Saturday . If no news comes to - morrow , let [us]2280-them walk in [the country]2802-the country on Sunday morning , and strengthen [you]140-rachael for another week . Will [you]140-rachael go ? ’[140-rachael] ‘ Yes , [dear]2972-dear . ’[2280-them] [They]2280-them were by this time in [the street where [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s house stood]2281-the street where mr. bounderby ’s house stood . The way to [[Sissy]76-sissy ’s destination]2282-sissy ’s destination led [them]2280-them past the door , and [they]2280-them were going straight towards [it]2283-it . [Some train]2284-some train had newly arrived in [Coketown]4-coketown , which had put [a number of vehicles]2285-a number of vehicles in motion , and scattered a considerable bustle about [the town]317-the town . [Several coaches]2287-several coaches were rattling before [them]2280-them and behind [them]2280-them as [they]2280-them approached [[Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s]2288-mr. bounderby ’s , and [one of [the latter]2290-the latter]2289-one of the latter drew up with such briskness as [they]2280-them were in the act of passing [the house]2875-the house , that [they]2280-them looked round involuntarily . The bright gaslight over [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s steps showed [them]2280-them [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby in [the coach]2292-the coach , in an ecstasy of excitement , struggling to open the door ; [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby seeing [them]2280-them at the same moment , called to [them]2280-them to stop . ‘ It ’s a coincidence , ’[92-mr. bounderby] exclaimed [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , as [she]2293-her was released by [the coachman]4508-the coachman . ‘ It ’s a Providence ! Come out , [ma’am]350-ma’am ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] then said [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , to [some one inside]2295-some one inside , ‘ come out , or [we]2280-them ’ll have [you]2295-some one inside dragged out ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] Hereupon , no other than [the mysterious old woman]4721-the mysterious old woman descended . Whom [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby incontinently collared . ‘ Leave [her]4721-the mysterious old woman alone , [everybody]391-everybody ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] cried [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , with great energy . ‘ Let [nobody]353-nobody touch [her]4721-the mysterious old woman . [She]4721-the mysterious old woman belongs to [me]92-mr. bounderby . Come in , [ma’am]350-ma’am ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] then said [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , reversing [her]2293-her former word of command . ‘ Come in , [ma’am]350-ma’am , or [we]4814-we ’ll have [you]350-ma’am dragged in ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] The spectacle of [a matron of classical deportment]2297-a matron of classical deportment , seizing [an ancient woman]2298-an ancient woman by the throat , and hauling [her]2298-an ancient woman into [a dwelling - house]2299-a dwelling - house , would have been under any circumstances , sufficient temptation to [all true English stragglers]2300-all true english stragglers so blest as to witness it , to force a way into [that dwelling - house]2301-that dwelling - house and see the matter out . But when the phenomenon was enhanced by the notoriety and mystery by this time associated all over [the town]317-the town with the Bank robbery , it would have lured [the stragglers]2303-the stragglers in , with an irresistible attraction , though the roof had been expected to fall upon [their]2303-the stragglers heads . Accordingly , [the chance witnesses on the ground]2304-the chance witnesses on the ground , consisting of [the busiest of [the neighbours to the number of some five - and - twenty]2306-the neighbours to the number of some five - and - twenty]2305-the busiest of the neighbours to the number of some five - and - twenty , closed in after [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]140-rachael , as [they]2304-the chance witnesses on the ground closed in after [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby and [her]2293-her prize ; and [the whole body]2307-the whole body made a disorderly irruption into [[Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s dining - room]2308-mr. bounderby ’s dining - room , where [the people behind]2309-the people behind lost not a moment ’s time in mounting on the chairs , to get the better of [the people in front]2310-the people in front . ‘ Fetch [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby down ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] cried [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , [young woman]4815-young woman ; [you]4815-young woman know who this is ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ It ’s [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , ’[140-rachael] said [Rachael]140-rachael . ‘ [I]92-mr. bounderby should think it is ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] cried [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , exulting . ‘ [Fetch Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . Stand away , [everybody]391-everybody ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] Here [old Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , muffling [herself]179-mrs. pegler up , and shrinking from observation , whispered a word of entreaty . ‘ Do n’t tell [me]92-mr. bounderby , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , aloud . ‘ [I]92-mr. bounderby have told [you]92-mr. bounderby twenty times , coming along , that [I]92-mr. bounderby will _ not _ leave [you]92-mr. bounderby till [I]92-mr. bounderby have handed [you]92-mr. bounderby over to [him]92-mr. bounderby [myself]92-mr. bounderby . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby now appeared , accompanied by [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom and the whelp , with whom [he]92-mr. bounderby had been holding conference up - stairs . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby looked more astonished than hospitable , at sight of this uninvited party in [[his]92-mr. bounderby dining - room]2311-his dining - room . ‘ Why , what ’s the matter now ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [he]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]350-ma’am ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Sir]2713-sir , ’[2312-that worthy woman] explained [that worthy woman]2312-that worthy woman , ‘ [I]2312-that worthy woman trust it is [my]2312-that worthy woman good fortune to produce [a person [you]2713-sir have much desired to find]4819-a person you have much desired to find . Stimulated by [my]2312-that worthy woman wish to relieve [your]2713-sir mind , [sir]2713-sir , and connecting together such imperfect clues to [the part of [the country]2802-the country in which [that person]4823-that person might be supposed to reside]4821-the part of the country in which that person might be supposed to reside , as have been afforded by [the young woman]4824-the young woman , [Rachael]140-rachael , fortunately now present to identify , [I]2312-that worthy woman have had the happiness to succeed , and to bring [that person]4823-that person with [me]2312-that worthy woman — [I]2312-that worthy woman need not say most unwillingly on [her]4823-that person part . It has not been , [sir]2713-sir , without some trouble that [I]2312-that worthy woman have effected this ; but trouble in [your]2713-sir service is to [me]2312-that worthy woman a pleasure , and hunger , thirst , and cold a real gratification . ’[2312-that worthy woman] Here [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby ceased ; for [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s visage exhibited an extraordinary combination of all possible colours and expressions of discomfiture , as [old Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler was disclosed to [his]92-mr. bounderby view . ‘ Why , what do [you]92-mr. bounderby mean by this ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] was [his]92-mr. bounderby highly unexpected demand , in great warmth . ‘ [I]92-mr. bounderby ask [you]92-mr. bounderby , what do [you]92-mr. bounderby mean by this , [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]350-ma’am ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Sir]2713-sir ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] exclaimed [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , faintly . ‘ Why do n’t [you]92-mr. bounderby mind [your]92-mr. bounderby own business , [ma’am]350-ma’am ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] roared [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ How dare [you]92-mr. bounderby go and poke [your]92-mr. bounderby officious nose into [my]92-mr. bounderby family affairs ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] This allusion to [her]179-mrs. pegler favourite feature overpowered [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby . [She]179-mrs. pegler sat down stiffly in a chair , as if [she]179-mrs. pegler were frozen ; and with a fixed stare at [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , slowly grated [her]179-mrs. pegler mittens against one another , as if they were frozen too . ‘ [[My]179-mrs. pegler dear]3090-my dear [Josiah]96-josiah bounderby ! ’[179-mrs. pegler] cried [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , trembling . ‘ [[My]179-mrs. pegler darling boy]4831-my darling boy ! [I]179-mrs. pegler am not to blame . It ’s not [my]179-mrs. pegler fault , [Josiah]96-josiah bounderby . [I]179-mrs. pegler told [this lady]3106-this lady over and over again , that [I]179-mrs. pegler knew [she]3106-this lady was doing what would not be agreeable to [you]96-josiah bounderby , but [she]3106-this lady would do it . ’[179-mrs. pegler] ‘ What did [you]92-mr. bounderby let [her]3106-this lady bring [you]92-mr. bounderby for ? Could n’t [you]92-mr. bounderby knock [her]3106-this lady cap off , or [her]3106-this lady tooth out , or scratch [her]3106-this lady , or do something or other to [her]3106-this lady ? ’[96-josiah bounderby] asked [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby . ‘ [[My]92-mr. bounderby own boy]4833-my own boy ! [She]3106-this lady threatened [me]92-mr. bounderby that if [I]92-mr. bounderby resisted [her]3106-this lady , [I]92-mr. bounderby should be brought by [constables]4834-constables , and it was better to come quietly than make that stir in such a’—Mrs . [Pegler]179-mrs. pegler glanced timidly but proudly round the walls—‘such [a fine house]4835-a fine house as this . Indeed , indeed , it is not [my]92-mr. bounderby fault ! [[My]92-mr. bounderby dear , [noble , stately boy]4837-noble , stately boy]4836-my dear , noble , stately boy ! [I]92-mr. bounderby have always lived quiet , and secret , [Josiah]96-josiah bounderby , [[my]92-mr. bounderby dear]3090-my dear . [I]92-mr. bounderby have never broken the condition once . [I]92-mr. bounderby have never said [I]92-mr. bounderby was [[your]96-josiah bounderby mother]710-your mother . [I]92-mr. bounderby have admired [you]96-josiah bounderby at a distance ; and if [I]92-mr. bounderby have come to [town]427-town sometimes , with long times between , to take a proud peep at [you]96-josiah bounderby , [I]92-mr. bounderby have done it unbeknown , [my]92-mr. bounderby love , and gone away again . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , with [his]92-mr. bounderby hands in [his]92-mr. bounderby pockets , walked in impatient mortification up and down at the side of the long dining - table , while [the spectators]501-the spectators greedily took in every syllable of [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler ’s appeal , and at each succeeding syllable became more and more round - eyed . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby still walking up and down when [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler had done , [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom addressed [that maligned old lady]2314-that maligned old lady : ‘ [I]75-tom am surprised , [madam]4841-madam , ’[75-tom] [he]75-tom observed with severity , ‘ that in [your]4841-madam old age [you]4841-madam have the face to claim [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby for [[your]4841-madam son]2203-your son , after [your]4841-madam unnatural and inhuman treatment of [him]2203-your son . ’[75-tom] ‘ _ [Me]179-mrs. pegler _ unnatural ! ’[179-mrs. pegler] cried poor old [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler . ‘ _ [Me]179-mrs. pegler _ inhuman ! To [[my]179-mrs. pegler dear boy]4843-my dear boy ? ’[179-mrs. pegler] ‘ [Dear]2972-dear ! ’[75-tom] repeated [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom . ‘ Yes ; dear in [his]2203-your son self - made prosperity , [madam]4841-madam , [I]75-tom dare say . Not very dear , however , when [you]4841-madam deserted [him]2203-your son in [his]2203-your son infancy , and left [him]2203-your son to the brutality of [a drunken grandmother]4846-a drunken grandmother . ’[75-tom] ‘ _ [I]179-mrs. pegler _ deserted [[my]179-mrs. pegler Josiah]4847-my josiah ! ’[179-mrs. pegler] cried [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , clasping [her]179-mrs. pegler hands . ‘ Now , [Lord]4848-lord forgive [you]75-tom , [sir]2713-sir , for [your]75-tom wicked imaginations , and for [your]75-tom scandal against the memory of [[my]179-mrs. pegler poor mother]4850-my poor mother , who died in [my]179-mrs. pegler arms before [Josiah]96-josiah bounderby was born . May [you]75-tom repent of it , [sir]2713-sir , and live to know better ! ’[179-mrs. pegler] [She]179-mrs. pegler was so very earnest and injured , that [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , shocked by the possibility which dawned upon [him]75-tom , said in a gentler tone : ‘ Do [you]179-mrs. pegler deny , then , [madam]4841-madam , that [you]179-mrs. pegler left [[your]179-mrs. pegler son]2203-your son to — to be brought up in the gutter ? ’[75-tom] ‘ [Josiah]96-josiah bounderby in the gutter ! ’[179-mrs. pegler] exclaimed [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler . ‘ No such a thing , [sir]2713-sir . Never ! For shame on [you]75-tom ! [[My]179-mrs. pegler dear boy]4843-my dear boy knows , and will give _ [you]75-tom _ to know , that though [he]4843-my dear boy come of [humble parents]4856-humble parents , [he]4843-my dear boy come of parents that loved [him]4843-my dear boy as dear as the best could , and never thought it hardship on [themselves]4856-humble parents to pinch a bit that [he]4843-my dear boy might write and cipher beautiful , and [I]179-mrs. pegler ’ve [his]4843-my dear boy books at [home]336-home to show it ! Aye , have [I]179-mrs. pegler ! ’[179-mrs. pegler] said [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , with indignant pride . ‘ And [[my]179-mrs. pegler dear boy]4843-my dear boy knows , and will give _ [you]75-tom _ to know , [sir]2713-sir , that after [[his]4843-my dear boy beloved father]4860-his beloved father died , when [he]4843-my dear boy was eight years old , [[his]4843-my dear boy mother]2851-his mother , too , could pinch a bit , as it was [her]2851-his mother duty and [her]2851-his mother pleasure and [her]2851-his mother pride to do it , to help [him]4843-my dear boy out in life , and put [him]4843-my dear boy ’[179-mrs. pegler] prentice . And [a steady lad]2315-a steady lad [he]2315-a steady lad was , and [a kind master]2316-a kind master [he]2315-a steady lad had to lend [him]2315-a steady lad a hand , and well [he]2315-a steady lad worked [his]2315-a steady lad own way forward to be rich and thriving . And _ [I_’ll]2317-i_’ll give [you]2318-you to know , [sir]2713-sir — for this [[my]0-i dear boy]4843-my dear boy won’t — that though [[his]4843-my dear boy mother]2851-his mother kept but [a little village shop]2322-a little village shop , [he]4843-my dear boy never forgot [her]2851-his mother , but pensioned [me]0-i on thirty pound a year — more than [I]0-i want , for [I]0-i put by out of it — only making the condition that [I]0-i was to keep down in [my]0-i own part , and make no boasts about [him]4843-my dear boy , and not trouble [him]4843-my dear boy . And [I]0-i never have , except with looking at [him]4843-my dear boy once a year , when [he]4843-my dear boy has never knowed it . And it ’s right , ’ said poor old [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , in affectionate championship , ‘[0-i] that [I]0-i _ should _ keep down in [my]0-i own part , and [I]0-i have no doubts that if [I]0-i was [here]354-here [I]0-i should do a many unbefitting things , and [I]0-i am well contented , and [I]0-i can keep [my]0-i pride in [my]0-i Josiah to [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i can love for love ’s own sake ! And [I]0-i am ashamed of [you]2324-you , [sir]2713-sir , ’ said [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , lastly , ‘[0-i] for [your]2324-you slanders and suspicions . And [I]0-i never stood [here]354-here before , nor never wanted to stand [here]354-here when [[my]0-i dear son]2328-my dear son said no . And [I]0-i should n’t be [here]354-here now , if it had n’t been for being brought [here]354-here . And for shame upon [you]2324-you , Oh , for shame , to accuse [me]0-i of being [a bad mother]2331-a bad mother to [[my]0-i son]2332-my son , with [[my]0-i son]2332-my son standing here to tell [you]2324-you so different ! ’ [The bystanders]4862-the bystanders , on and off the dining - room chairs , raised a murmur of sympathy with [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , and [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom felt [himself]75-tom innocently placed in a very distressing predicament , when [Mr. Bounderby , who had never]92-mr. bounderby [ceased walking up and down , and had every moment swelled larger and larger , and grown redder and redder]4863-ceased walking up and down , and had every moment swelled larger and larger , and grown redder and redder , stopped short . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t exactly know , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘[0-i] how [I]0-i come to be favoured with the attendance of [the present company]2334-the present company , but [I]0-i do n’t inquire . When [they]2334-the present company ’re quite satisfied , perhaps [they]2334-the present company ’ll be so good as to disperse ; whether [they]2334-the present company ’re[2334-the present company] satisfied or not , perhaps [they]2334-the present company ’ll be so good as to disperse . [I]0-i ’m not bound to deliver a lecture on [my]75-tom family affairs , [I]75-tom have not undertaken to do it , and [I]75-tom ’m[75-tom] not a going to do it . Therefore [those who expect any explanation whatever upon that branch of the subject]2335-those who expect any explanation whatever upon that branch of the subject , will be disappointed — particularly [Tom Gradgrind]75-tom , and [he]75-tom ca n’t know it too soon . In reference to the Bank robbery , there has been a mistake made , concerning [[my]0-i mother]357-my mother . If there had n’t been over - officiousness it would n’t have been made , and [I]0-i hate over - officiousness at all times , whether or no . Good evening ! ’ Although [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby carried it off in these terms , holding the door open for [the company]570-the company to depart , there was a blustering sheepishness upon [him]92-mr. bounderby , at once extremely crestfallen and superlatively absurd . [Detected]216-detected as [the Bully of humility]2843-the bully of humility , who had built [his]92-mr. bounderby windy reputation upon lies , and in [his]92-mr. bounderby boastfulness had put the honest truth as far away from [him]92-mr. bounderby as if [he]92-mr. bounderby had advanced the mean claim ( there is no meaner ) to tack [himself]92-mr. bounderby on to a pedigree , [he]92-mr. bounderby cut a most ridiculous figure . With [the people]307-the people filing off at the door [he]92-mr. bounderby held , who [he]92-mr. bounderby knew would carry what had passed to [the whole town]3620-the whole town , to be given to the four winds , [he]92-mr. bounderby could not have looked [a Bully more shorn and forlorn]4868-a bully more shorn and forlorn , if [he]92-mr. bounderby had had [his]92-mr. bounderby ears cropped . Even [that unlucky female]4869-that unlucky female , [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , fallen from [her]4869-that unlucky female pinnacle of exultation into [the Slough of Despond]54-the slough of despond , was not in so bad a plight as [that remarkable man]4870-that remarkable man and self - made [Humbug]217-humbug , [Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown . [Rachael]140-rachael and [Sissy]76-sissy , leaving [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler to occupy a bed at [[her]179-mrs. pegler son]4871-her son ’s for that night , walked together to the gate of [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge and there parted . [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom joined [them]4872-them before [they]4872-them had gone very far , and spoke with much interest of [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen ; for whom [he]75-tom thought this signal failure of the suspicions against [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler was likely to work well . As to the whelp ; throughout this scene as on all other late occasions , [he]137-stephen had stuck close to [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby . [He]137-stephen seemed to feel that as long as [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby could make no discovery without [his]137-stephen knowledge , [he]137-stephen was so far safe . [He]137-stephen never visited [[his]137-stephen sister]644-his sister , and had only seen [her]644-his sister once since [she]644-his sister went [home]336-home : that is to say on the night when [he]137-stephen still stuck close to [Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby , as already related . There was one dim unformed fear lingering about [[his]137-stephen sister]644-his sister ’s mind , to which [she]644-his sister never gave utterance , which surrounded [the graceless and ungrateful boy]4876-the graceless and ungrateful boy with a dreadful mystery . The same dark possibility had presented itself in the same shapeless guise , this very day , to [Sissy]76-sissy , when [Rachael]140-rachael spoke of [some one who would be confounded by [Stephen]137-stephen ’s return , having put [him]137-stephen out of the way]4877-some one who would be confounded by stephen ’s return , having put him out of the way . [Louisa]91-louisa had never spoken of harbouring any suspicion of [[her]91-louisa brother]2889-her brother in connexion with the robbery , [she]91-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy had held no confidence on the subject , save in that one interchange of looks when [the unconscious father]4879-the unconscious father rested [his]4879-the unconscious father gray head on [his]4879-the unconscious father hand ; but it was understood between [them]4880-them , and [they]4880-them both knew it . This other fear was so awful , that it hovered about each of [them]4880-them like a ghostly shadow ; neither daring to think of its being near [herself]644-his sister , far less of its being near the other . And still the forced spirit which [the whelp]1268-the whelp had plucked up , throve with [him]137-stephen . If [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen was not [the thief]4789-the thief , let [him]137-stephen show [himself]137-stephen . Why did n’t [he]137-stephen ? Another night . Another day and night . No [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen . Where was [the man]3010-the man , and why did [he]137-stephen not come back ? CHAPTER VI THE STARLIGHT THE Sunday was a bright Sunday in autumn , clear and cool , when early in the morning [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]140-rachael met , to walk in [the country]2802-the country . As [Coketown]4-coketown cast ashes not only on its own head but on [the neighbourhood]3292-the neighbourhood ’s too — after the manner of [those pious persons who do penance for [their]4886-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth own sins by putting [other people]4887-other people into sackcloth]4886-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth — it was customary for those who now and then thirsted for a draught of pure air , which is not absolutely the most wicked among the vanities of life , to get a few miles away by [the railroad]3601-the railroad , and then begin [their]4886-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth walk , or [their]4886-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth lounge in [the fields]4889-the fields . [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]140-rachael helped [themselves]4886-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth out of the smoke by the usual means , and were put down at [a station about midway between [the town]317-the town and [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s retreat]4890-a station about midway between the town and mr. bounderby ’s retreat . Though [the green landscape]4892-the green landscape was blotted here and there with heaps of coal , [it]4892-the green landscape was green elsewhere , and there were trees to see , and there were larks singing ( though it was Sunday ) , and there were pleasant scents in the air , and all was over - arched by a bright blue sky . In the distance one way , [Coketown]4-coketown showed as a black mist ; in another distance [hills]4893-hills began to rise ; in a third , there was a faint change in the light of the horizon where it shone upon [the far - off sea]4894-the far - off sea . Under [their]2337-they feet , the grass was fresh ; beautiful shadows of branches flickered upon it , and speckled it ; hedgerows were luxuriant ; everything was at peace . Engines at [pits]4895-pits ’[0-i] mouths , and lean old horses that had worn the circle of [their]2337-they daily labour into the ground , were alike quiet ; wheels had ceased for a short space to turn ; and the great wheel of earth seemed to revolve without the shocks and noises of another time . [They]2337-they walked on across [the fields]4889-the fields and down [the shady lanes]2339-the shady lanes , sometimes getting over a fragment of a fence so rotten that it dropped at a touch of the foot , sometimes passing near a wreck of bricks and beams overgrown with grass , marking the site of [deserted works]2340-deserted works . [They]2337-they followed paths and tracks , however slight . [Mounds where the grass was rank and high]2341-mounds where the grass was rank and high , and where brambles , dock - weed , and [such - like vegetation]2342-such - like vegetation , were confusedly heaped together , [they]2337-they always avoided ; for dismal stories were told in [that country of [the old pits hidden beneath such indications]2344-the old pits hidden beneath such indications]2343-that country of the old pits hidden beneath such indications . The sun was high when [they]2337-they sat down to rest . [They]2337-they had seen [no one]545-no one , near or distant , for a long time ; and the solitude remained unbroken . ‘ It is so still here , [Rachael]140-rachael , and the way is so untrodden , that [I]76-sissy think [we]2337-they must be [the first who have been [here]354-here all the summer]4896-the first who have been here all the summer . ’[76-sissy] As [Sissy]76-sissy said it , [her]76-sissy eyes were attracted by another of those rotten fragments of fence upon the ground . [She]76-sissy got up to look at [it]2346-it . ‘ And yet [I]76-sissy do n’t know . This has not been broken very long . The wood is quite fresh where it gave way . Here are footsteps too.—O [Rachael]140-rachael ! ’[76-sissy] [She]76-sissy ran back , and caught [her]76-sissy round the neck . [Rachael]140-rachael had already started up . ‘ What is the matter ? ’[140-rachael] ‘ [I]2337-they do n’t know . There is a hat lying in the grass . ’[2337-they] [They]2337-they went forward together . [Rachael]140-rachael took it up , shaking from head to foot . [She]140-rachael broke into a passion of tears and lamentations : [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen was written in [his]137-stephen own hand on the inside . ‘ O [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad , [the poor lad]1534-the poor lad ! [He]1534-the poor lad has been made away with . [He]1534-the poor lad is lying murdered here ! ’[137-stephen] ‘ Is there — has the hat any blood upon it ? ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy faltered . [They]2337-they were afraid to look ; but [they]2337-they did examine it , and found no mark of violence , inside or out . It had been lying there some days , for rain and dew had stained it , and the mark of its shape was on the grass where it had fallen . [They]2337-they looked fearfully about [them]2337-they , without moving , but could see nothing more . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy whispered , ‘ [I]76-sissy will go on a little by [myself]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] [She]76-sissy had unclasped [her]76-sissy hand , and was in the act of stepping forward , when [Rachael]140-rachael caught [her]76-sissy in both arms with a scream that resounded over [the wide landscape]2347-the wide landscape . Before [them]2337-they , at [their]2337-they very feet , was the brink of [a black ragged chasm hidden by the thick grass]2348-a black ragged chasm hidden by the thick grass . [They]2337-they sprang back , and fell upon [their]2337-they knees , each hiding [her]140-rachael face upon [the other]1294-the other ’s neck . ‘ O , [[my]140-rachael good Lord]4900-my good lord ! [He]4901-he ’s down there ! Down there ! ’[140-rachael] At first this , and [her]140-rachael terrific screams , were all that could be got from [Rachael]140-rachael , by any tears , by any prayers , by any representations , by any means . It was impossible to hush [her]140-rachael ; and it was deadly necessary to hold [her]140-rachael , or [she]140-rachael would have flung [herself]140-rachael down the shaft . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , dear [Rachael]140-rachael , good [Rachael]140-rachael , for the love of [Heaven]80-heaven , not these dreadful cries ! Think of [Stephen]137-stephen , think of [Stephen]137-stephen , think of [Stephen]137-stephen ! ’[140-rachael] By an earnest repetition of this entreaty , poured out in all the agony of such a moment , [Sissy]76-sissy at last brought [her]140-rachael to be silent , and to look at [her]140-rachael with a tearless face of stone . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , [Stephen]137-stephen may be living . [You]76-sissy would n’t leave [him]137-stephen lying maimed at the bottom of [this dreadful place]4902-this dreadful place , a moment , if [you]76-sissy could bring help to [him]137-stephen ? ’[76-sissy] ‘ No , no , no ! ’[2351-him] ‘ Do n’t stir from here , for [his]137-stephen sake ! Let [me]140-rachael go and listen . ’[140-rachael] [She]140-rachael shuddered to approach the pit ; but [she]140-rachael crept towards [it]2350-it on [her]140-rachael hands and knees , and called to [him]2351-him as loud as [she]140-rachael could call . [She]140-rachael listened , but no sound replied . [She]140-rachael called again and listened ; still no answering sound . [She]140-rachael did this , twenty , thirty times . [She]140-rachael took a little clod of earth from the broken ground where [he]2351-him had stumbled , and threw it in . [She]140-rachael could not hear it fall . [The wide prospect]2352-the wide prospect , so beautiful in [its]2352-the wide prospect stillness but a few minutes ago , almost carried despair to [her]140-rachael brave heart , as [she]140-rachael rose and looked all round [her]140-rachael , seeing no help . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , [we]4903-we must lose not a moment . [We]4903-we must go in different directions , seeking aid . [You]140-rachael shall go by the way [we]4903-we have come , and [I]140-rachael will go forward by the path . Tell [any one]2994-any one [you]140-rachael see , and [every one]1571-every one what has happened . Think of [Stephen]137-stephen , think of [Stephen]137-stephen ! ’[140-rachael] [She]140-rachael knew by [Rachael]140-rachael ’s face that [she]140-rachael might trust [her]140-rachael now . And after standing for a moment to see [her]140-rachael running , wringing [her]140-rachael hands as [she]140-rachael ran , [she]140-rachael turned and went upon [her]140-rachael own search ; [she]140-rachael stopped at the hedge to tie [her]140-rachael shawl there as a guide to [the place]329-the place , then threw [her]140-rachael bonnet aside , and ran as [she]140-rachael had never run before . Run , [Sissy]76-sissy , run , in [Heaven]80-heaven ’s name ! Do n’t stop for breath . Run , run ! Quickening [herself]140-rachael by carrying such entreaties in [her]140-rachael thoughts , [she]140-rachael ran from [field]2354-field to [field]2354-field , and [lane]2356-lane to [lane]2356-lane , and place to place , as [she]140-rachael had never run before ; until [she]140-rachael came to [a shed by [an engine - house]2359-an engine - house , where [two men]2360-two men lay in the shade , asleep on straw]2358-a shed by an engine - house , where two men lay in the shade , asleep on straw . First to wake [them]2360-two men , and next to tell [them]2360-two men , all so wild and breathless as [she]140-rachael was , what had brought [her]140-rachael there , were difficulties ; but [they]2360-two men no sooner understood [her]140-rachael than [their]2360-two men spirits were on fire like [hers]140-rachael . [One of [the men]549-the men]2361-one of the men was in a drunken slumber , but on [[his]2361-one of the men comrade]2363-his comrade ’s shouting to [him]2361-one of the men that [a man]3830-a man had fallen down [the Old Hell Shaft]55-the old hell shaft , [he]2361-one of the men started out to a pool of dirty water , put [his]2361-one of the men head in it , and came back sober . With [these two men]2365-these two men [she]140-rachael ran to another half - a - mile further , and with that one to another , while [they]2365-these two men ran elsewhere . Then a horse was found ; and [she]140-rachael got [another man to ride for life or death]2366-another man to ride for life or death to [the railroad]3601-the railroad , and send a message to [Louisa]91-louisa , which [she]140-rachael wrote and gave [him]2366-another man to ride for life or death . By this time [a whole village]2368-a whole village was up : and windlasses , ropes , poles , candles , lanterns , all things necessary , were fast collecting and being brought into one place , to be carried to [the Old Hell Shaft]2369-the old hell shaft . It seemed now hours and hours since [she]140-rachael had left [the lost man]2370-the lost man lying in the grave where [he]2370-the lost man had been buried alive . [She]140-rachael could not bear to remain away from it any longer — it was like deserting [him]2370-the lost man — and [she]140-rachael hurried swiftly back , accompanied by [half - a - dozen labourers]2371-half - a - dozen labourers , including [the drunken man whom the news had sobered]2372-the drunken man whom the news had sobered , and who was [the best man of all]2373-the best man of all . When [they]2365-these two men came to [the Old Hell Shaft]2369-the old hell shaft , [they]2365-these two men found [it]2369-the old hell shaft as lonely as [she]140-rachael had left [it]2369-the old hell shaft . [The men]549-the men called and listened as [she]140-rachael had done , and examined the edge of the chasm , and settled how it had happened , and then sat down to wait until the implements [they]549-the men wanted should come up . Every sound of insects in the air , every stirring of the leaves , every whisper among [these men]1334-these men , made [Sissy]76-sissy tremble , for [she]76-sissy thought it was a cry at the bottom of [the pit]2377-the pit . But the wind blew idly over it , and no sound arose to the surface , and [they]2365-these two men sat upon the grass , waiting and waiting . After [they]2365-these two men had waited some time , [straggling people who had heard of the accident]2378-straggling people who had heard of the accident began to come up ; then the real help of implements began to arrive . In the midst of this , [Rachael]140-rachael returned ; and with [[her]140-rachael party]2379-her party there was [a surgeon]2380-a surgeon , who brought some wine and medicines . But , the expectation among [the people]307-the people that [the man]3010-the man would be found alive was very slight indeed . There being now [people enough present to impede the work]2383-people enough present to impede the work , [the sobered man]2384-the sobered man put [himself]2384-the sobered man at the head of the rest , or was put there by the general consent , and made a large ring round [the Old Hell Shaft]55-the old hell shaft , and appointed [men to keep it]2385-men to keep it . [Besides such volunteers as were accepted to work]2386-besides such volunteers as were accepted to work , only [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]140-rachael were at first permitted within this ring ; but , later in the day , when the message brought an express from [Coketown]4-coketown , [Mr. Gradgrind and Louisa]218-louisa , and [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , and [the whelp]1268-the whelp , were also [there]412-there . The sun was four hours lower than when [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]140-rachael had first sat down upon the grass , before a means of enabling [two men]2360-two men to descend securely was rigged with poles and ropes . Difficulties had arisen in the construction of this machine , simple as it was ; requisites had been found wanting , and messages had had to go and return . It was five o’clock in the afternoon of the bright autumnal Sunday , before a candle was sent down to try the air , while [three or four rough faces]2390-three or four rough faces stood crowded close together , attentively watching it : [the man at the windlass]2391-the man at the windlass lowering as [they]2390-three or four rough faces were told . The candle was brought up again , feebly burning , and then some water was cast in . Then the bucket was hooked on ; and [the sobered man]2384-the sobered man and [another]2393-another got in with lights , giving the word ‘ Lower away ! ’[2393-another] As the rope went out , tight and strained , and the windlass creaked , there was not a breath among [the one or two hundred men]2394-the one or two hundred men and [women looking on]2395-women looking on , that came as it was wo nt to come . The signal was given and the windlass stopped , with abundant rope to spare . Apparently so long an interval ensued with [the men at the windlass]2396-the men at the windlass standing idle , that [some women]2397-some women shrieked that another accident had happened ! But [the surgeon who held the watch]2398-the surgeon who held the watch , declared five minutes not to have elapsed yet , and sternly admonished [them]2396-the men at the windlass to keep silence . [He]2398-the surgeon who held the watch had not well done speaking , when the windlass was reversed and worked again . [Practised eyes]219-practised eyes knew that it did not go as heavily as it would if [both workmen]2399-both workmen had been coming up , and that [only one]2400-only one was returning . The rope came in tight and strained ; and ring after ring was coiled upon the barrel of the windlass , and all eyes were fastened on the pit . [The sobered man]2384-the sobered man was brought up and leaped out briskly on the grass . There was an universal cry of ‘ Alive or dead ? ’[2384-the sobered man] and then a deep , profound hush . When [he]2384-the sobered man said ‘ Alive ! ’[2384-the sobered man] a great shout arose and many eyes had tears in them . ‘ But [he]2384-the sobered man ’s hurt very bad , ’[2384-the sobered man] [he]2384-the sobered man added , as soon as [he]2384-the sobered man could make [himself]2384-the sobered man heard again . ‘ Where ’s [doctor]4906-doctor ? [He]2384-the sobered man ’s hurt so very bad , [sir]2713-sir , that [we]2396-the men at the windlass donno how to get [him]2384-the sobered man up . ’[2384-the sobered man] [They]2396-the men at the windlass all consulted together , and looked anxiously at [the surgeon]2402-the surgeon , as [he]2402-the surgeon asked some questions , and shook [his]2402-the surgeon head on receiving the replies . The sun was setting now ; and the red light in the evening sky touched every face there , and caused it to be distinctly seen in all its rapt suspense . The consultation ended in [the men]549-the men returning to the windlass , and [the pitman]2404-the pitman going down again , carrying the wine and some other small matters with [him]2404-the pitman . Then [the other man]2405-the other man came up . In the meantime , under [the surgeon]2402-the surgeon ’s directions , [some men]2407-some men brought a hurdle , on which [others]671-others made a thick bed of spare clothes covered with loose straw , while [he]2404-the pitman [himself]2404-the pitman contrived some bandages and slings from shawls and handkerchiefs . As these were made , they were hung upon an arm of [the pitman who had last come up , with instructions how to use them]2409-the pitman who had last come up , with instructions how to use them : and as [he]2404-the pitman stood , shown by the light [he]2404-the pitman carried , leaning [his]2404-the pitman powerful loose hand upon one of the poles , and sometimes glancing down [the pit]2377-the pit , and sometimes glancing round upon [the people]307-the people , [he]2404-the pitman was not the least conspicuous figure in the scene . It was dark now , and torches were kindled . It appeared from the little [this man]2949-this man said to those about [him]2404-the pitman , which was quickly repeated all over the circle , that [the lost man]2370-the lost man had fallen upon a mass of crumbled rubbish with which [the pit]2377-the pit was half choked up , and that [his]2404-the pitman fall had been further broken by some jagged earth at the side . [He]2404-the pitman lay upon [his]2404-the pitman back with one arm doubled under [him]2404-the pitman , and according to [his]2404-the pitman own belief had hardly stirred since [he]2404-the pitman fell , except that [he]2404-the pitman had moved [his]2404-the pitman free hand to a side pocket , in which [he]2404-the pitman remembered to have some bread and meat ( of which [he]2404-the pitman had swallowed crumbs ) , and had likewise scooped up a little water in it now and then . [He]2404-the pitman had come straight away from [his]2404-the pitman work , on being written to , and had walked the whole journey ; and was on [his]2404-the pitman way to [[Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s country house]2415-mr. bounderby ’s country house after dark , when [he]2404-the pitman fell . [He]2404-the pitman was crossing [that dangerous country]2416-that dangerous country at such a dangerous time , because [he]2404-the pitman was innocent of what was laid to [his]2404-the pitman charge , and could n’t rest from coming the nearest way to deliver [himself]2404-the pitman up . [The Old Hell Shaft]2369-the old hell shaft , [the pitman]2404-the pitman said , with a curse upon it , was worthy of its bad name to the last ; for though [Stephen]137-stephen could speak now , [he]137-stephen believed it would soon be found to have mangled the life out of [him]137-stephen . When all was ready , [this man]2949-this man , still taking [his]2949-this man last hurried charges from [[his]2949-this man comrades]2420-his comrades and [the surgeon after the windlass]2421-the surgeon after the windlass had begun to lower [him]2949-this man , disappeared into [the pit]2377-the pit . The rope went out as before , the signal was made as before , and the windlass stopped . [No man]3980-no man removed [his]3980-no man hand from it now . [Every one]1571-every one waited with [his]1571-every one grasp set , and [his]1571-every one body bent down to the work , ready to reverse and wind in . At length the signal was given , and all the ring leaned forward . For , now , the rope came in , tightened and strained to its utmost as it appeared , and [the men]549-the men turned heavily , and the windlass complained . It was scarcely endurable to look at the rope , and think of its giving way . But , ring after ring was coiled upon the barrel of the windlass safely , and the connecting chains appeared , and finally the bucket with [the two men holding on at the sides]2426-the two men holding on at the sides — a sight to make the head swim , and oppress the heart — and tenderly supporting between [them]2426-the two men holding on at the sides , slung and tied within , the figure of [a poor , crushed , human creature]2427-a poor , crushed , human creature . A low murmur of pity went round [the throng]2428-the throng , and [the women]550-the women wept aloud , as this form , almost without form , was moved very slowly from its iron deliverance , and laid upon the bed of straw . At first , [none but [the surgeon]2402-the surgeon]2430-none but the surgeon went close to it . [He]2402-the surgeon did what [he]2402-the surgeon could in its adjustment on the couch , but the best that [he]2402-the surgeon could do was to cover it . That gently done , [he]2402-the surgeon called to [him]2402-the surgeon [Rachael]140-rachael and [Sissy]76-sissy . And at that time [the pale , worn , patient face]2432-the pale , worn , patient face was seen looking up at the sky , with the broken right hand lying bare on the outside of the covering garments , as if waiting to be taken by another hand . [They]2433-they gave [him]1571-every one drink , moistened [his]1571-every one face with water , and administered some drops of cordial and wine . Though [he]1571-every one lay quite motionless looking up at the sky , [he]1571-every one smiled and said , ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael . ’[1571-every one] [She]2434-she stooped down on the grass at [his]1571-every one side , and bent over [him]1571-every one until [her]2434-she eyes were between [his]1571-every one and the sky , for [he]1571-every one could not so much as turn them to look at [her]2434-she . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , [[my]2434-she dear]3090-my dear . ’[2434-she] [She]2434-she took [his]1571-every one hand . [He]1571-every one smiled again and said , ‘ Do n’t let ’[1571-every one] t go . ’ ‘[1571-every one] [Thou’rt]2435-thou’rt in great pain , [[my]0-i own dear]2436-my own dear [Stephen]137-stephen ? ’ ‘[137-stephen] [I]0-i ha ’ been , but not now . [I]137-stephen ha ’[137-stephen] been — dreadful , and dree , and long , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear — but ’ tis ower now . Ah , [Rachael]140-rachael , aw a muddle ! Fro ’[137-stephen] first to last , a muddle ! ’ The spectre of [his]137-stephen old look seemed to pass as [he]137-stephen said the word . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ha ’ fell into [th ’[0-i] pit]4909-th ’ pit , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , as have cost [wi’in]2439-wi’in the knowledge o ’ old fok now livin , [hundreds and hundreds o ’[0-i] men]4910-hundreds and hundreds o ’ men ’s lives — [fathers]2440-fathers , [sons]2441-sons , [brothers]3937-brothers , dear to [thousands an ’ thousands]4911-thousands an ’ thousands , an ’[4911-thousands an ’ thousands] keeping ’em fro ’[4911-thousands an ’ thousands] want and hunger . [I]0-i ha ’ fell into [a pit that ha ’[4911-thousands an ’ thousands] been wi ’ th ’[4911-thousands an ’ thousands] Firedamp crueller than battle]4912-a pit that ha ’ been wi ’ th ’ firedamp crueller than battle . [I]0-i ha ’ read on ’[0-i] t in the public petition , as onny one may read , fro ’ [the men that works in [pits]4895-pits]4913-the men that works in pits , in which [they]2443-the lawmakers ha ’[0-i] pray’n and pray’n [the lawmakers]2443-the lawmakers for Christ ’s sake not to let [their]2443-the lawmakers work be murder to [’em]4915-’em , but to spare ’em[0-i] for [th ’ wives]4916-th ’ wives and children that [they]2443-the lawmakers loves as well as [gentlefok]4917-gentlefok loves [theirs]2443-the lawmakers . When it were in work , it killed wi’out need ; when ’[0-i] tis let alone , it kills wi’out need . See how [we]2444-we die an ’ no need , one way an ’[2445-thou] another — in a muddle — every day ! ’ [He]0-i faintly said it , without any anger against [any one]2994-any one . Merely as the truth . ‘[2445-thou] [[Thy]2445-thou little sister]1001-thy little sister , [Rachael]140-rachael , [thou]2445-thou hast not forgot [her]1001-thy little sister . A muddle ! Aw a muddle ! ’[218-louisa] [Louisa]218-louisa approached [him]0-i ; but [he]0-i could not see [her]1001-thy little sister , lying with [his]0-i face turned up to the night sky . ‘ If aw th ’[1001-thy little sister] things that tooches [us]2448-us , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , was not so muddled , [I]0-i should’n [ha]2450-ha ’ had’n need to coom heer . If [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby had ever know’d [me]4922-workin ’ brothers right — if [he]0-i ’d ever know’d [me]4922-workin ’ brothers at aw — [he]0-i would’n [ha]2450-ha ’[4922-workin ’ brothers] took’n offence wi ’ [me]4922-workin ’ brothers .
