Look aboove ! ’ Following [his]2454-he eyes , [she]140-rachael saw that [he]2454-he was gazing at a star . [ Picture : [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen recovered from [the Old Hell Shaft]2369-the old hell shaft ] ‘[2453-it] [It]2453-it ha ’ shined upon [me]2454-he , ’[2454-he] [he]2454-he said reverently , ‘ in [my]2454-he pain and trouble down below . It ha ’[2454-he] shined into [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i ha ’ look’n at ’[2452-i] t and thowt o ’ [thee]140-rachael , [Rachael]140-rachael , till the muddle in [my]2452-i mind have cleared awa , above a bit , [I]2452-i hope . If soom [ha]2450-ha ’[2452-i] been wantin ’ in unnerstan’in [me]2452-i better , [I]2452-i , too , [ha]2450-ha ’[2452-i] been wantin ’ in unnerstan’in [them]4924-them better . When [I]2452-i got [thy]140-rachael letter , [I]2452-i easily believen that what [the yoong ledy sen]4925-the yoong ledy sen and done to [me]2452-i , and what [[her]2455-her brother]2889-her brother sen and done to [me]2452-i , was one , and that there were a wicked plot betwixt ’em[2452-i] . When [I]0-i fell , [I]0-i were in anger wi ’ [her]2455-her , an ’[2457-ha] hurryin on t ’ be as onjust t ’[2457-ha] [her]2455-her as oothers was t ’ [me]218-louisa . But in [our]4927-our judgments , like as in [our]4927-our doins , [we]4927-our mun bear and forbear . In [my]218-louisa pain an ’[218-louisa] trouble , lookin up [yonder,—wi]2456-yonder,—wi ’ it shinin on [me]0-i — [I]0-i ha ’[0-i] seen more clear , and [ha]2457-ha ’ made it [my]0-i dyin prayer that aw th ’[0-i] world may on’y coom toogether more , an ’ get [a better unnerstan’in o ’[2457-ha] one another]4928-a better unnerstan’in o ’ one another , than when [I]0-i were in ’ t [[my]218-louisa own weak seln]4929-my own weak seln . ’[218-louisa] [Louisa]218-louisa hearing what [he]0-i said , bent over [him]0-i on the opposite side to [Rachael]140-rachael , so that [he]0-i could see [her]140-rachael . ‘ [You]218-louisa ha ’[218-louisa] heard ? ’ [he]0-i said , after a few moments ’[218-louisa] silence . ‘ [I]218-louisa ha ’[218-louisa] not forgot [you]218-louisa , [ledy]2458-ledy . ’ ‘[218-louisa] Yes , [Stephen]137-stephen , [I]0-i have heard [you]137-stephen . And [your]137-stephen prayer is [mine]0-i . ’ ‘[218-louisa] [You]218-louisa ha ’ [a father]4930-a father . Will [yo]137-stephen tak ’[218-louisa] a message to [him]0-i ? ’ ‘[0-i] [He]0-i is here , ’ said [Louisa]218-louisa , with dread . ‘[0-i] Shall [I]0-i bring [him]0-i to [you]137-stephen ? ’ ‘[137-stephen] If [yo]137-stephen please . ’ [Louisa]218-louisa returned with [[her]4931-her father]335-her father . Standing hand - in - hand , [they]4933-they both looked down upon the solemn countenance . ‘[137-stephen] [Sir]2713-sir , [yo]137-stephen will clear [me]0-i an ’ mak [my]137-stephen name good wi ’[137-stephen] [aw men]2460-aw men . This [I]0-i leave to [yo]137-stephen . ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa was troubled and asked how ? ‘[0-i] [Sir]2713-sir , ’ was the reply : ‘[2713-sir] [yor son]2462-yor son will tell [yo]137-stephen how . Ask [him]0-i . [I]0-i mak no charges : [I]0-i leave none ahint [me]0-i : not a single word . [I]0-i ha ’ seen an ’[137-stephen] spok’n wi ’ [yor son]2462-yor son , one night . [I]137-stephen ask no more o ’[137-stephen] [yo]137-stephen than that [yo]137-stephen clear [me]0-i — an ’ [I]137-stephen trust to [yo]137-stephen to do ’[137-stephen] t. ’ [The bearers]4935-the bearers being now ready to carry [him]0-i away , and [the surgeon]2402-the surgeon being anxious for [his]0-i removal , [those who had torches or lanterns]4937-those who had torches or lanterns , prepared to go in front of the litter . Before it was raised , and while [they]4935-the bearers were arranging how to go , [he]0-i said to [Rachael]140-rachael , looking upward at the star : ‘[0-i] Often as [I]0-i coom to [myseln]2463-myseln , and found it shinin ’ on [me]2464-my down there in [my]2464-my trouble , [I]2464-my thowt it were the star as guided to [[[Our]2464-my Saviour]4938-our saviour ’s home]4939-our saviour ’s home . [I]2464-my awmust think it be the very star ! ’[2464-my] [They]2464-my lifted [him]0-i up , and [he]0-i was overjoyed to find that [they]2464-my were about to take [him]0-i in the direction whither the star seemed to [him]0-i to lead . ‘ [Rachael]140-rachael , [beloved lass]4940-beloved lass ! Do n’t let go [my]2464-my hand . [We]2464-my may walk toogether t’night , [[my]2464-my dear]3090-my dear ! ’[2464-my] ‘ [I]140-rachael will hold [thy]0-i hand , and keep beside [thee]0-i , [Stephen]137-stephen , all the way . ’[140-rachael] ‘ Bless [thee]0-i ! Will soombody be pleased to coover [my]2464-my face ! ’[2464-my] [They]2464-my carried [him]0-i very gently along [the fields]4889-the fields , and down [the lanes]1915-the lanes , and over [the wide landscape]2347-the wide landscape ; [Rachael]140-rachael always holding the hand in [hers]140-rachael . Very few whispers broke the mournful silence . It was soon a funeral procession . The star had shown [him]0-i where to find [the God of [the poor]4099-the poor]2468-the god of the poor ; and through humility , and sorrow , and forgiveness , [he]0-i had gone to [[his]0-i Redeemer]2470-his redeemer ’s rest . CHAPTER VII WHELP - HUNTING BEFORE the ring formed round [the Old Hell Shaft]2369-the old hell shaft was broken , [one figure]2472-one figure had disappeared from within it . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby and [his]92-mr. bounderby shadow had not stood near [Louisa]218-louisa , who held [[her]2473-her father]335-her father ’s arm , but in a retired place by [themselves]2464-my . When [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa was summoned to [the couch]2475-the couch , [Sissy]76-sissy , attentive to all that happened , slipped behind that wicked shadow — a sight in the horror of [his]92-mr. bounderby face , if there had been eyes there for any sight but one — and whispered in [his]92-mr. bounderby ear . Without turning [his]92-mr. bounderby head , [he]92-mr. bounderby conferred with [her]76-sissy a few moments , and vanished . Thus [the whelp]1268-the whelp had gone out of the circle before [the people]307-the people moved . When [the father]426-the father reached [home]336-home , [he]426-the father sent a message to [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s , desiring [[his]426-the father son]3997-his son to come to [him]426-the father directly . The reply was , that [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby having missed [him]3997-his son in [the crowd]4465-the crowd , and seeing nothing of [him]3997-his son since , had supposed [him]3997-his son to be at [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge . ‘ [I]218-louisa believe , [father]2723-father , ’[218-louisa] said [Louisa]218-louisa , ‘ [he]92-mr. bounderby will not come back to [town]427-town to - night . ’[218-louisa] [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa turned away , and said no more . In the morning , [he]218-louisa went down to [the Bank]3460-the bank [himself]218-louisa as soon as it was opened , and seeing [[his]426-the father son]3997-his son ’s place empty ( [he]218-louisa had not the courage to look in at first ) went back along [the street]448-the street to meet [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby on [his]92-mr. bounderby way [there]412-there . To whom [he]218-louisa said that , for reasons [he]218-louisa would soon explain , but entreated not then to be asked for , [he]218-louisa had found it necessary to employ [[his]426-the father son]3997-his son at a distance for a little while . Also , that [he]218-louisa was charged with the duty of vindicating [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen ’s memory , and declaring [the thief]4789-the thief . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby quite confounded , stood stock - still in [the street]448-the street after [[his]92-mr. bounderby father - in - law]2113-his father - in - law had left [him]92-mr. bounderby , swelling like an immense soap - bubble , without its beauty . [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa went [home]336-home , locked [himself]218-louisa in [[his]218-louisa room]3401-his room , and kept it all that day . When [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]218-louisa tapped at [his]218-louisa door , [he]218-louisa said , without opening it , ‘ Not now , [[my]218-louisa dears]4944-my dears ; in the evening . ’[218-louisa] On [their]2492-their return in the evening , [he]218-louisa said , ‘ [I]218-louisa am not able yet — to - morrow . ’[218-louisa] [He]218-louisa ate nothing all day , and had no candle after dark ; and [they]2492-their heard [him]218-louisa walking to and fro late at night . But , in the morning [he]218-louisa appeared at breakfast at the usual hour , and took [his]218-louisa usual place at the table . Aged and bent [he]218-louisa looked , and quite bowed down ; and yet [he]218-louisa looked [a wiser man]2493-a wiser man , and [a better man]2494-a better man , than in the days when in this life [he]218-louisa wanted nothing — but Facts . Before [he]218-louisa left [the room]2859-the room , [he]218-louisa appointed a time for [them]2492-their to come to [him]218-louisa ; and so , with [his]218-louisa gray head drooping , went away . ‘ [Dear father]4945-dear father , ’[218-louisa] said [Louisa]218-louisa , when [they]2492-their kept [their]2492-their appointment , ‘ [you]4945-dear father have [three young children]4946-three young children left . [They]4946-three young children will be different , [I]2496-i will be different yet , with [Heaven]80-heaven ’s help . ’[2496-i] [She]2496-i gave [her]2496-i hand to [Sissy]76-sissy , as if [she]2496-i meant with [her]2496-i help too . ‘ [[Your]218-louisa wretched brother]4947-your wretched brother , ’[218-louisa] said [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa . ‘ Do [you]218-louisa think [he]4947-your wretched brother had planned this robbery , when [he]4947-your wretched brother went with [you]218-louisa to [the lodging]4948-the lodging ? ’[218-louisa] ‘ [I]2496-i fear so , [father]2723-father . [I]2496-i know [he]4947-your wretched brother had wanted money very much , and had spent a great deal . ’[2496-i] ‘ [The poor man]1441-the poor man being about to leave [the town]317-the town , it came into [his]4947-your wretched brother evil brain to cast suspicion on [him]4947-your wretched brother ? ’[218-louisa] ‘ [I]218-louisa think it must have flashed upon [him]4947-your wretched brother while [he]4947-your wretched brother sat there , [father]2723-father . For [I]218-louisa asked [him]4947-your wretched brother to go [there]412-there with [me]218-louisa . The visit did not originate with [him]4947-your wretched brother . ’[218-louisa] ‘ [He]4947-your wretched brother had some conversation with [the poor man]1441-the poor man . Did [he]4947-your wretched brother take [him]4947-your wretched brother aside ? ’[2496-i] ‘ [He]4947-your wretched brother took [him]4947-your wretched brother out of [the room]2859-the room . [I]218-louisa asked [him]4947-your wretched brother afterwards , why [he]4947-your wretched brother had done so , and [he]4947-your wretched brother made a plausible excuse ; but since last night , [father]2723-father , and when [I]218-louisa remember the circumstances by its light , [I]218-louisa am afraid [I]218-louisa can imagine too truly what passed between [them]4957-them . ’[218-louisa] ‘ Let [me]335-her father know , ’[335-her father] said [[her]2497-her father]335-her father , ‘ if [your]218-louisa thoughts present [[your]218-louisa guilty brother]4958-your guilty brother in the same dark view as [mine]335-her father . ’[335-her father] ‘ [I]218-louisa fear , [father]2723-father , ’[218-louisa] hesitated [Louisa]218-louisa , ‘ that [he]4947-your wretched brother must have made some representation to [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen — perhaps in [my]218-louisa name , perhaps in [his]4947-your wretched brother own — which induced [him]4947-your wretched brother to do in good faith and honesty , what [he]4947-your wretched brother had never done before , and to wait about the Bank those two or three nights before [he]4947-your wretched brother left [the town]317-the town . ’[218-louisa] ‘ Too plain ! ’[426-the father] returned [the father]426-the father . ‘ Too plain ! ’[426-the father] [He]426-the father shaded [his]426-the father face , and remained silent for some moments . Recovering [himself]426-the father , [he]426-the father said : ‘ And now , how is [he]4947-your wretched brother to be found ? How is [he]4947-your wretched brother to be saved from justice ? In the few hours that [I]426-the father can possibly allow to elapse before [I]426-the father publish the truth , how is [he]4947-your wretched brother to be found by [us]4961-us , and only by [us]4961-us ? Ten thousand pounds could not effect it . ’[426-the father] ‘ [Sissy]76-sissy has effected it , [father]2723-father . ’[426-the father] [He]426-the father raised [his]426-the father eyes to where [she]2500-she stood , like [a good fairy in [[his]426-the father house]4003-his house]2501-a good fairy in his house , and said in a tone of softened gratitude and grateful kindness , ‘ It is always [you]2500-she , [[my]426-the father child]1047-my child ! ’[426-the father] ‘ [We]4961-us had [our]4961-us fears , ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy explained , glancing at [Louisa]218-louisa , ‘ before yesterday ; and when [I]76-sissy saw [you]218-louisa brought to the side of the litter last night , and heard what passed ( being close to [Rachael]140-rachael all the time ) , [I]76-sissy went to [him]426-the father when [no one]545-no one saw , and said to [him]426-the father , “ Do n’t look at [me]76-sissy . See where [[your]426-the father father]2725-your father is . Escape at once , for [his]2725-your father sake and [your]426-the father own ! ” [He]426-the father was in a tremble before [I]76-sissy whispered to [him]426-the father , and [he]426-the father started and trembled more then , and said , “ Where can [I]76-sissy go ? [I]76-sissy have very little money , and [I]76-sissy do n’t know who will hide [me]76-sissy ! ” [I]76-sissy thought of [[father]2723-father ’s old circus]4967-father ’s old circus . [I]76-sissy have not forgotten where [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary goes at this time of year , and [I]76-sissy read of [him]87-mr. sleary in a paper only the other day . [I]76-sissy told [him]87-mr. sleary to hurry there , and tell [his]87-mr. sleary name , and ask [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary to hide [him]87-mr. sleary till [I]76-sissy came . “ [I]76-sissy ’ll get to [him]87-mr. sleary before the morning , ” [he]2503-he said . And [I]76-sissy saw [him]87-mr. sleary shrink away among [the people]307-the people . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Thank [Heaven]80-heaven ! ’[494-his father] exclaimed [[his]2503-he father]494-his father . ‘ [He]87-mr. sleary may be got abroad yet . ’[494-his father] It was the more hopeful as [the town to which [Sissy]76-sissy had directed [him]2503-he]2505-the town to which sissy had directed him was within three hours ’ journey of [Liverpool]56-liverpool , whence [he]2503-he could be swiftly dispatched to [any part of [the world]2766-the world]4969-any part of the world . But , caution being necessary in communicating with [him]2503-he — for there was a greater danger every moment of [his]2503-he being suspected now , and [nobody]353-nobody could be sure at heart but that [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby [himself]92-mr. bounderby , in a bullying vein of public zeal , might play a Roman part — it was consented that [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]218-louisa should repair to [the place in question]4972-the place in question , by a circuitous course , alone ; and that [the unhappy father]4973-the unhappy father , setting forth in an opposite direction , should get round to the same bourne by another and wider route . It was further agreed that [he]92-mr. bounderby should not present [himself]92-mr. bounderby to [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , lest [his]92-mr. bounderby intentions should be mistrusted , or the intelligence of [his]92-mr. bounderby arrival should cause [[his]92-mr. bounderby son]3997-his son to take flight anew ; but , that the communication should be left to [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]218-louisa to open ; and that [they]4975-they should inform the cause of so much misery and disgrace , of [[his]3997-his son father]494-his father ’s being at hand and of the purpose for which [they]4975-they had come . When these arrangements had been well considered and were fully understood by [all three]4977-all three , it was time to begin to carry [them]4975-they into execution . Early in the afternoon , [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa walked direct from [[his]218-louisa own house]1079-his own house into [the country]2802-the country , to be taken up on the line by which [he]218-louisa was to travel ; and at night [the remaining two]4980-the remaining two set forth upon [their]4980-the remaining two different course , encouraged by not seeing any face [they]4980-the remaining two knew . [The two]3259-the two travelled all night , except when [they]3259-the two were left , for odd numbers of minutes , at [branch - places]4982-branch - places , up illimitable flights of steps , or down [wells]4983-wells — which was the only variety of those branches — and , early in the morning , were turned out on [a swamp]4984-a swamp , a mile or two from [the town]317-the town [they]3259-the two sought . From [this dismal spot]4986-this dismal spot [they]3259-the two were rescued by [a savage old postilion , who happened to be up early , kicking a horse in a fly]4987-a savage old postilion , who happened to be up early , kicking a horse in a fly : and so were smuggled into [the town]317-the town by all [the back lanes where the pigs lived]4989-the back lanes where the pigs lived : which , although not a magnificent or even savoury approach , was , as is usual in such cases , [the legitimate highway]4990-the legitimate highway . The first thing [they]3259-the two saw on entering [the town]317-the town was the skeleton of [[Sleary]87-mr. sleary ’s Circus]4992-sleary ’s circus . [The company]570-the company had departed for [another town]4994-another town more than twenty miles off , and had opened [there]412-there last night . The connection between [the two places]4996-the two places was by [a hilly turnpike - road]4997-a hilly turnpike - road , and the travelling on [that road]4998-that road was very slow . Though [they]3259-the two took but a hasty breakfast , and no rest ( which it would have been in vain to seek under such anxious circumstances ) , it was noon before [they]3259-the two began to find the bills of [Sleary]87-mr. sleary ’s Horse - riding on [barns]4999-barns and walls , and one o’clock when [they]3259-the two stopped in [the market - place]5000-the market - place . A Grand Morning Performance by [the Riders]5001-the riders , commencing at that very hour , was in course of announcement by [the bellman]5002-the bellman as [they]3259-the two set [their]3259-the two feet upon the stones of [the street]448-the street . [Sissy]76-sissy recommended that , to avoid making inquiries and attracting attention in [the town]317-the town , [they]3259-the two should present [themselves]3259-the two to pay at the door . If [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary were taking the money , [he]87-mr. sleary would be sure to know [her]5005-her , and would proceed with discretion . If [he]87-mr. sleary were not , [he]87-mr. sleary would be sure to see [them]3259-the two inside ; and , knowing what [he]87-mr. sleary had done with [the fugitive]5006-the fugitive , would proceed with discretion still . Therefore , [they]3259-the two repaired , with fluttering hearts , to the well - remembered booth . The flag with the inscription [SLEARY]87-mr. sleary ’S[76-sissy] HORSE - RIDING was [there]412-there ; and [the Gothic niche]2507-the gothic niche was there ; but [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary was not [there]412-there . [Master Kidderminster]109-master kidderminster , grown too maturely turfy to be received by the wildest credulity as [Cupid]108-cupid any more , had yielded to the invincible force of circumstances ( and [his]109-master kidderminster beard ) , and , in the capacity of [a man who made [himself]109-master kidderminster generally useful]2509-a man who made himself generally useful , presided on this occasion over the exchequer — having also a drum in reserve , on which to expend [his]109-master kidderminster leisure moments and superfluous forces . In the extreme sharpness of [his]109-master kidderminster look out for base coin , [Mr. Kidderminster]109-master kidderminster , as at present situated , never saw anything but money ; so [Sissy]76-sissy passed [him]109-master kidderminster unrecognised , and [they]2510-they went in . [The Emperor of [Japan]57-japan]2511-the emperor of japan , on a steady old white horse stencilled with black spots , was twirling five wash - hand basins at once , as it is the favourite recreation of [that monarch]2512-that monarch to do . [Sissy]76-sissy , though well acquainted with [his]109-master kidderminster Royal line , had no personal knowledge of [the present Emperor]2513-the present emperor , and [his]2513-the present emperor reign was peaceful . [Miss Josephine Sleary]88-josephine , in [her]88-josephine celebrated graceful Equestrian Tyrolean Flower Act , was then announced by [a new clown]2514-a new clown ( who humorously said Cauliflower Act ) , and [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary appeared , leading [her]88-josephine in . [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary had only made one cut at [the Clown]2515-the clown with [his]87-mr. sleary long whip - lash , and [the Clown]2515-the clown had only said , ‘ If [you]76-sissy do it again , [I]2515-the clown ’ll throw the horse at [you]76-sissy ! ’[2515-the clown] when [Sissy]76-sissy was recognised both by [father]2723-father and [daughter]3470-daughter . But [they]2519-they got through the Act with great self - possession ; and [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , saving for the first instant , conveyed no more expression into [his]87-mr. sleary locomotive eye than into [his]87-mr. sleary fixed one . The performance seemed a little long to [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]218-louisa , particularly when it stopped to afford [the Clown]2515-the clown an opportunity of telling [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary ( who said ‘ Indeed , [sir]2713-sir ! ’[87-mr. sleary] to all [his]87-mr. sleary observations in the calmest way , and with [his]87-mr. sleary eye on [the house]2875-the house ) about two legs sitting on three legs looking at one leg , when in came four legs , and laid hold of one leg , and up got two legs , caught hold of three legs , and threw [’em]5008-’em at four legs , who ran away with one leg . For , although an ingenious Allegory relating to [a butcher]5009-a butcher , a three - legged stool , a dog , and a leg of mutton , this narrative consumed time ; and [they]2519-they were in great suspense . At last , however , [little fair - haired Josephine]88-josephine made [her]88-josephine curtsey amid great applause ; and [the Clown , left alone in the ring]5010-the clown , left alone in the ring , had just warmed [himself]2515-the clown , and said , ‘[87-mr. sleary] Now _ [I_’ll]2515-the clown have a turn ! ’ when [Sissy]76-sissy was touched on the shoulder , and beckoned out . [She]76-sissy took [Louisa]218-louisa with [her]76-sissy ; and [they]2519-they were received by [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary in [a very little private apartment]5011-a very little private apartment , with canvas sides , a grass floor , and a wooden ceiling all aslant , on which [the box company]5012-the box company stamped [their]5012-the box company approbation , as if [they]5012-the box company were coming through . ‘[117-thethilia] [Thethilia]117-thethilia , ’ said [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , who had brandy and water at hand , ‘[117-thethilia] it doth [me]0-i good to [thee]2522-you [you]2522-you . [You]2522-you wath alwayth a favourite with [uth]2523-uth , and [you]2522-you ’ve done uth credith thinth the old timeth [I]0-i ’m thure . [You]2522-you mutht [thee]2522-you [[our]5013-our people]2977-our people , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , afore [we]5013-our thpeak of [bithnith]58-bithnith , or [they]2977-our people ’ll break [their]2977-our people hearth — ethpethially [the women]550-the women . [Here’th Jothphine]220-here’th jothphine hath been and got married to [E. W. B. Childerth]221-childerth , and [thee]2522-you hath got [a boy]655-a boy , and though [he’th]655-a boy only three yearth old , [he]655-a boy thtickth on to any pony [you]2522-you can bring againtht [him]655-a boy . [He’th]655-a boy named The Little Wonder of Thcolathtic Equitation ; and if [you]2522-you do n’t hear of [that boy]3137-that boy at [Athley’th]59-athley’th , [you]2522-you ’ll hear of [him]655-a boy at [Parith]60-parith . And [you]2522-you recollect [Kidderminthter]5019-kidderminthter , that wath thought to be rather thweet upon [yourthelf]5020-yourthelf ? Well . [He’th]655-a boy married too . Married [a widder]5021-a widder . Old enough to be hith [mother]3242-mother . [Thee]2525-you wath Tightrope , [thee]2525-you wath , and now [thee’th]2525-you nothing — on accounth of fat . [They]5023-they ’ve got [two children]5024-two children , tho [we]2526-we ’re[0-i] thtrong in the Fairy bithnith and [the Nurthery dodge]2524-the nurthery dodge . If [you]2525-you wath to [thee]2525-you [[our]2526-we Children]2527-our children in [the Wood]2528-the wood , with [[their]2527-our children father]311-their father and [mother]3242-mother both a dyin ’ on a horthe — [[their]2527-our children uncle]5025-their uncle a retheiving of [’em]5026-’em[2525-you] ath hith wardth , upon a horthe — themthelvth both a goin’ a black - berryin ’ on a horthe — and [the Robinth]222-the robinth a coming in to cover ’em[2525-you] with leavth , upon a horthe — [you’d]2525-you thay it wath the completetht thing ath ever [you]2525-you thet [your]2525-you eyeth on ! And [you]2525-you remember [Emma Gordon]118-emma gordon , [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , ath wath a’motht [a mother to [you]2525-you]2532-a mother to you ? Of courthe [you]2525-you do ; [I]0-i need n’t athk . Well ! [Emma]118-emma gordon , [thee]118-emma gordon lotht [[her]2533-her huthband]2534-her huthband . [He]2535-he wath throw’d a heavy back - fall off a Elephant in a thort of a Pagoda thing ath [the Thultan of [the Indieth]61-the indieth]2536-the thultan of the indieth , and [he]2535-he never got the better of it ; and [thee]118-emma gordon married a thecond time — married [a Cheethemonger]223-a cheethemonger [ath]2537-ath fell in love with [her]2533-her from the front — and [he’th]2538-he’th [a Overtheer and makin ’ a fortun]5027-a overtheer and makin ’ a fortun . ’[2538-he’th] These various changes , [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , very short of breath now , related with great heartiness , and with a wonderful kind of innocence , considering what [a bleary and brandy - and - watery old veteran]2539-a bleary and brandy - and - watery old veteran [he]87-mr. sleary was . Afterwards [he]87-mr. sleary brought in [Josephine]88-josephine , and [E. W. B. Childers]107-mr. childers ( rather deeply lined in the jaws by daylight ) , and [the Little Wonder of Scholastic Equitation]2540-the little wonder of scholastic equitation , and in a word , [all the company]2541-all the company . [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa arrived within an hour afterwards . [He]218-louisa too had encountered [no one whom [he]218-louisa knew]2551-no one whom he knew ; and was now sanguine with [Sleary]87-mr. sleary ’s assistance , of getting [[his]218-louisa disgraced son]2552-his disgraced son to [Liverpool]56-liverpool in the night . As [neither of [the three]4098-the three]2553-neither of the three could be [[his]87-mr. sleary companion]1292-his companion without almost identifying [him]87-mr. sleary under any disguise , [he]87-mr. sleary prepared a letter to [a correspondent whom [he]87-mr. sleary could trust]2556-a correspondent whom he could trust , beseeching [him]2556-a correspondent whom he could trust to ship [the bearer]2557-the bearer off at any cost , to [North]62-north or [South America]63-south america , or [any distant part of [the world]2766-the world to which [he]87-mr. sleary could be the most speedily and privately dispatched]2558-any distant part of the world to which he could be the most speedily and privately dispatched . This done , [they]2560-they walked about , waiting for [the Circus]394-the circus to be quite vacated ; not only by [the audience]3969-the audience , but by [the company]570-the company and by the horses . After watching it a long time , [they]2560-they saw [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary bring out a chair and sit down by the side - door , smoking ; as if that were [his]87-mr. sleary signal that [they]2560-they might approach . ‘ [Your]5054-you thervant , Thquire , ’[87-mr. sleary] was [his]87-mr. sleary cautious salutation as [they]2560-they passed in . ‘ If [you]5054-you want [me]87-mr. sleary [you]5054-you ’ll find [me]87-mr. sleary here . [You]5054-you muthn’t mind [your]5054-you thon having a comic livery on . ’[87-mr. sleary] [They]2560-they all three went in ; and [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa sat down forlorn , on [the Clown]2515-the clown ’s performing chair in the middle of the ring . On one of the back benches , remote in the subdued light and the strangeness of [the place]329-the place , sat [the villainous whelp]2566-the villainous whelp , sulky to [the last , whom [he]87-mr. sleary had the misery to call [[his]87-mr. sleary son]3997-his son]2567-the last , whom he had the misery to call his son . In a preposterous coat , like a beadle ’s , with cuffs and flaps exaggerated to an unspeakable extent ; in an immense waistcoat , knee - breeches , buckled shoes , and a mad cocked hat ; with nothing fitting [him]2566-the villainous whelp , and everything of coarse material , moth - eaten and full of holes ; with seams in [his]2566-the villainous whelp black face , where fear and heat had started through the greasy composition daubed all over it ; anything so grimly , detestably , ridiculously shameful as the whelp in [his]2566-the villainous whelp comic livery , [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa never could by any other means have believed in , weighable and measurable fact though it was . And [one of [[his]218-louisa model children]2570-his model children]2569-one of his model children had come to this ! At first [the whelp]1268-the whelp would not draw any nearer , but persisted in remaining up there by [himself]1268-the whelp . Yielding at length , if any concession so sullenly made can be called yielding , to the entreaties of [Sissy]76-sissy — for [Louisa]218-louisa [he]2566-the villainous whelp disowned altogether — [he]2566-the villainous whelp came down , bench by bench , until [he]2566-the villainous whelp stood in the sawdust , on the verge of the circle , as far as possible , within its limits from where [[his]3997-his son father]494-his father sat . ‘ How was this done ? ’[426-the father] asked [the father]426-the father . ‘ How was what done ? ’[2574-the son] moodily answered [the son]2574-the son . ‘ This robbery , ’[426-the father] said [the father]426-the father , raising [his]426-the father voice upon the word . ‘ [I]426-the father forced the safe [myself]426-the father over night , and shut it up ajar before [I]426-the father went away . [I]426-the father had had the key that was found , made long before . [I]426-the father dropped it that morning , that it might be supposed to have been used . [I]426-the father did n’t take the money all at once . [I]426-the father pretended to put [my]426-the father balance away every night , but [I]426-the father did n’t . Now [you]426-the father know all about it . ’[426-the father] ‘ If a thunderbolt had fallen on [me]426-the father , ’[426-the father] said [the father]426-the father , ‘ it would have shocked [me]426-the father less than this ! ’[426-the father] ‘ [I]2574-the son do n’t see why , ’[2574-the son] grumbled [the son]2574-the son . ‘ [So many people]5055-so many people are employed in situations of trust ; [so many people]5055-so many people , out of so many , will be dishonest . [I]2574-the son have heard [you]426-the father talk , a hundred times , of its being a law . How can _ [I]2574-the son _ help laws ? [You]426-the father have comforted [others]671-others with such things , [father]2723-father . Comfort [yourself]426-the father ! ’[2574-the son] [The father]426-the father buried [his]426-the father face in [his]426-the father hands , and [the son]2574-the son stood in [his]2574-the son disgraceful grotesqueness , biting straw : [his]2574-the son hands , with the black partly worn away inside , looking like the hands of a monkey . The evening was fast closing in ; and from time to time , [he]2574-the son turned the whites of [his]2574-the son eyes restlessly and impatiently towards [[his]2574-the son father]494-his father . They were the only parts of [his]2574-the son face that showed any life or expression , the pigment upon it was so thick . ‘ [You]2574-the son must be got to [Liverpool]56-liverpool , and sent abroad . ’[1268-the whelp] ‘ [I]1268-the whelp suppose [I]1268-the whelp must . That ’s one thing . ’[1268-the whelp] [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa went to the door , and returned with [Sleary]87-mr. sleary , to whom [he]218-louisa submitted the question , How to get this deplorable object away ? ‘ Why , [I]218-louisa ’ve been thinking of it , Thquire . [I]0-i ’ve never met with nothing but beer ath’ll ever clean a comic blackamoor . ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa rapidly assented ; [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary rapidly turned out from a box , a smock frock , a felt hat , and other essentials ; the whelp rapidly changed clothes behind a screen of baize ; [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary rapidly brought beer , and washed [him]87-mr. sleary white again . ‘[0-i] Now , ’ said [Sleary]87-mr. sleary , ‘[0-i] come along to the coath , and jump up behind ; [I]0-i ’ll go with [you]0-i there , and [they]2589-they ’ll thuppothe [you]0-i [one of [[my]0-i people]552-my people]2590-one of my people . Give [me]0-i [your]0-i hand , [[my]0-i poor boy]2594-my poor boy , and may [God]126-god forgive [you]0-i as [I]0-i do ! ’ [The culprit]5061-the culprit was moved to a few abject tears by these words and their pathetic tone . But , when [Louisa]218-louisa opened [her]5062-her arms , [he]0-i repulsed [her]5062-her afresh . ‘[0-i] Not [you]0-i . [They]2595-we all confusedly went out : [Louisa]218-louisa crying to [him]0-i that [she]5063-her forgave [him]0-i , and loved [him]0-i still , and that [he]0-i would one day be sorry to have left [her]5063-her so , and glad to think of these [her]5063-her last words , far away : when [some one]973-some one ran against [them]2595-we . [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy , who were both before [him]0-i while [[his]0-i sister]644-his sister yet clung to [his]0-i shoulder , stopped and recoiled . For , there was [Bitzer]77-bitzer , out of breath , [his]77-bitzer thin lips parted , [his]77-bitzer thin nostrils distended , [his]77-bitzer white eyelashes quivering , [his]77-bitzer colourless face more colourless than ever , as if [he]77-bitzer ran [himself]77-bitzer into a white heat , when [other people]4887-other people ran [themselves]4887-other people into a glow . There [he]77-bitzer stood , panting and heaving , as if [he]77-bitzer had never stopped since the night , now long ago , when [he]77-bitzer had run [them]4887-other people down before . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry to interfere with [your]5067-your plans , ’[77-bitzer] said [Bitzer]77-bitzer , shaking [his]77-bitzer head , ‘ but [I]77-bitzer ca n’t allow [myself]77-bitzer to be done by [horse - riders]5068-horse - riders . [I]77-bitzer must have [young Mr. Tom]75-tom ; [he]75-tom must n’t be got away by [horse - riders]5068-horse - riders ; here [he]75-tom is in a smock frock , and [I]77-bitzer must have [him]75-tom ! ’[77-bitzer] By the collar , too , it seemed . For , so [he]77-bitzer took possession of [him]77-bitzer . CHAPTER VIII PHILOSOPHICAL [THEY]2599-they went back into the booth , [Sleary]87-mr. sleary shutting the door to keep [intruders]2600-intruders out . [Bitzer]77-bitzer , still holding [the paralysed culprit by the collar]2601-the paralysed culprit by the collar , stood in the Ring , blinking at [[his]77-bitzer old patron]2602-his old patron through the darkness of the twilight . ‘ [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , broken down , and miserably submissive to [him]77-bitzer , ‘ have [you]77-bitzer a heart ? ’[75-tom] ‘ The circulation , [sir]2713-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer , smiling at the oddity of the question , ‘ could n’t be carried on without one . [No man]3980-no man , [sir]2713-sir , acquainted with the facts established by [Harvey]227-harvey relating to the circulation of the blood , can doubt that [I]77-bitzer have a heart . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ Is it accessible , ’[75-tom] cried [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘ to any compassionate influence ? ’[75-tom] ‘ It is accessible to Reason , [sir]2713-sir , ’[2603-the excellent young man] returned [the excellent young man]2603-the excellent young man . ‘ And to nothing else . ’[2599-they] [They]2599-they stood looking at [each other]2604-each other ; [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom ’s face as white as [the pursuer]2605-the pursuer ’s . ‘ What motive — even what motive in reason — can [you]2713-sir have for preventing the escape of [this wretched youth]5074-this wretched youth , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘ and crushing [[his]5074-this wretched youth miserable father]5075-his miserable father ? See [[his]5074-this wretched youth sister]644-his sister here . Pity [us]2599-they ! ’[75-tom] ‘ [Sir]2713-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer , in a very business - like and logical manner , ‘ since [you]2713-sir ask [me]77-bitzer what motive [I]77-bitzer have in reason , for taking [young Mr. Tom]75-tom back to [Coketown]4-coketown , it is only reasonable to let [you]2713-sir know . [I]77-bitzer have suspected [young Mr. Tom]75-tom of this bank - robbery from the first . [I]77-bitzer had had [my]77-bitzer eye upon [him]75-tom before that time , for [I]77-bitzer knew [his]75-tom ways . [I]77-bitzer have kept [my]77-bitzer observations to [myself]77-bitzer , but [I]77-bitzer have made them ; and [I]77-bitzer have got ample proofs against [him]75-tom now , besides [his]75-tom running away , and besides [his]75-tom own confession , which [I]77-bitzer was just in time to overhear . [I]77-bitzer had the pleasure of watching [[your]2713-sir house]5078-your house yesterday morning , and following [you]2713-sir here . [I]77-bitzer am going to take [young Mr. Tom]75-tom back to [Coketown]4-coketown , in order to deliver [him]75-tom over to [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . [Sir]2713-sir , [I]77-bitzer have no doubt whatever that [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby will then promote [me]77-bitzer to [young Mr. Tom]75-tom ’s situation . And [I]77-bitzer wish to have [his]75-tom situation , [sir]2713-sir , for it will be a rise to [me]77-bitzer , and will do [me]77-bitzer good . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ If this is solely a question of self - interest with [you]2713-sir — ’[75-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom began . ‘ [I]77-bitzer beg [your]2713-sir pardon for interrupting [you]2713-sir , [sir]2713-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer ; ‘ but [I]77-bitzer am sure [you]2713-sir know that the whole social system is a question of self - interest . What [you]2713-sir must always appeal to , is [a person]4282-a person ’s self - interest . It ’s [your]2713-sir only hold . [We]5083-we are so constituted . [I]77-bitzer was brought up in that catechism when [I]77-bitzer was very young , [sir]2713-sir , as [you]2713-sir are aware . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ What sum of money , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , ‘ will [you]2713-sir set against [your]2713-sir expected promotion ? ’[75-tom] ‘ Thank [you]2713-sir , [sir]2713-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ‘ for hinting at the proposal ; but [I]77-bitzer will not set any sum against it . Knowing that [[your]2713-sir clear head]5086-your clear head would propose that alternative , [I]77-bitzer have gone over the calculations in [my]77-bitzer mind ; and [I]77-bitzer find that to compound a felony , even on very high terms indeed , would not be as safe and good for [me]77-bitzer as [my]77-bitzer improved prospects in [the Bank]3460-the bank . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ’[75-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom , stretching out [his]75-tom hands as though [he]75-tom would have said , See how miserable [I]0-i am ! ‘ [Bitzer]77-bitzer , [I]75-tom have but one chance left to soften [you]77-bitzer . [You]77-bitzer were many years at [[my]75-tom school]4525-my school . If , in remembrance of the pains bestowed upon [you]77-bitzer [there]412-there , [you]77-bitzer can persuade [yourself]77-bitzer in any degree to disregard [your]77-bitzer present interest and release [[my]75-tom son]2332-my son , [I]75-tom entreat and pray [you]77-bitzer to give [him]2332-my son the benefit of that remembrance . ’[75-tom] ‘ [I]2606-the old pupil really wonder , [sir]2713-sir , ’[2606-the old pupil] rejoined [the old pupil]2606-the old pupil in an argumentative manner , ‘ to find [you]2713-sir taking a position so untenable . [My]2606-the old pupil schooling was paid for ; it was a bargain ; and when [I]2606-the old pupil came away , the bargain ended . ’[2606-the old pupil] It was a fundamental principle of the Gradgrind philosophy that everything was to be paid for . [Nobody]353-nobody was ever on any account to give [anybody]2845-anybody anything , or render [anybody]2845-anybody help without purchase . Gratitude was to be abolished , and the virtues springing from it were not to be . Every inch of the existence of [mankind]322-mankind , from birth to death , was to be a bargain across a counter . And if [we]2611-we did n’t get to [Heaven]80-heaven that way , it was not [a politico - economical place]2612-a politico - economical place , and [we]2611-we had no business [there]412-there . ‘ [I]77-bitzer do n’t deny , ’[77-bitzer] added [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ‘ that [my]77-bitzer schooling was cheap . But that comes right , [sir]2713-sir . [I]77-bitzer was made in the cheapest market , and have to dispose of [myself]77-bitzer in the dearest . ’[77-bitzer] [He]77-bitzer was a little troubled here , by [Louisa]218-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy crying . ‘ Pray do n’t do that , ’[77-bitzer] said [he]77-bitzer , ‘ it ’s of no use doing that : it only worries . [You]5093-you seem to think that [I]77-bitzer have some animosity against [young Mr. Tom]75-tom ; whereas [I]77-bitzer have none at all . [I]77-bitzer am only going , on the reasonable grounds [I]77-bitzer have mentioned , to take [him]75-tom back to [Coketown]4-coketown . If [he]75-tom was to resist , [I]77-bitzer should set up the cry of [Stop thief]5094-stop thief ! But , [he]75-tom wo n’t resist , [you]5093-you may depend upon it . ’[77-bitzer] [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , who with [his]87-mr. sleary mouth open and [his]87-mr. sleary rolling eye as immovably jammed in [his]87-mr. sleary head as [his]87-mr. sleary fixed one , had listened to these doctrines with profound attention , here stepped forward . ‘ [Thquire]115-thquire , [you]5093-you know perfectly well , and [[your]5093-you daughter]4670-your daughter knowth perfectly well ( better than [you]5093-you , becauthe [I]218-louisa thed it to [her]4670-your daughter ) , that [I]218-louisa did n’t know what [your]5093-you thon had done , and that [I]218-louisa did n’t want to know — [I]218-louisa thed it wath better not , though [I]218-louisa only thought , then , it wath thome thkylarking . However , [thith young man]5096-thith young man having made it known to be a robbery of [a bank]5097-a bank , why , that’h a theriouth thing ; muth too theriouth a thing for [me]218-louisa to compound , ath [thith]5096-thith young man [young man]3023-young man hath very properly called it . Conthequently , [Thquire]115-thquire , [you]5093-you muthn’t quarrel with [me]218-louisa if [I]218-louisa take [thith young man’th thide]5099-thith young man’th thide , and [thay]5099-thith young man’th thide [he’th]5099-thith young man’th thide right and there’th no help for it . But [I]218-louisa tell [you]5093-you what [I]218-louisa ’ll do , [Thquire]115-thquire ; [I]218-louisa ’ll drive [[your]5093-you thon]5100-your thon and [thith young man]5096-thith young man over to the rail , and prevent expothure here . [I]218-louisa ca n’t conthent to do more , but [I]218-louisa ’ll do that . ’[218-louisa] Fresh lamentations from [Louisa]218-louisa , and deeper affliction on [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa ’s part , followed this desertion of [them]2614-them by [[their]2614-them last friend]2615-their last friend . But , [Sissy]76-sissy glanced at [him]218-louisa with great attention ; nor did [she]76-sissy in [her]76-sissy own breast misunderstand [him]218-louisa . As [they]2614-them were all going out again , [he]218-louisa favoured [her]76-sissy with one slight roll of [his]218-louisa movable eye , desiring [her]76-sissy to linger behind . As [he]218-louisa locked the door , [he]218-louisa said excitedly : ‘ The Thquire thtood by [you]76-sissy , [Thethilia]117-thethilia , and [I]218-louisa ’ll thtand by [the Thquire]3100-the thquire . More than that : [thith]5103-thith ith a prethiouth rathcal , and belongth to that bluthtering Cove that [[my]218-louisa people]552-my people nearly pitht out o ’[218-louisa] winder . It ’ll be a dark night ; [I]0-i ’ve got a horthe that ’ll do anything but thpeak ; [I]0-i ’ve got a pony that ’ll go fifteen mile an hour with [Childerth]221-childerth driving of [him]218-louisa ; [I]0-i ’ve got a dog that ’ll keep [a man]3830-a man to one plathe four - and - twenty hourth . Get a word with [the young Thquire]2617-the young thquire . Tell [him]2617-the young thquire , when [he]2617-the young thquire theeth [our]2618-our horthe begin to danthe , not to be afraid of being thpilt , but to look out for a pony - gig coming up . Tell [him]2617-the young thquire , when [he]2617-the young thquire theeth that gig clothe by , to jump down , and it ’ll take [him]2617-the young thquire off at a rattling pathe . If [[my]0-i dog]2619-my dog leth [thith]2620-thith [young man]3023-young man thtir a peg on foot , [I]0-i give [him]2617-the young thquire leave to go . And if [my]0-i horthe ever thtirth from [that thpot where [he]2617-the young thquire beginth a danthing]2622-that thpot where he beginth a danthing , till the morning — [I]0-i do n’t know him?—Tharp’th the word ! ’ The word was so sharp , that in ten minutes [Mr. Childers]107-mr. childers , sauntering about [the market - place]5000-the market - place in a pair of slippers , had [his]107-mr. childers cue , and [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary ’s equipage was ready . It was a fine sight , to behold the learned dog barking round it , and [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary instructing [him]107-mr. childers , with [his]107-mr. childers one practicable eye , that [Bitzer]77-bitzer was the object of [his]107-mr. childers particular attentions . Soon after dark [they]5106-they [all three]4977-all three got in and started ; the learned dog ( a formidable creature ) already pinning [Bitzer]77-bitzer with [his]107-mr. childers eye , and sticking close to the wheel on [his]107-mr. childers side , that [he]77-bitzer might be ready for [him]77-bitzer in the event of [his]107-mr. childers showing the slightest disposition to alight . [The other three]5108-the other three sat up at [the inn]5109-the inn all night in great suspense . At eight o’clock in the morning [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary and the dog reappeared : [both in high spirits]5110-both in high spirits . ‘[115-thquire] All right , [Thquire]115-thquire ! ’ said [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , ‘[115-thquire] [your]115-thquire thon may be aboard - a - thip by thith time . [Childerth]221-childerth took [him]221-childerth off , an hour and a half after [we]2623-we left [there]412-there latht night . [The horthe]2625-the horthe danthed the polka till [he]2625-the horthe wath dead beat ( [he]2625-the horthe would have walthed if [he]2625-the horthe had n’t been in harneth ) , and then [I]0-i gave [him]2625-the horthe the word and [he]2625-the horthe went to thleep comfortable . When that prethiouth young [Rathcal]228-rathcal thed [he]2625-the horthe ’d go for’ard afoot , the dog hung on to hith neck - hankercher with all four legth in the air and pulled [him]2625-the horthe down and rolled [him]2625-the horthe over . Tho [he]2625-the horthe come back into the drag , and there [he]2625-the horthe that , ’ till [I]2625-the horthe turned the horthe’th head , at half - patht thixth thith morning . ’[2625-the horthe] [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa overwhelmed [him]2625-the horthe with thanks , of course ; and hinted as delicately as [he]218-louisa could , at a handsome remuneration in money . ‘ [I]218-louisa do n’t want money mythelf , [Thquire]115-thquire ; but [Childerth]221-childerth ith [a family man]5111-a family man , and if [you]2626-you wath to like to offer [him]221-childerth a five - pound note , it might n’t be unactheptable . Likewithe if [you]2626-you wath to thtand a collar for the dog , or a thet of bellth for [the horthe]2625-the horthe , [I]218-louisa thould be very glad to take [’em]5113-’em[218-louisa] . Brandy and water [I]0-i alwayth take . ’ [He]218-louisa had already called for a glass , and now called for another . ‘[218-louisa] If [you]2626-you would n’t think it going too far , [Thquire]115-thquire , to make a little thpread for the company at about three and thixth ahead , not reckoning [Luth]229-luth , it would make [’em]5114-’em happy . ’[229-luth] All these little tokens of [his]218-louisa gratitude , [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa very willingly undertook to render . Though [he]218-louisa thought them far too slight , [he]218-louisa said , for such a service . ‘ Very well , [Thquire]115-thquire ; then , if [you]2626-you ’ll only give a Horthe - riding , a bethpeak , whenever [you]2626-you can , [you]2626-you ’ll more than balanthe the account . Now , [Thquire]115-thquire , if [[your]2626-you daughter]4670-your daughter will ethcuthe [me]218-louisa , [I]218-louisa thould like one parting word with [you]2626-you . ’[218-louisa] [Louisa]218-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy withdrew into [an adjoining room]2627-an adjoining room ; [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , stirring and drinking [his]87-mr. sleary brandy and water as [he]87-mr. sleary stood , went on : ‘ [Thquire,—you]115-thquire do n’t need to be told that dogth ith wonderful animalth . ’[87-mr. sleary] ‘ [Their]5116-their instinct , ’[218-louisa] said [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa , ‘ is surprising . ’[218-louisa] ‘ Whatever [you]2626-you call it — and [I]87-mr. sleary ’m[87-mr. sleary] bletht if _ [I]0-i _ know what to call [it’—said Sleary]87-mr. sleary , ‘ it ith athtonithing . The way in whith a dog’ll find [you]2626-you — the dithtanthe [he]5117-he ’ll come ! ’[87-mr. sleary] ‘ [His]5117-he scent , ’[218-louisa] said [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa , ‘ being so fine . ’[218-louisa] ‘ [I]87-mr. sleary ’m[87-mr. sleary] bletht if [I]0-i know what to call it , ’ repeated [Sleary]87-mr. sleary , shaking [his]87-mr. sleary head , ‘[0-i] but [I]0-i have had dogth find [me]0-i , [Thquire]115-thquire , in a way that made [me]0-i think whether that dog had n’t gone to another dog , and thed , “ [You]0-i do n’t happen to know [a perthon of the name of [Thleary]65-thleary]2628-a perthon of the name of thleary , do [you]0-i ? O yeth , to be thure ! [A friend of [mine]0-i]2630-a friend of mine menthioned [him]65-thleary to [me]0-i at one time . [I]0-i can get [you]0-i hith [addreth]230-addreth directly . ” In conthequenth of [my]0-i being afore [the public]255-the public , and going about tho muth , [you]0-i [thee]0-i , there mutht be a number of dogth acquainted with [me]0-i , [Thquire]115-thquire , that _ [I]0-i _ do n’t know ! ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa seemed to be quite confounded by this speculation . ‘[0-i] Any way , ’ said [Sleary]87-mr. sleary , after putting [his]87-mr. sleary lips to [his]87-mr. sleary brandy and water , ‘[0-i] ith fourteen month ago , [Thquire]115-thquire , thinthe [we]2632-our wath at [Chethter]67-chethter . [We]2632-our wath getting up [[our]2632-our Children]2527-our children in [the Wood]68-the wood one morning , when there cometh into [our]2632-our Ring , by the thtage door , a dog . [He]2634-he had travelled a long way , [he]2634-he wath in [a very bad condithon]2635-a very bad condithon , [he]2634-he wath lame , and pretty well blind . [He]2634-he went round to [[our]2632-our children]2527-our children , one after another , as if [he]2634-he wath a theeking for [a child [he]2634-he know’d]2637-a child he know’d ; and then [he]2634-he come to [me]0-i , and throwd hithelf up behind , and thtood on hith two forelegth , weak ath [he]2634-he wath , and then [he]2634-he wagged hith tail and died . Thquire , that dog wath [Merrylegth]231-merrylegth . ’ ‘[231-merrylegth] [[Sissy]76-sissy ’s father]2638-sissy ’s father ’s dog ! ’ ‘[231-merrylegth] Thethilia’th father’th old dog . Now , [Thquire]115-thquire , [I]0-i can take [my]0-i oath , from [my]0-i knowledge of that dog , that [that man]3019-that man wath dead — and buried — afore that dog come back to [me]0-i . [Joth’phine]119-joth’phine and [Childerth]221-childerth and [me]0-i talked it over a long time , whether [I]0-i thould write or not . But [we]2640-we agreed , “ No . There’th nothing comfortable to tell ; why unthettle [her]2637-a child he know’d mind , and make [her]2637-a child he know’d unhappy ? ” Tho , whether [[her]2637-a child he know’d father]335-her father bathely detherted [her]2637-a child he know’d ; or whether [he]335-her father broke [hith]2637-a child he know’d own heart alone , rather than pull [her]2637-a child he know’d down along with [him]335-her father ; never will be known , now , Thquire , till — no , not till [we]2640-we know how [the dogth]2642-the dogth findth uth out ! ’ ‘[2637-a child he know’d] [She]2637-a child he know’d keeps the bottle that [he]335-her father sent [her]2637-a child he know’d for , to this hour ; and [she]2637-a child he know’d will believe in [his]335-her father affection to the last moment of [her]2637-a child he know’d life , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa . ‘[2637-a child he know’d] It theemth to prethent two thingth to [a perthon]2643-a perthon , do n’t it , Thquire ? ’ said [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , musing as [he]87-mr. sleary looked down into the depths of [his]87-mr. sleary brandy and water : ‘[2637-a child he know’d] one , that there ith a love in [the world]2766-the world , not all Thelf - interetht after all , but thomething very different ; t’other , that it hath a way of ith own of calculating or not calculating , whith thomehow or another ith at leatht ath hard to give a name to , ath the wayth of the dogth ith ! ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]218-louisa looked out of window , and made no reply . [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary emptied [his]87-mr. sleary glass and recalled [the ladies]5118-the ladies . ‘[0-i] Thethilia [[my]0-i dear]3090-my dear , kith [me]0-i and good - bye ! [Mith]2646-mith Thquire , to [thee]3090-my dear [you]3090-my dear treating of [her]2637-a child he know’d like a thithter , and a thithter that [you]3090-my dear trutht and honour with all [your]3090-my dear heart and more , ith a very pretty thight to [me]0-i . [I]0-i hope [[your]3090-my dear brother]3871-your brother may live to be better detherving of [you]3090-my dear , and a greater comfort to [you]3090-my dear . [Thquire]115-thquire , thake handth , firtht and latht ! Do n’t be croth with [uth]2648-uth poor vagabondth . [People]300-people mutht be amuthed . [They]300-people ca n’t be alwayth a learning , nor yet [they]300-people ca n’t be alwayth a working , [they]300-people an’t made for it . [You]3090-my dear _ mutht _ have uth , [Thquire]115-thquire . Do the withe thing and the kind thing too , and make the betht of uth ; not the wurtht ! ’ ‘[0-i] And [I]0-i never thought before , ’ said [Mr. Sleary]87-mr. sleary , putting [his]87-mr. sleary head in at the door again to say it , ‘[0-i] that [I]0-i wath tho muth of [a Cackler]3012-a cackler ! ’ CHAPTER IX FINAL IT is a dangerous thing to see anything in the sphere of [a vain blusterer]5119-a vain blusterer , before [the vain blusterer]5120-the vain blusterer sees it [himself]5120-the vain blusterer . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby felt that [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby had audaciously anticipated [him]92-mr. bounderby , and presumed to be wiser than [he]92-mr. bounderby . Inappeasably indignant with [her]2651-her for [her]2651-her triumphant discovery of [Mrs. Pegler]179-mrs. pegler , [he]92-mr. bounderby turned this presumption , on the part of [a woman in [her]2651-her dependent position]5121-a woman in her dependent position , over and over in [his]92-mr. bounderby mind , until it accumulated with turning like a great snowball . At last [he]92-mr. bounderby made the discovery that to discharge [this highly connected female]5122-this highly connected female — to have it in [his]92-mr. bounderby power to say , ‘[2651-her] [She]2651-her was [a woman of family]2652-a woman of family , and wanted to stick to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i would n’t have it , and got rid of [her’—would]2653-her’—would be to get the utmost possible amount of crowning glory out of the connection , and at the same time to punish [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby according to [her]2651-her deserts . Filled fuller than ever , with this great idea , [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby came in to lunch , and sat [himself]92-mr. bounderby down in [the dining - room of former days]2654-the dining - room of former days , where [his]92-mr. bounderby portrait was . [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby sat by the fire , with [her]2651-her foot in [her]2651-her cotton stirrup , little thinking whither [she]2651-her was posting . Since the [Pegler]179-mrs. pegler affair , [this gentlewoman]2655-this gentlewoman had covered [her]2651-her pity for [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby with a veil of quiet melancholy and contrition . In virtue thereof , it had become [her]2651-her habit to assume a woful look , which woful look [she]2651-her now bestowed upon [[her]2651-her patron]3087-her patron . ‘ What ’s the matter now , [ma’am]350-ma’am ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , in a very short , rough way . ‘ Pray , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] returned [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ do not bite [my]92-mr. bounderby nose off . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Bite [your]350-ma’am nose off , [ma’am]350-ma’am ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] repeated [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ _ [Your]350-ma’am _ nose ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] meaning , as [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby conceived , that it was too developed a nose for the purpose . After which offensive implication , [he]92-mr. bounderby cut [himself]92-mr. bounderby a crust of bread , and threw the knife down with a noise . [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby took [her]2651-her foot out of [her]2651-her stirrup , and said , ‘ [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , [sir]2713-sir ! ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Well , [ma’am]350-ma’am ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] retorted [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ What are [you]350-ma’am staring at ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ May [I]92-mr. bounderby ask , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ have [you]2713-sir been ruffled this morning ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Yes , [ma’am]350-ma’am . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ May [I]92-mr. bounderby inquire , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] pursued [the injured woman]2657-the injured woman , ‘ whether _ [I]92-mr. bounderby _ am the unfortunate cause of [your]2713-sir having lost [your]2713-sir temper ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Now , [I]92-mr. bounderby ’ll tell [you]350-ma’am what , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , ‘ [I]92-mr. bounderby am not come here to be bullied . [A female]5132-a female may be highly connected , but [she]5132-a female ca n’t be permitted to bother and badger [a man in [my]92-mr. bounderby position]5133-a man in my position , and [I]92-mr. bounderby am not going to put up with it . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ( [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby felt it necessary to get on : foreseeing that if [he]92-mr. bounderby allowed of details , [he]92-mr. bounderby would be beaten . ) [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby first elevated , then knitted , [her]2657-the injured woman Coriolanian eyebrows ; gathered up [her]2657-the injured woman work into its proper basket ; and rose . ‘ [Sir]2713-sir , ’[2657-the injured woman] said [she]2657-the injured woman , majestically . ‘ It is apparent to [me]2657-the injured woman that [I]2657-the injured woman am in [your]2713-sir way at present . [I]2657-the injured woman will retire to [[my]2657-the injured woman own apartment]5135-my own apartment . ’[2657-the injured woman] ‘ Allow [me]92-mr. bounderby to open the door , [ma’am]350-ma’am . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Thank [you]2713-sir , [sir]2713-sir ; [I]2657-the injured woman can do it for [myself]2657-the injured woman . ’[2657-the injured woman] ‘ [You]2657-the injured woman had better allow [me]92-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , passing [her]2657-the injured woman , and getting [his]92-mr. bounderby hand upon the lock ; ‘ because [I]92-mr. bounderby can take the opportunity of saying a word to [you]2657-the injured woman , before [you]2657-the injured woman go . [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]350-ma’am , [I]92-mr. bounderby rather think [you]350-ma’am are cramped [here]354-here , do [you]350-ma’am know ? It appears to [me]92-mr. bounderby , that , under [my]92-mr. bounderby humble roof , there ’s hardly opening enough for [a lady of [your]2657-the injured woman genius]5141-a lady of your genius in [other people]4887-other people ’s affairs . ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby gave [him]92-mr. bounderby a look of the darkest scorn , and said with great politeness , ‘ Really , [sir]2713-sir ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ [I]92-mr. bounderby have been thinking it over , [you]350-ma’am see , since the late affairs have happened , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ; ‘ and it appears to [my]92-mr. bounderby poor judgment — ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Oh ! Pray , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby interposed , with sprightly cheerfulness , ‘ do n’t disparage [your]2713-sir judgment . [Everybody]391-everybody knows how unerring [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby ’s judgment is . [Everybody]391-everybody has had proofs of it . It must be the theme of general conversation . Disparage anything in [yourself]2713-sir but [your]2713-sir judgment , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , laughing . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , very red and uncomfortable , resumed : ‘ It appears to [me]92-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]350-ma’am , [I]92-mr. bounderby say , that a different sort of establishment altogether would bring out [a lady of _ [your]2713-sir _ powers]5150-a lady of _ your _ powers . Such an establishment as [[your]2713-sir relation]5151-your relation , [Lady Scadgers]122-lady scadgers ’s , now . Do n’t [you]350-ma’am think [you]350-ma’am might find some affairs there , [ma’am]350-ma’am , to interfere with ? ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ It never occurred to [me]92-mr. bounderby before , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] returned [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby ; ‘ but now [you]2713-sir mention it , should think it highly probable . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Then suppose [you]350-ma’am try , [ma’am]350-ma’am , ’[92-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , laying an envelope with a cheque in it in [her]2658-her little basket . ‘ [You]350-ma’am can take [your]350-ma’am own time for going , [ma’am]350-ma’am ; but perhaps in the meanwhile , it will be more agreeable to [a lady of [your]350-ma’am powers of mind]5156-a lady of your powers of mind , to eat [her]5156-a lady of your powers of mind meals by [herself]5156-a lady of your powers of mind , and not to be intruded upon . [I]92-mr. bounderby really ought to apologise to [you]2713-sir — being only [[Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown]388-josiah bounderby of coketown — for having stood in [your]2713-sir light so long . ’[92-mr. bounderby] ‘ Pray do n’t name it , [sir]2713-sir , ’[92-mr. bounderby] returned [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby . ‘ If that portrait could speak , [sir]2713-sir — but it has the advantage over the original of not possessing the power of committing [itself]5160-itself and disgusting [others,—it]5161-others,—it would testify , that a long period has elapsed since [I]92-mr. bounderby first habitually addressed it as the picture of [a Noodle]5162-a noodle . Nothing that [a Noodle]5162-a noodle does , can awaken surprise or indignation ; the proceedings of [a Noodle]5162-a noodle can only inspire contempt . ’[92-mr. bounderby] Thus saying , [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby , with [her]2659-her Roman features like a medal struck to commemorate [her]2659-her scorn of [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby , surveyed [him]92-mr. bounderby fixedly from head to foot , swept disdainfully past [him]92-mr. bounderby , and ascended [the staircase]2660-the staircase . [Mr. Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby closed the door , and stood before the fire ; projecting [himself]92-mr. bounderby after [his]92-mr. bounderby old explosive manner into [his]92-mr. bounderby portrait — and into futurity . * * * * * Into how much of futurity ? [He]92-mr. bounderby saw [Mrs. Sparsit]92-mr. bounderby fighting out a daily fight at the points of all the weapons in [the female armoury]2661-the female armoury , with the grudging , smarting , peevish , tormenting [Lady Scadgers]122-lady scadgers , still laid up in bed with [her]122-lady scadgers mysterious leg , and gobbling [her]122-lady scadgers insufficient income down by about the middle of every quarter , in [a mean little airless lodging]2662-a mean little airless lodging , a mere closet for one , a mere crib for two ; but did [he]92-mr. bounderby see more ? Did [he]92-mr. bounderby catch any glimpse of [himself]92-mr. bounderby making a show of [Bitzer]77-bitzer to [strangers]603-strangers , as [the rising young man]2664-the rising young man , so devoted to [[his]92-mr. bounderby master]2665-his master ’s great merits , who had won young [Tom]75-tom ’s place , and had almost captured [young Tom]75-tom [himself]92-mr. bounderby , in the times when by various rascals [he]92-mr. bounderby was spirited away ? Did [he]92-mr. bounderby see any faint reflection of [his]92-mr. bounderby own image making a vain - glorious will , whereby [five - and - twenty Humbugs]2666-five - and - twenty humbugs , past five - and - fifty years of age , each taking upon [himself]92-mr. bounderby the name , [[Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown]388-josiah bounderby of coketown , should for ever dine in [Bounderby Hall]69-bounderby hall , for ever lodge in [[Bounderby]92-mr. bounderby buildings]2668-bounderby buildings , for ever attend [a Bounderby chapel]2669-a bounderby chapel , for ever go to sleep under [a Bounderby chaplain]2670-a bounderby chaplain , for ever be supported out of [a Bounderby estate]2671-a bounderby estate , and for ever nauseate all healthy stomachs , with a vast amount of [Bounderby balderdash]96-josiah bounderby and bluster ? Had [he]92-mr. bounderby any prescience of the day , five years to come , when [Josiah Bounderby]96-josiah bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown was to die of a fit in [the Coketown street]2672-the coketown street , and this same precious will was to begin [its]2673-its long career of quibble , plunder , false pretences , vile example , little service and much law ? Probably not . Yet the portrait was to see it all out . [Here]354-here was [Mr. Gradgrind]75-tom on the same day , and in the same hour , sitting thoughtful in [[his]75-tom own room]2675-his own room . How much of futurity did _ [he]92-mr. bounderby _ see ? Did [he]92-mr. bounderby see [himself]92-mr. bounderby , [a white - haired decrepit man]2676-a white - haired decrepit man , bending [his]92-mr. bounderby hitherto inflexible theories to appointed circumstances ; making [his]92-mr. bounderby facts and figures subservient to Faith , Hope , and Charity ; and no longer trying to grind that Heavenly trio in [[his]92-mr. bounderby dusty little mills]2677-his dusty little mills ? Did [he]92-mr. bounderby catch sight of [himself]92-mr. bounderby , therefore much despised by [[his]92-mr. bounderby late political associates]2678-his late political associates ? Did [he]92-mr. bounderby see [them]2678-his late political associates , in the era of its being quite settled that [the national dustmen]1996-the national dustmen have only to do with [one another]2898-one another , and owe no duty to an abstraction called [a People]2681-a people , ‘ taunting [the honourable gentleman]5165-the honourable gentleman ’[92-mr. bounderby] with this and with that and with what not , five nights a - week , until the small hours of the morning ? Probably [he]92-mr. bounderby had that much foreknowledge , knowing [[his]92-mr. bounderby men]2682-his men . * * * * * Here was [Louisa]218-louisa on the night of the same day , watching the fire as in days of yore , though with a gentler and a humbler face . How much of the future might arise before _ [her]2683-her _ vision ? Broadsides in [the streets]2931-the streets , signed with [[her]2683-her father]335-her father ’s name , exonerating [the late Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen , [weaver]2194-weaver , from misplaced suspicion , and publishing the guilt of [[his]137-stephen own son]2687-his own son , with such extenuation as [his]137-stephen years and temptation ( [he]137-stephen could not bring [himself]137-stephen to add , [his]137-stephen education ) might beseech ; were of the Present . So , [Stephen Blackpool]137-stephen ’s tombstone , with [[her]2683-her father]335-her father ’s record of [his]137-stephen death , was almost of the Present , for [she]2683-her knew it was to be . These things [she]2683-her could plainly see . But , how much of the Future ? [A working woman]998-a working woman , christened [Rachael]140-rachael , after a long illness once again appearing at the ringing of the Factory bell , and passing to and fro at the set hours , among [the Coketown Hands]145-the coketown hands ; [a woman of pensive beauty , always dressed in black , but sweet - tempered and serene , and even cheerful]2690-a woman of pensive beauty , always dressed in black , but sweet - tempered and serene , and even cheerful ; who , of [all the people in [the place]329-the place]2691-all the people in the place , alone appeared to have compassion on [a degraded , drunken wretch of [her]2683-her own sex]2693-a degraded , drunken wretch of her own sex , who was sometimes seen in [the town]317-the town secretly begging of [her]2683-her , and crying to [her]2683-her ; a woman working , ever working , but content to do it , and preferring to do it as [her]2683-her natural lot , until [she]2683-her should be too old to labour any more ? Did [Louisa]218-louisa see this ? Such a thing was to be . [A lonely brother]2695-a lonely brother , many thousands of miles away , writing , on paper blotted with tears , that [her]2683-her words had too soon come true , and that all the treasures in [the world]2766-the world would be cheaply bartered for a sight of [her]2683-her dear face ? At length [this brother]2697-this brother coming nearer [home]336-home , with hope of seeing [her]2683-her , and being delayed by illness ; and then a letter , in a strange hand , saying ‘ [he]2695-a lonely brother died in [hospital]5166-hospital , of fever , such a day , and died in penitence and love of [you]218-louisa : [his]2695-a lonely brother last word being [your]218-louisa name ’[218-louisa] ? Did [Louisa]218-louisa see these things ? Such things were to be . [Herself]218-louisa again [a wife]3734-a wife — [a mother]553-a mother — lovingly watchful of [[her]3734-a wife children]398-her children , ever careful that [they]398-her children should have a childhood of the mind no less than a childhood of the body , as knowing it to be even a more beautiful thing , and a possession , any hoarded scrap of which , is a blessing and happiness to [the wisest]2702-the wisest ? Did [Louisa]218-louisa see this ? Such a thing was never to be . But , [happy [Sissy]76-sissy ’s happy children]2703-happy sissy ’s happy children loving [her]76-sissy ; [all children]2704-all children loving [her]76-sissy ; [she]76-sissy , grown learned in childish lore ; thinking no innocent and pretty fancy ever to be despised ; trying hard to know [her]76-sissy humbler fellow - creatures , and to beautify [their]398-her children lives of machinery and reality with those imaginative graces and delights , without which the heart of infancy will wither up , the sturdiest physical manhood will be morally stark death , and [the plainest national prosperity figures]2705-the plainest national prosperity figures can show , will be the Writing on the Wall,—she holding this course as part of no fantastic vow , or bond , or brotherhood , or sisterhood , or pledge , or covenant , or fancy dress , or fancy fair ; but simply as a duty to be done,—did [Louisa]218-louisa see these things of [herself]218-louisa ? These things were to be . [Dear reader]2706-dear reader ! It rests with [you]2706-dear reader and [me]0-i , whether , in [our]2707-our two fields of action , similar things shall be or not . Let them be ! [We]2707-our shall sit with lighter bosoms on the hearth , to see the ashes of [our]2707-our fires turn gray and cold .
